 32412                                  ;Break  <BUFSEC -- BUFFER A SECTOR AND SET UP A TRANSFER>
 32413                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32414                                  ;
 32415                                  ; Procedure Name : BUFSEC
 32416                                  ;
 32417                                  ; Inputs:
 32418                                  ;       AH = priority of buffer
 32419                                  ;       AL = 0 if buffer must be read, 1 if no pre-read needed
 32420                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 32421                                  ;       [CLUSNUM] = Physical cluster number
 32422                                  ;       [SECCLUSPOS] = Sector position of transfer within cluster
 32423                                  ;       [BYTCNT1] = Size of transfer
 32424                                  ; Function:
 32425                                  ;       Insure specified sector is in buffer, flushing buffer before
 32426                                  ;       read if necessary.
 32427                                  ; Outputs:
 32428                                  ;       ES:DI = Pointer to buffer
 32429                                  ;       SI = Pointer to transfer address
 32430                                  ;       CX = Number of bytes
 32431                                  ;       [NEXTADD] updated
 32432                                  ;       [TRANS] set to indicate a transfer will occur
 32433                                  ;       Carry set if error (user FAILed to I 24)
 32434                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32435                                  
 32436                                  	; 25/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 32437                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:98C2h
 32438                                  
 32439                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8BF1h) - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1)
 32440                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8C2Ch) - Retro DOS v4.2
 32441                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0BE33h)
 32442                                  
 32443                                  BUFSEC:
 32444                                  	; 25/02/2024
 32445                                  	;;;
 32446                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 32447 00005451 8B16[DE0A]              	mov	dx,[CLUSNUM_HW]
 32448                                  	;mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],dx
 32449 00005455 8716[E80A]              	xchg	dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 32450 00005459 52                      	push	dx	; [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 32451                                  	;;;
 32452 0000545A 8B16[BC05]                      MOV     DX,[CLUSNUM]
 32453 0000545E 8A1E[7305]                      MOV     BL,[SECCLUSPOS]
 32454                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],38h
 32455 00005462 C606[4B03]38                    MOV     byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY+Allowed_IGNORE
 32456 00005467 E89A01                          CALL    FIGREC
 32457 0000546A E81F11                  	call	GETBUFFR
 32458                                  	; 25/02/2024
 32459                                  	;;;
 32460 0000546D 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 32461                                  	;;;
 32462 00005471 72DD                            jc	short fndclus_retn
 32463                                  
 32464 00005473 C606[7405]01                    MOV     BYTE [TRANS],1	; A transfer is taking place
 32465 00005478 8B36[B805]                      MOV     SI,[NEXTADD]
 32466 0000547C 89F7                            MOV     DI,SI
 32467 0000547E 8B0E[D205]                      MOV     CX,[BYTCNT1]
 32468 00005482 01CF                            ADD     DI,CX
 32469 00005484 893E[B805]                      MOV     [NEXTADD],DI
 32470 00005488 C43E[E205]                      LES     DI,[CURBUF]
 32471                                  	;or	byte [es:di+5],8
 32472 0000548C 26804D0508                      OR      byte [ES:DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_isDATA
 32473                                  	;;;lea	di,[di+16] ; MSDOS 3.3 
 32474                                  	;;lea	di,[di+20] ; MSDOS 6.0
 32475                                          ;lea	di,[di+24] ; PCDOS 7.1  ; 25/02/2024
 32476 00005491 8D7D18                  	LEA     DI,[DI+BUFINSIZ]        ; Point to buffer
 32477 00005494 033E[CC05]                      ADD     DI,[BYTSECPOS]
 32478 00005498 F8                              CLC	; (not necessary!?) ; 25/02/2024
 32479 00005499 C3                              retn
 32480                                  
 32481                                  ;Break   <BUFRD, BUFWRT -- PERFORM BUFFERED READ AND WRITE>
 32482                                  
 32483                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32484                                  ;
 32485                                  ; Procedure Name : BUFRD
 32486                                  ;
 32487                                  ; Do a partial sector read via one of the system buffers
 32488                                  ; ES:BP Points to DPB
 32489                                  ; Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 32490                                  ;
 32491                                  ; DS - set to DOSDATA
 32492                                  ;
 32493                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32494                                  
 32495                                  	; 25/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 32496                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32497                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32498                                  BUFRD:
 32499 0000549A 06                              PUSH	ES
 32500 0000549B 31C0                            xor	ax,ax			; pre-read sector
 32501 0000549D E8B1FF                          CALL    BUFSEC
 32502 000054A0 7303                            JNC	short BUF_OK ; ds=ss
 32503                                  
 32504                                  BUF_IO_FAIL:				; this label used by BUFWRT also
 32505 000054A2 07                              POP	ES
 32506 000054A3 EB2D                            JMP     SHORT RBUFPLACED ; ds=ss
 32507                                  
 32508                                  BUF_OK:
 32509 000054A5 8CC3                            MOV     BX,ES
 32510 000054A7 8E06[2E03]                      MOV     ES,[DMAADD+2]
 32511 000054AB 8EDB                            MOV     DS,BX
 32512 000054AD 87F7                    	XCHG    DI,SI
 32513 000054AF D1E9                            SHR     CX,1
 32514                                  ;M039
 32515                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 32516                                  	;JNC	short EVENRD
 32517                                  	;MOVSB
 32518                                  ;EVENRD:
 32519                                  	;REP     MOVSW
 32520                                  
 32521                                  ;	CX = # of whole WORDs ; CF=1 if odd # of bytes.
 32522                                  ;       DS:SI-> Source within Buffer.
 32523                                  ;       ES:DI-> Destination within Transfer memory block.
 32524                                  
 32525                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32526 000054B1 F3A5                    	rep	movsw			;Copy Buffer to Transfer memory.
 32527                                  	;adc	cx,0                    ;CX=1 if odd # of bytes, else CX=0.
 32528                                  	;rep	movsb                   ;Copy last byte.
 32529                                  	; 16/12/2022
 32530 000054B3 7301                    	jnc	short EVENRD ; **** 20/05/2019
 32531 000054B5 A4                      	movsb ; ****
 32532                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 32533                                  	;adc	cx,0
 32534                                  	;rep	movsb
 32535                                  ;M039
 32536                                  EVENRD: ; ****

 32541                                  	;;lea	bx,[di+20] ; MSDOS 6.0
 32542                                  	;lea	bx,[di+24] ; PCDOS 7.1	; 25/02/2024

 32548 000054C8 7205                            JB	short RBUFPLACEDC ; ds<>ss ; No, leave buf where it is
 32549                                  ;M039
 32550                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 32551                                  	;call	PLACEHEAD               ; Make it prime candidate for chucking
 32552                                                                          ;  even though it is MRU.
 32553                                          ; MSDOS 6.0
 32554 000054CA 36893E[6D00]            	MOV	[ss:BufferQueue],DI	; Make it prime candidate for
 32555                                  ;M039					; chucking even though it is MRU.
 32556                                  
 32557                                  RBUFPLACEDC:
 32558 000054CF F8                              CLC
 32559                                  ;RBUFPLACED:
 32560 000054D0 16                      	push	ss
 32561 000054D1 1F                      	pop	ds
 32562                                  RBUFPLACED:	; 25/02/2024 (ds=ss)
 32563 000054D2 C3                              retn

 32757                                  ;Break	<OPTIMIZE -- DO A USER DISK REQUEST WELL>
 32758                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32759                                  ;
 32760                                  ; Procedure Name : OPTIMIZE
 32761                                  ;
 32762                                  ; Inputs:
 32763                                  ;	  BX = Physical cluster
 32764                                  ;	  CX = No. of records
 32765                                  ;	  DL = sector within cluster
 32766                                  ;	  ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 32767                                  ;	  [NEXTADD] = transfer address
 32768                                  ; Outputs:
 32769                                  ;	  AX = No. of records remaining
 32770                                  ;	  BX = Transfer address
 32771                                  ;	  CX = No. or records to be transferred
 32772                                  ;	  DX = Physical sector address (LOW)
 32773                                  ;	  [HIGH_SECTOR] = Physical sector address (HIGH)
 32774                                  ;	  DI = Next cluster
 32775                                  ;	  [CLUSNUM] = Last cluster accessed
 32776                                  ;	  [NEXTADD] updated
 32777                                  ;	  Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 32778                                  ; ES:BP unchanged. Note that segment of transfer not set.
 32779                                  ;
 32780                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32781                                  
 32782                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32783                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 32784                                  
 32785                                  OPTIMIZE:
 32786 00005575 52                      	PUSH	DX
 32787                                  	; 27/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 32788                                  	;;;
 32789 00005576 FF36[E80A]              	push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 32790                                  	;;;
 32791 0000557A 53                      	PUSH	BX
 32792                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+4]

 32794 0000557F FEC0                    	INC	AL		; Number of sectors per cluster
 32795 00005581 88C4                    	MOV	AH,AL

 32797 00005585 89CA                    	MOV	DX,CX
 32798                                  	;MOV	CX,0
 32799                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 32800                                  	; 16/12/2022
 32801 00005587 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx	; sub cx,cx
 32802                                  OPTCLUS:
 32803                                  ; AL has number of sectors available in current cluster
 32804                                  ; AH has number of sectors available in next cluster
 32805                                  ; BX has current physical cluster
 32806                                  ; CX has number of sequential sectors found so far
 32807                                  ; DX has number of sectors left to transfer
 32808                                  ; ES:BP Points to DPB
 32809                                  ; ES:SI has FAT pointer
 32810                                  
 32811                                  do_norm3:
 32812 00005589 E8B109                  	call	UNPACK
 32813 0000558C 7263                    	JC	short OP_ERR	; ds=ss ; 27/02/2024

 32826                                  	;add	bx,1

 33028                                  
 33029                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33030                                  ; DOSCODE:8DC2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 33031                                  
 33032                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 33033                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset
 33034                                  
 33035                                  ;Break   <ALLOCATE -- Assign disk space>
 33036                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33037                                  ;
 33038                                  ; Procedure Name : ALLOCATE - Allocate Disk Space
 33039                                  ;
 33040                                  ;   ALLOCATE is called to allocate disk clusters. The new clusters are
 33041                                  ;   FAT-chained onto the end of the existing file.
 33042                                  ;
 33043                                  ;   The DPB contains the cluster # of the last free cluster allocated
 33044                                  ;   (dpb_next_free). We start at this cluster and scan towards higher
 33045                                  ;   numbered clusters, looking for the necessary free blocks.
 33046                                  ;
 33047                                  ;   Once again, fancy terminology gets in the way of correct coding. When
 33048                                  ;   using next_free, start scanning AT THAT POINT and not the one following it.
 33049                                  ;   This fixes the boundary condition bug when only free = next_free = 2.
 33050                                  ;
 33051                                  ;       If we get to the end of the disk without satisfaction:
 33052                                  ;
 33053                                  ;           if (dpb_next_free == 2) then we've scanned the whole disk.
 33054                                  ;               return (insufficient_disk_space)
 33055                                  ;           ELSE
 33056                                  ;               dpb_next_free = 2; start scan over from the beginning.
 33057                                  ;
 33058                                  ;   Note that there is no multitasking interlock. There is no race when
 33059                                  ;   examining the entrys in an in-core FAT block since there will be no
 33060                                  ;   context switch. When UNPACK context switches while waiting for a FAT read
 33061                                  ;   we are done with any in-core FAT blocks, so again there is no race. The
 33062                                  ;   only special concern is that V2 and V3 MSDOS left the last allocated
 33063                                  ;   cluster as "00"; marking it EOF only when the entire alloc request was
 33064                                  ;   satisfied. We can't allow another activation to think this cluster is
 33065                                  ;   free, so we give it a special temporary mark to show that it is, indeed,
 33066                                  ;   allocated.
 33067                                  ;
 33068                                  ;   Note that when we run out of space this algorithem will scan from
 33069                                  ;   dpb_next_free to the end, then scan from cluster 2 through the end,
 33070                                  ;   redundantly scanning the later part of the disk. This only happens when
 33071                                  ;   we run out of space, so sue me.
 33072                                  ;
 33073                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 33074                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 33075                                  ;                                                                          ;
 33076                                  ;   The use of FATBYT and RESTFATBYT is somewhat mysterious. Here is the
 33077                                  ;   explanation:
 33078                                  ;
 33079                                  ;   In the NUL file case (sf_firclus currently 0) ALLOCATE is called with
 33080                                  ;   entry BX = 0. What needs to be done in this case is to stuff the cluster
 33081                                  ;   number of the first cluster allocated in sf_firclus when the ALLOCATE is
 33082                                  ;   complete. THIS VALUE IS SAVED TEMPORARILY IN CLUSTER 0, HENCE THE CURRENT
 33083                                  ;   VALUE IN CLUSTER 0 MUST BE SAVED AND RESTORED. This is a side effect of
 33084                                  ;   the fact that PACK and UNPACK don't treat requests for clusters 0 and 1 as
 33085                                  ;   errors. This "stuff" is done by the call to PACK which is right before
 33086                                  ;   the
 33087                                  ;           LOOP   findfre         ; alloc more if needed
 33088                                  ;   instruction when the first cluster is allocated to the nul file. The
 33089                                  ;   value is recalled from cluster 0 and stored at sf_firclus at ads4:
 33090                                  ;
 33091                                  ;   This method is obviously useless (because it is non-reentrant) for
 33092                                  ;   multitasking, and will have to be changed. Storing the required value on
 33093                                  ;   the stack is recommended. Setting sf_firclus at the PACK of cluster 0
 33094                                  ;   (instead of actually doing the PACK) is BAD because it doesn't handle
 33095                                  ;   problems with INT 24 well.
 33096                                  ;
 33097                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 33098                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 33099                                  ;                                                                          ;
 33100                                  ;       ENTRY   BX = Last cluster of file (0 if null file)
 33101                                  ;               CX = No. of clusters to allocate
 33102                                  ;               ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 33103                                  ;               [THISSFT] = Points to SFT
 33104                                  ;
 33105                                  ;       EXIT   'C' set if insufficient space
 33106                                  ;                [FAILERR] can be tested to see the reason for failure
 33107                                  ;                CX = max. no. of clusters that could be added to file
 33108                                  ;              'C' clear if space allocated
 33109                                  ;                BX = First cluster allocated
 33110                                  ;                FAT is fully updated
 33111                                  ;                sf_FIRCLUS field of SFT set if file was null
 33112                                  ;
 33113                                  ;       USES    ALL but SI, BP
 33114                                  
 33115                                  ;callmagic  proc near
 33116                                  ;       push    ds                             ;push segment of routine 
 33117                                  ;       push    Offset MagicPatch              ;push offset for routine
 33118                                  ;       retf                                   ;simulate jmp far
 33119                                  ;                                              ;far return address is on
 33120                                  ;                                              ;stack, so far return from
 33121                                  ;                                              ;call will return this routine
 33122                                  ;callmagic  endp
 33123                                  
 33124                                  ; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33125                                  ;PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9AC5h
 33126                                  
 33127                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8DC2h)
 33128                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C078h)
 33129                                  
 33130                                  ; 07/03/2025
 33131                                  ; 25/09/2023
 33132                                  %if 0	; 27/02/2024
 33133                                  callmagic:
 33134                                  	push	ds
 33135                                  	push	word [ss:OffsetMagicPatch]
 33136                                  	retf	
 33137                                  %endif
 33138                                  
 33139                                  ; 10/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33140                                  %if 1
 33141                                  ALLOCATE_X:
 33142 0000563C A3[F00A]                	mov	[CCOUNT_HW],ax
 33143                                  	;jmp	short ALLOCATE
 33144                                  %endif
 33145                                  
 33146                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33147                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9ACFh
 33148                                  
 33149                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8DC9h)
 33150                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C07Fh)
 33151                                  
 33152                                  ALLOCATE:
 33153                                  	; 10/09/2018
 33154                                  ;BEGIN MAGICDRV MODIFICATIONS
 33155                                  ;
 33156                                  ;7/5/92 scottq
 33157                                  ;
 33158                                  ;This is the disk compression patch location which allows
 33159                                  ;the disk compression software to fail allocations if the
 33160                                  ;FAT would allows allocation, but the free space for compressed
 33161                                  ;data would not.
 33162                                  ;        
 33163                                  ;;;	call    far ptr MAGICPATCH
 33164                                  ;;; We cannot do a far call since we cannot have fix-ups[romdos,hidos],
 33165                                  ;;; but we do know the segment and offset of the routine

 33171                                  	;				;if no patch is present

 33173                                          ;call	callmagic		;this is a near call
 33174                                          ;jnc	short Regular_Allocate_Path
 33175                                  	;jmp	Disk_Full_Return
 33176

 33179

 33189                                  %endif

 33192                                  ;END MAGICDRV MODIFICATIONS
 33193                                  
 33194                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 33195                                  	; DOSCODE:8D87h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 33196                                  
 33197                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 33223                                  %if 0
 33224                                          PUSH    CX

 33228                                  	;;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Ch]  ; MSDOS 3.3

 33236

 33244                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0

 33246                                  	;;;
 33247 00005660 FF36[F00A]              	push	word [CCOUNT_HW]
 33248 00005664 51                      	push	cx
 33249 00005665 FF36[E80A]              	push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33250 00005669 53                      	push	bx
 33251                                  
 33252 0000566A 89DA                    	mov	dx,bx
 33253                                  
 33254 0000566C 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx ; 0
 33255                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],bx ; 0
 33256 0000566E 26395E0F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],bx ; 0

 33259                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Dh]
 33260 0000567A 268B5E1D                	mov	bx,[es:bp+DPB.NEXT_FREE]

 33266                                  	;cmp	bx,0

 33269 0000568A 268B5E39                	mov	bx,[es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE]
 33270 0000568E 7526                    	jnz	short FINDFRE
 33271                                  ads1:
 33272 00005690 83FB02                  	cmp	bx,2
 33273 00005693 7721                    	ja	short FINDFRE
 33274                                  ads2:
 33275 00005695 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx ; 0
 33276                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],bx
 33277 00005697 26395E0F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],bx ; 0
 33278 0000569B 750A                    	jnz	short ads3		; not FAT32
 33279                                  
 33280                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+39h],2
 33281 0000569D 26C746390200            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE],2
 33282                                  	;mov	[es:bp+3Bh],bx
 33283 000056A3 26895E3B                	mov	[es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE+2],bx ; 0
 33284                                  ads3:
 33285 000056A7 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx ; 0
 33286                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Dh],2	
 33287 000056AB 26C7461D0200            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 33288 000056B1 43                      	inc	bx ; 1
 33289                                  	;or	[es:bp+18h],bl
 33290 000056B2 26085E18                	or	[es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],bl ; 1	
 33291                                  	;;;
 33292                                  %endif
 33293                                  
 33294                                  ;   Scanning both forwards and backwards for a free cluster
 33295                                  ;
 33296                                  ;       (BX) = forwards scan pointer
 33297                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated

 33299                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file

 33774                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33775                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33776                                  	;;;
 33777 0000582E 8916[EA0A]              	mov	[CLUSDATA_HW],dx ; (dx = 0, release)
 33778                                  	;;;
 33779                                  
 33780                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9D19h
 33781                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8E88h)
 33782                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C285h)
 33783                                  
 33784                                  	;entry	RELBLKS
 33785                                  RELBLKS:
 33786                                  
 33787                                  ;   Enter here with DX=0FFFFH to put an end-of-file mark in the first cluster
 33788                                  ;   and free the rest in the chain.
 33789                                  
 33790 00005832 E80807                  	call	UNPACK
 33791                                  	;jc	short RELEASE_flush
 33792                                  	;jz	short RELEASE_flush
 33793                                  	; 28/12/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33794 00005835 7652                            jbe	short RET12 ; jna short RET12
 33795                                  				; CCONTENT_HW:DI= Content of FAT
 33796                                   				; for given cluster (next cluster)
 33797 00005837 89F8                    	MOV     AX,DI
 33798 00005839 52                              PUSH    DX
 33799                                  
 33800                                  	;;; 28/12/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33801                                  	;push	ax
 33802                                  	;;;
 33803                                  
 33804 0000583A E8AF07                  	call	PACK
 33805                                  
 33806                                  	;;; 28/12/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33807                                  	;pop	ax
 33808 0000583D 8B16[EC0A]              	mov	dx,[CCONTENT_HW]
 33809 00005841 8916[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],dx ; next cluster (hw) to be released
 33810 00005845 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax		 ; next cluster (lw) to be released
 33811                                  	;;;
 33812                                          
 33813 00005847 5A                      	POP     DX
 33814                                  	;jc	short RELEASE_flush
 33815                                  	; 28/12/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33816 00005848 723F                    	jc	short RET12
 33817                                          
 33818 0000584A 09D2                    	OR      DX,DX
 33819 0000584C 751F                            JNZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; Was putting EOF mark
 33820                                  
 33821                                  ; 28/02/2024
 33822                                  %if 0
 33823                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1 ; MSDOS 3.3
 33824                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 33825                                  	CMP     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 33826                                          JZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; No
 33827                                          INC	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 33828                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 33829                                          MOV     BX,AX
 33830                                          dec     ax              	; check for "1"
 33831                                  	jz	short RELEASE_flush	; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 33832                                  %else
 33833                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33834                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33835                                  	;;;
 33836 0000584E 3B16[EA0A]              	cmp	dx,[CLUSDATA_HW]	; > 0 ? (delete, release)
 33837 00005852 7519                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC	; no, EOF (allocate, -1), (dx = 0)
 33838                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh
 33839 00005854 26837E1FFF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh ; -1
 33840                                  					; Free count valid?
 33841 00005859 7412                    	jz	short NO_DEALLOC	; No (dx = 0)
 33842                                  relblks_ifc:
 33843                                  	;inc	word ptr es:[bp+1Fh]
 33844 0000585B 26FF461F                	inc	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 33845 0000585F 7519                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2
 33846                                  
 33847                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],dx
 33848 00005861 2639560F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],dx
 33849 00005865 7513                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2	; not FAT32
 33850                                  
 33851                                  	;inc	word [es:bp+21h]
 33852 00005867 26FF4621                	inc	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT+2]
 33853 0000586B EB0D                    	jmp	short NO_DEALLOC2
 33854                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 33855                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],dx
 33856 0000586D 2639560F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],dx	; dx is -1 or 0
 33857                                  					; (valid 16 bit fat size is another number)
 33858 00005871 7507                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2 ; FAT (FAT16 or FAT12)
 33859                                  					; dx = 0, FAT32
 33860                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh
 33861 00005873 26837E21FF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT+2],0FFFFh
 33862 00005878 75E1                    	jnz	short relblks_ifc
 33863                                  NO_DEALLOC2:
 33864 0000587A 833E[E80A]00            	cmp	word [CLUSTNUM_HW],0
 33865 0000587F 7503                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC3
 33866 00005881 48                      	dec	ax			; check for "1"	
 33867 00005882 7405                    	jz	short RET12		; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 33868                                  NO_DEALLOC3:
 33869                                  	;;;
 33870                                  %endif
 33871                                  
 33872 00005884 E88D06                  	call	IsEOF
 33873 00005887 72A3                            JB	short RELEASE	; Carry clear if JMP not taken
 33874                                  
 33875                                  	; 16/12/2022
 33876                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 33877                                  ; 28/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33878                                  %if 0
 33879                                  RELEASE_flush:
 33880                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33881                                  	mov	al,[es:bp]
 33882                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 33883                                  	push	si		; FLUSHBUF may trash these and we guarantee
 33884                                  	push	cx		;  them to be preserved.
 33885                                  	push	es
 33886                                  	push	bp
 33887                                  	call	FLUSHBUF	; commit buffers for this drive
 33888                                  	pop	bp
 33889                                  	pop	es
 33890                                  	pop	cx
 33891                                  	pop	si
 33892                                  %endif		; 28/02/2024
 33893                                  
 33894                                  RET12:
 33895 00005889 C3                      	retn
 33896                                  
 33897                                  ;Break	<GETEOF -- Find the end of a file>
 33898                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33899                                  ;
 33900                                  ; Procedure Name : GETEOF
 33901                                  ;
 33902                                  ; Inputs:
 33903                                  ;       ES:BP Points to DPB
 33904                                  ;       BX = Cluster in a file
 33905                                  ;       DS = CS
 33906                                  ; Outputs:
 33907                                  ;       BX = Last cluster in the file
 33908                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 33909                                  ; DI destroyed. No other registers affected.
 33910                                  ;
 33911                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33912                                  
 33913                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33914                                  %if 0
 33915                                  GETEOF:
 33916                                  	call	UNPACK
 33917                                          jc	short RET12
 33918                                          PUSH    BX
 33919                                          MOV     BX,DI
 33920                                  	call	IsEOF
 33921                                          POP     BX
 33922                                          JAE     short RET12
 33923                                          MOV     BX,DI
 33924                                          JMP     short GETEOF
 33925                                  %else
 33926                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33927                                  	;;;
 33928                                  GETEOF4:	; **
 33929 0000588A 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 33930                                  GETEOF1:
 33931 0000588E 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 33932 00005890 8916[F20A]              	mov	[CLUSTERS_HW],dx ; CLUSTERS_HW:DI = Cluster Count
 33933 00005894 58                      	pop	ax
 33934 00005895 5A                      	pop	dx
 33935 00005896 C3                      	retn
 33936                                  
 33937                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9D7Ch
 33938                                  GETEOF:
 33939 00005897 52                      	push	dx
 33940 00005898 50                      	push	ax
 33941 00005899 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx ; 0	; cluster count = 0
 33942 0000589B 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; 0
 33943                                  GETEOF2:
 33944 0000589D E89D06                  	call	UNPACK
 33945 000058A0 72EC                    	jc	short GETEOF1
 33946                                  		; CCONTENT_HW:DI = next cluster (cluster content)
 33947 000058A2 40                      	inc	ax
 33948 000058A3 7501                    	jnz	short GETEOF3
 33949 000058A5 42                      	inc	dx
 33950                                  GETEOF3:
 33951 000058A6 FF36[E80A]              	push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 33952 000058AA 53                      	push    bx
 33953                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33954 000058AB 8B1E[EC0A]              	mov	bx,[CCONTENT_HW]
 33955 000058AF 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 33956 000058B3 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 33957 000058B5 E85C06                  	call	IsEOF
 33958                                  	;pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 33959 000058B8 5B                      	pop	bx
 33960                                  	;jae	short GETEOF1   ; EOF
 33961 000058B9 73CF                    	jae	short GETEOF4 ; ** ; 28/02/2024
 33962                                  	;mov	bx,[CCONTENT_HW] ; not EOF
 33963                                  	;mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 33964 000058BB 5B                      	pop	bx	; * ; 28/02/2024
 33965 000058BC 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 33966 000058BE EBDD                    	jmp	short GETEOF2   ; get next cluster
 33967                                  	;;;
 33968                                  %endif

 34007                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34008                                  ;
 34009                                  ; Procedure : MakeFcb
 34010                                  ;
 34011                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34012                                  
 34013                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34014                                  	; DOSCODE:8E77h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34015                                  
 34016                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34017                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9DB0h
 34018                                  
 34019                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8ED3h)
 34020                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:8D92h)
 34021                                  
 34022                                  MAKEFCB:
 34023                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34024                                  	;MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0
 34025 000058C0 30D2                    	XOR	DL,DL		; Flag--not ambiguous file name
 34026                                  	; 29/02/2024
 34027 000058C2 368816[4E03]            	mov	[ss:SpaceFlag],dl ; 0
 34028                                  	;test	al,2
 34029 000058C7 A802                    	test	AL,DRVBIT	; Use current drive field if default?
 34030 000058C9 7503                    	JNZ	short DEFDRV
 34031                                  	;MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0	; No - use default drive
 34032                                  	; 29/02/2024
 34033 000058CB 268815                  	mov	[es:di],dl ; 0
 34034                                  DEFDRV:
 34035 000058CE 47                      	INC	DI
 34036 000058CF B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 34037                                  	;test	al,4
 34038 000058D2 A804                    	test	AL,NAMBIT	; Use current name fields as default?
 34039 000058D4 93                      	XCHG	AX,BX		; Save bits in BX
 34040 000058D5 B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 34041 000058D7 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB	; If not, go fill with blanks
 34042 000058D9 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 34043 000058DB 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX		; Don't fill any
 34044                                  FILLB:
 34045 000058DD F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34046 000058DF B103                    	MOV	CL,3
 34047 000058E1 F6C308                  	test	BL,EXTBIT	; Use current extension as default
 34048 000058E4 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB2
 34049 000058E6 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 34050 000058E8 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX
 34051                                  FILLB2:
 34052 000058EA F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34053 000058EC 91                      	XCHG	AX,CX		; Put zero in AX
 34054 000058ED AB                      	STOSW
 34055 000058EE AB                      	STOSW			; Initialize two words after to zero
 34056 000058EF 83EF10                  	SUB	DI,16		; Point back at start
 34057                                  	;test	bl,1
 34058 000058F2 F6C301                  	test	BL,SCANSEPARATOR; Scan off separators if not zero
 34059 000058F5 7409                    	JZ	short SKPSPC
 34060 000058F7 E88800                  	CALL	SCANB		; Peel off blanks and tabs
 34061 000058FA E81E01                  	CALL	DELIM		; Is it a one-time-only delimiter?
 34062 000058FD 7504                    	JNZ	short NOSCAN
 34063 000058FF 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over the delimiter
 34064                                  SKPSPC:
 34065 00005900 E87F00                  	CALL	SCANB		; Always kill preceding blanks and tabs
 34066                                  NOSCAN:
 34067 00005903 E8EC00                  	CALL	GETLET
 34068 00005906 761E                    	JBE	short NODRV	; Quit if termination character
 34069 00005908 803C3A                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],":"	; Check for potential drive specifier
 34070 0000590B 7519                    	JNZ	short NODRV
 34071 0000590D 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over colon
 34072 0000590E 2C40                    	SUB	AL,"@"          ; Convert drive letter to drive number (A=1)
 34073 00005910 760F                    	JBE	short BADDRV	; Drive letter out of range
 34074                                  
 34075 00005912 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34076 00005913 E8961E                  	call	GetVisDrv
 34077 00005916 58                      	POP	AX
 34078 00005917 730A                    	JNC	short HAVDRV
 34079                                  
 34080                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34081                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34082                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34083 00005919 36803E[1006]1A          	CMP	byte [SS:DrvErr],error_not_DOS_disk ; 1Ah
 34084                                  					; if not FAT drive ;AN000;
 34085 0000591F 7402                    	JZ	short HAVDRV		; assume ok	   ;AN000;
 34086                                  BADDRV:
 34087 00005921 B2FF                    	MOV	DL,-1
 34088                                  HAVDRV:
 34089 00005923 AA                      	STOSB			; Put drive specifier in first byte
 34090 00005924 46                      	INC	SI
 34091 00005925 4F                      	DEC	DI		; Counteract next two instructions
 34092                                  NODRV:
 34093 00005926 4E                      	DEC	SI		; Back up
 34094 00005927 47                      	INC	DI		; Skip drive byte
 34095                                  
 34096                                  	;entry	NORMSCAN
 34097                                  NORMSCAN:
 34098 00005928 B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 34099 0000592B E82200                  	CALL	GETWORD 	; Get 8-letter file name
 34100 0000592E 803C2E                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],"."
 34101 00005931 7510                    	JNZ	short NODOT
 34102 00005933 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over dot if present
 34103                                  
 34104                                  	; 24/09/2023
 34105                                  	;mov	cx,3
 34106 00005934 B103                    	mov	cl,3	; ch=0
 34107                                  
 34108                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34109                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34110                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],DBCS_VOLID2 ; 100h ;AN000;
 34111                                  	; 10/06/2019
 34112 00005936 36F606[1206]01          	test	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(DBCS_VOLID2>>8) ; 1
 34113 0000593C 7402                    	JZ	short VOLOK				;AN000;
 34114 0000593E A4                      	MOVSB			; 2nd byte of DBCS	;AN000;
 34115                                  	; 24/09/2023
 34116                                  	;MOV	CX,2					;AN000;
 34117 0000593F 49                      	dec	cx  ; cx=2
 34118                                  	;JMP	SHORT contvol				;AN000;
 34119                                  VOLOK:
 34120                                  	;MOV	CX,3		; Get 3-letter extension
 34121                                  contvol:
 34122 00005940 E81300                  	CALL	MUSTGETWORD
 34123                                  NODOT:
 34124 00005943 88D0                    	MOV	AL,DL
 34125                                  
 34126                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34127                                  	;and	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],0FEFFh
 34128                                  	; 18/12/2022
 34129 00005945 368026[1206]FE          	and	byte [ss:DOS34_FLAG+1],0FEh ; (~DBCS_VOLID2)>>8
 34130                                  	;and	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],~DBCS_VOLID2 ; ### BUG FIX ###
 34131                                  
 34132 0000594B C3                      	retn
 34133                                  
 34134                                  NONAM:
 34135 0000594C 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 34136 0000594E 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34137 0000594F C3                      	retn
 34138                                  
 34139                                  GETWORD:
 34140 00005950 E89F00                  	CALL	GETLET		
 34141 00005953 76F7                    	JBE	short NONAM	; Exit if invalid character
 34142 00005955 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34143                                  
 34144                                  ;	UGH!!! Horrible bug here that should be fixed at some point:
 34145                                  ;	If the name we are scanning is longer than CX, we keep on reading!
 34146                                  
 34147                                  MUSTGETWORD:
 34148 00005956 E89900                  	CALL	GETLET
 34149                                  
 34150                                  ;	If spaceFlag is set then we allow spaces in a pathname
 34151                                  
 34152                                  ;IF NOT TABLELOOK
 34153                                  ;	JB	short FILLNAM  ; MSDOS 3.3
 34154                                  ;ENDIF
 34155 00005959 750C                    	JNZ	short MustCheckCX
 34156                                  
 34157                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34158 0000595B 36F606[4E03]FF          	test	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0FFh
 34159 00005961 7419                    	JZ	short FILLNAM
 34160 00005963 3C20                    	CMP	AL," "
 34161 00005965 7515                    	JNZ	short FILLNAM
 34162                                  
 34163                                  MustCheckCX:
 34164 00005967 E3ED                    	JCXZ	MUSTGETWORD
 34165 00005969 49                      	DEC	CX
 34166 0000596A 3C2A                    	CMP	AL,"*"          ; Check for ambiguous file specifier
 34167 0000596C 7504                    	JNZ	short NOSTAR
 34168 0000596E B03F                    	MOV	AL,"?"
 34169 00005970 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34170                                  NOSTAR:
 34171 00005972 AA                      	STOSB
 34172 00005973 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,"?"
 34173 00005975 75DF                    	JNZ	short MUSTGETWORD
 34174 00005977 80CA01                  	OR	DL,1		; Flag ambiguous file name
 34175 0000597A EBDA                    	JMP	short MUSTGETWORD
 34176                                  FILLNAM:
 34177 0000597C B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 34178 0000597E F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34179 00005980 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34180 00005981 C3                      	retn
 34181                                  
 34182                                  SCANB:
 34183 00005982 AC                      	LODSB
 34184 00005983 E89D00                  	CALL	SPCHK
 34185 00005986 74FA                    	JZ	short SCANB
 34186 00005988 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34187                                  scanb_retn:
 34188 00005989 C3                      	retn

 34190                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34191                                  ;
 34192                                  ; Procedure Name : NameTrans
 34193                                  ;
 34194                                  ; NameTrans is used by FindPath to scan off an element of a path. We must
 34195                                  ; allow spaces in pathnames
 34196                                  ;
 34197                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI points to start of path element
 34198                                  ;   Outputs:	Name1 has unpacked name, uppercased
 34199                                  ;		ES = DOSGroup
 34200                                  ;		DS:SI advanced after name
 34201                                  ;   Registers modified: DI,AX,DX,CX
 34202                                  ;
 34203                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34204                                  
 34205                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34206                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34207                                  
 34208                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34209                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9E7Ch
 34210                                  
 34211                                  NameTrans:
 34212                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34213 0000598A 36C606[4E03]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],1
 34214 00005990 16                      	push	ss
 34215 00005991 07                      	pop	es
 34216                                  
 34217                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 34218 00005992 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 34219 00005995 57                      	PUSH	DI
 34220                                  
 34221                                  ; 29/02/2024
 34222                                  %if 0
 34223                                  	MOV	AX,'  '	; 2020h
 34224                                  	MOV	CX,5
 34225                                  	STOSB
 34226                                  	REP	STOSW		; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 34227                                  	XOR	AL,AL		; Set stuff for NORMSCAN
 34228                                  	MOV	DL,AL
 34229                                  %else
 34230                                  	; 29/02/2024
 34231                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34232                                  	;;;
 34233 00005996 B020                    	mov     al, 20h ; ' '
 34234 00005998 B90B00                  	mov     cx, 11
 34235 0000599B F3AA                    	rep stosb               ; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 34236 0000599D 91                      	xchg    ax, cx
 34237 0000599E 99                      	cwd
 34238                                  	;;;
 34239                                  %endif
 34240                                  
 34241 0000599F AA                      	STOSB
 34242 000059A0 5F                      	POP	DI
 34243                                  
 34244 000059A1 E884FF                  	CALL	NORMSCAN
 34245                                  
 34246                                  ;hkn; SS override for NAME1
 34247 000059A4 36803E[4B05]E5          	CMP	byte [SS:NAME1],0E5H
 34248 000059AA 75DD                    	jnz	short scanb_retn
 34249 000059AC 36C606[4B05]05          	MOV	byte [SS:NAME1],5 ; Magic name translation
 34250 000059B2 C3                      	retn
 34251                                  
 34252                                  ;Break	<GETLET, DELIM -- CHECK CHARACTERS AND CONVERT>
 34253                                  ;============================================================================
 34254                                  
 34255                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34256                                  ; DOSCODE:8FD2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34257                                  
 34258                                  ;If TableLook
 34259                                  
 34260                                  ;hkn; Table	SEGMENT
 34261                                  ;	PUBLIC	CharType
 34262                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34263                                  
 34264                                  ; Character type table for file name scanning
 34265                                  ; Table provides a mapping of characters to validity bits.
 34266                                  ; Four bits are provided for each character. Values 7Dh and above
 34267                                  ; have all bits set, so that part of the table is chopped off, and
 34268                                  ; the translation routine is responsible for screening these values.
 34269                                  ; The bit values are defined in DOSSYM.INC
 34270                                  
 34271                                  ;	      ; ^A and NUL
 34272                                  ;CharType:
 34273                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34274                                  ;	      ; ^C and ^B
 34275                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34276                                  ;	      ; ^E and ^D
 34277                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34278                                  ;	      ; ^G and ^F
 34279                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34280                                  ;	      ; TAB and BS
 34281                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34282                                  ;	      ; ^K and ^J
 34283                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34284                                  ;	      ; ^M and ^L
 34285                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34286                                  ;	      ; ^O and ^N
 34287                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34288                                  ;	      ; ^Q and ^P
 34289                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34290                                  ;	      ; ^S and ^R
 34291                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34292                                  ;	      ; ^U and ^T
 34293                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34294                                  ;	      ; ^W and ^V
 34295                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34296                                  ;	      ; ^Y and ^X
 34297                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34298                                  ;	      ; ESC and ^Z
 34299                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34300                                  ;	      ; ^] and ^;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34302                                  ;	      ; ^_ and ^^
 34303                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34304                                  ;	      ; ! and SPACE
 34305                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK)
 34306                                  ;	      ; # and "
 34307                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK)
 34308                                  ;	      ; $ - )
 34309                                  ;	 db   3 dup (0FFh)
 34310                                  ;	      ; + and *
 34311                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 34312                                  ;	      ; - and '
 34313                                  ;	 db   NOT (FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM)
 34314                                  ;	      ; / and .
 34315                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34316                                  ;	      ; 0 - 9
 34317                                  ;	 db   5 dup (0FFh)
 34318                                  ;	      ; ; and :
 34319                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 34320                                  ;	      ; = and <
 34321                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 34322                                  ;	      ; ? and >
 34323                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 34324                                  ;	      ; A - Z
 34325                                  ;	 db   13 dup (0FFh)
 34326                                  ;	      ; \ and [
 34327                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 34328                                  ;	      ; ^ and ]
 34329                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34330                                  ;	      ; _ - {
 34331                                  ;	 db   15 dup (0FFh)
 34332                                  ;	      ; } and |
 34333                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 34334                                  
 34335                                  ;CharType_last equ ($ - CharType) * 2	; This is the value of the last
 34336                                  ;					; character in the table

 34348 000059B3 6666666606666666                db  66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 06h, 66h, 66h, 66h ; 0-7

 34351 000059CB FFFFFFFFFF4444F4        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh, 44h, 44h,0F4h ; 24-31

 34355 000059EB FFFFFFFFFFFFF4          	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0F4h	   ; 56-62
