 34399                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34400                                  ; DOSCODE:9011h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34401                                  
 34402                                  ; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34403                                  ; DOSCODE:8FB5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34404                                  
 34405                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34406                                  ;
 34407                                  ; Procedure Names : GetLet, UCase, GetLet3
 34408                                  ;
 34409                                  ; These routines take a character, convert it to upper case, and check
 34410                                  ; for delimiters.  Three different entry points:
 34411                                  ;	GetLet -  DS:[SI] = character to convert
 34412                                  ;	UCase  -  AL = character to convert
 34413                                  ;	GetLet3 - AL = character
 34414                                  ;		  [BX] = translation table to use
 34415                                  ;
 34416                                  ;	Exit (in all cases) : AL = upper case character
 34417                                  ;			      CY set if char is control char other than TAB
 34418                                  ;			      ZF set if char is a delimiter
 34419                                  ;	Uses : AX, flags
 34420                                  ;
 34421                                  ; NOTE: This routine exists in a fast table lookup version, and a slow
 34422                                  ; inline version.  Return with carry set is only possible in the inline
 34423                                  ; version. The table lookup version is the one in use.
 34424                                  ;
 34425                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34426                                  
 34427                                  ; This entry point has character at [SI]
 34428                                  
 34429                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5517h
 34430                                  GETLET:	
 34431 000059F2 AC                      	LODSB
 34432                                  
 34433                                  ; This entry point has character in AL
 34434                                  
 34435                                  	;entry	UCase
 34436                                  UCase:	
 34437                                  	; 09/08/2018
 34438                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5518h
 34439                                  _UCase:
 34440 000059F3 53                      	PUSH	BX
 34441 000059F4 BB[7E0B]                	MOV	BX,FILE_UCASE_TAB+2
 34442                                  
 34443                                  ; Convert the character in AL to upper case
 34444                                  
 34445                                  gl_0:
 34446 000059F7 3C61                    	CMP	AL,"a"
 34447 000059F9 7214                    	JB	short gl_2	; Already upper case, go check type
 34448 000059FB 3C7A                    	CMP	AL,"z"
 34449 000059FD 7702                    	JA	short gl_1
 34450 000059FF 2C20                    	SUB	AL,20H		; Convert to upper case
 34451                                  
 34452                                  ; Map European character to upper case
 34453                                  
 34454                                  gl_1:
 34455 00005A01 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80H
 34456 00005A03 720A                    	JB	short gl_2	; Not EuroChar, go check type
 34457 00005A05 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80H		; translate to upper case with this index
 34458                                  
 34459                                  	; M048 - Start 
 34460                                  	; Lantastic call Ucase thru int 2f without setting SS to DOSDATA.
 34461                                  	; So we shall set up DS and to access FILE_UCASE_TAB in BX and also 
 34462                                  	; preserve it.
 34463                                  
 34464                                  	; 09/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34465                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34466                                  	;;XLAT	BYTE [CS:BX]	; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 34467                                  	;CS	XLAT
 34468                                  
 34469                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34470                                  
 34471                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34472 00005A07 1E                      	push	ds
 34473                                  	;getdseg <ds>
 34474 00005A08 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 34475 00005A0D D7                      	XLAT			; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 34476 00005A0E 1F                      	pop	ds
 34477                                  
 34478                                  	; M048 - End
 34479                                  
 34480                                  ; Now check the type
 34481                                  
 34482                                  ;If TableLook
 34483                                  gl_2:
 34484                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34485 00005A0F 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34486                                  
 34487                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34488                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 34489                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 34490                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 34491                                  	;cs	xlat	
 34492                                  	
 34493                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34494 00005A10 E81800                  	CALL	GetCharType	; returns type flags in AL
 34495                                  	
 34496                                  	;test	al,1	
 34497 00005A13 A801                    	TEST	AL,FCHK 	; test for normal character
 34498 00005A15 58                      	POP	AX
 34499                                  
 34500 00005A16 5B                      	POP	BX
 34501 00005A17 C3                      	RETN
 34502                                  
 34503                                  ; This entry has character in AL and lookup table in BX
 34504                                  
 34505                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34506                                  ;	;entry GetLet3
 34507                                  GETLET3: ; 10/08/2018
 34508 00005A18 53                      	PUSH	BX
 34509 00005A19 EBDC                    	JMP	short gl_0
 34510                                  ;ELSE
 34511                                  ;
 34512                                  ;gl_2:
 34513                                  ;	POP	BX
 34514                                  ;	CMP	AL,"."
 34515                                  ;	retz
 34516                                  ;	CMP	AL,'"'
 34517                                  ;	retz
 34518                                  ;	CALL	PATHCHRCMP
 34519                                  ;	retz
 34520                                  ;	CMP	AL,"["
 34521                                  ;	retz
 34522                                  ;	CMP	AL,"]"
 34523                                  ;	retz
 34524                                  ;ENDIF
 34525                                  
 34526                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------
 34527                                  ;
 34528                                  ; DELIM - check if character is a delimiter
 34529                                  ;	Entry : AX = character to check
 34530                                  ;	Exit  : ZF set if character is not a delimiter
 34531                                  ;	Uses  : Flags
 34532                                  ;
 34533                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
 34534                                  
 34535                                  	;entry	DELIM
 34536                                  DELIM:
 34537                                  ;IF TableLook
 34538                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34539 00005A1B 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34540                                  
 34541                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34542                                  	;push	bx
 34543                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 34544                                  	;;09/08/2018
 34545                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 34546                                  	;cs	xlat
 34547                                  	;pop	bx
 34548                                  
 34549                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34550 00005A1C E80C00                  	CALL	GetCharType
 34551                                  	
 34552                                  	;test	al,2
 34553 00005A1F A802                    	TEST	AL,FDELIM
 34554 00005A21 58                      	POP	AX
 34555 00005A22 C3                      	RETN
 34556                                  ;ELSE
 34557                                  ;	CMP	AL,":"
 34558                                  ;	retz
 34559                                  ;
 34560                                  ;	CMP	AL,"<"
 34561                                  ;	retz
 34562                                  ;	CMP	AL,"|"
 34563                                  ;	retz
 34564                                  ;	CMP	AL,">"
 34565                                  ;	retz
 34566                                  ;
 34567                                  ;	CMP	AL,"+"
 34568                                  ;	retz
 34569                                  ;	CMP	AL,"="
 34570                                  ;	retz
 34571                                  ;	CMP	AL,";"
 34572                                  ;	retz
 34573                                  ;	CMP	AL,","
 34574                                  ;	retz
 34575                                  ;ENDIF
 34576                                  
 34577                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34578                                  ;
 34579                                  ;  SPCHK - checks to see if a character is a space or equivalent
 34580                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to check
 34581                                  ;	Exit  : ZF set if character is a space
 34582                                  ;	Uses  : flags
 34583                                  ;
 34584                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34585                                  
 34586                                  	;entry SPCHK
 34587                                  SPCHK:
 34588                                  ;IF TableLook
 34589                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34590 00005A23 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34591                                  
 34592                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34593                                  	;push	bx
 34594                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 34595                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 34596                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 34597                                  	;cs	xlat
 34598                                  	;pop	bx
 34599                                  
 34600                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34601 00005A24 E80400                  	CALL	GetCharType
 34602                                  	
 34603                                  	;test	al,4
 34604 00005A27 A804                    	TEST	AL,FSPCHK
 34605 00005A29 58                      	POP	AX
 34606 00005A2A C3                      	RETN
 34607                                  ;ELSE
 34608                                  ;	CMP	AL,9		; Filter out tabs too
 34609                                  ;	retz
 34610                                  ;; WARNING! " " MUST be the last compare
 34611                                  ;	CMP	AL," "
 34612                                  ;	return
 34613                                  ;ENDIF
 34614                                  
 34615                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34616                                  ;
 34617                                  ;  GetCharType - return flag bits indicating character type
 34618                                  ;	Bits are defined in DOSSYM.INC. Uses lookup table
 34619                                  ;	defined above at label CharType.
 34620                                  ;
 34621                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to return type flags for
 34622                                  ;	Exit  : AL = type flags
 34623                                  ;	Uses  : AL, flags
 34624                                  ;
 34625                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34626                                  
 34627                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34628                                  
 34629                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34630                                  
 34631                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34632                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34633                                  
 34634                                  GetCharType:
 34635                                  	;cmp	al,7Eh
 34636 00005A2B 3C7E                    	cmp	al,CharType_last 	; beyond end of table?
 34637 00005A2D 7314                    	jae	short gct_90		; return standard value
 34638                                  
 34639 00005A2F 53                      	push	bx
 34640 00005A30 BB[B359]                	mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 34641 00005A33 D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; adjust for half-byte table entry size
 34642                                  	;xlat	cs:[bx] 		; get flags
 34643 00005A35 2ED7                    	cs	xlat	
 34644 00005A37 5B                      	pop	bx
 34645                                  
 34646                                  ; carry clear from previous shift means we want the low nibble.  Otherwise
 34647                                  ; we have to shift the flags down to the low nibble
 34648                                  
 34649 00005A38 7306                    	jnc	short gct_80		; carry clear, no shift needed
 34650                                  
 34651                                  ; 29/02/2024
 34652                                  %if 0
 34653                                  	shr	al,1			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 34654                                  	shr	al,1
 34655                                  	shr	al,1
 34656                                  	shr	al,1
 34657                                  %else
 34658                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34659                                  	;;;
 34660 00005A3A 51                      	push	cx
 34661 00005A3B B104                    	mov	cl,4			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 34662 00005A3D D2E8                    	shr	al,cl
 34663 00005A3F 59                      	pop	cx
 34664                                  	;;;
 34665                                  %endif
 34666                                  
 34667                                  gct_80:
 34668 00005A40 240F                    	and	al,0Fh			; clear the unused nibble
 34669 00005A42 C3                      	retn
 34670                                  gct_90:
 34671 00005A43 B00F                    	mov	al,0Fh			; set all flags
 34672 00005A45 C3                      	retn
 34673                                  
 34674                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34675                                  ;
 34676                                  ; Procedure : PATHCHRCMP
 34677                                  ;
 34678                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34679                                  
 34680                                  PATHCHRCMP:
 34681 00005A46 3C2F                    	CMP	AL,'/'
 34682 00005A48 7606                    	JBE	short PathRet
 34683 00005A4A 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'
 34684 00005A4C C3                      	retn
 34685                                  GotFor:
 34686 00005A4D B05C                    	MOV	AL,'\'
 34687 00005A4F C3                      	retn
 34688                                  PathRet:
 34689 00005A50 74FB                    	JZ	short GotFor
 34690 00005A52 C3                      	retn

 34699                                  ; 15/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11, CTRLC.ASM, 1983)
 34700                                  
 34701                                  ;**	MSCTRLC.ASM - ^C and error handler for MSDOS
 34702                                  
 34703                                  ;	TITLE	Control C detection, Hard error and EXIT routines
 34704                                  ;	NAME	IBMCTRLC
 34705                                  
 34706                                  ;**	Low level routines for detecting special characters on CON input,
 34707                                  ;	the ^C exit/int code, the Hard error INT 24 code, the
 34708                                  ;	process termination code, and the INT 0 divide overflow handler.
 34709                                  ;
 34710                                  ;	FATAL
 34711                                  ;	FATAL1
 34712                                  ;	reset_environment
 34713                                  ;	DSKSTATCHK
 34714                                  ;	SPOOLINT
 34715                                  ;	STATCHK
 34716                                  ;	CNTCHAND
 34717                                  ;	DIVOV
 34718                                  ;	CHARHARD
 34719                                  ;	HardErr
 34720                                  ;
 34721                                  ;	Revision history:
 34722                                  ;
 34723                                  ;	    AN000	version 4.0   Jan 1988
 34724                                  ;	    A002	PTM    -- dir >lpt3 hangs
 34725                                  ;	    A003	PTM 3957- fake version for IBMCAHE.COM
 34726                                  ;
 34727                                  ; 	M011: NEC's 8086 clone chip uses Intel's undocumented bit number in
 34728                                  ;	      flags register. In order to return to user normally DOS used to
 34729                                  ;	      move F202 into flags, which sets bit number 1 in flags uncondit-
 34730                                  ;	      ionally. Now it is modified to maintain the state of bit 1.
 34731                                  ;
 34732                                  ; 	M024: suppressed fail and ignore options if not in the middle of int

 34734                                  ;	      charhard.

 35041                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35042                                  ;
 35043                                  ; Procedure Name : CNTHAND ( CTRLC_C HANDLER )
 35044                                  ;
 35045                                  ; "^C" and CR/LF is printed. Then the user registers are restored and the
 35046                                  ; user CTRL-C handler is executed. At this point the top of the stack has 1)
 35047                                  ; the interrupt return address should the user CTRL-C handler wish to allow
 35048                                  ; processing to continue; 2) the original interrupt return address to the code
 35049                                  ; that performed the function call in the first place. If the user CTRL-C
 35050                                  ; handler wishes to continue, it must leave all registers unchanged and RET
 35051                                  ; (not IRET) with carry CLEAR. If carry is SET then an terminate system call
 35052                                  ; is simulated.
 35053                                  ;
 35054                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35055                                  
 35056                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 35057                                  
 35058                                  CNTCHAND:
 35059                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; SS override
 35060                                  					; AN002; from RAWOUT
 35061                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],CTRL_BREAK_FLAG  
 35062                                  	;JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 35063                                  
 35064                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35065                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:91C4h, 29/12/2022)
 35066 00005B9B 36F606[1206]02          	TEST	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(CTRL_BREAK_FLAG>>8)  ; 2 
 35067 00005BA1 7508                    	JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 35068                                  
 35069 00005BA3 B003                            MOV     AL,3			; Display "^C"
 35070 00005BA5 E8D3C0                          CALL	BUFOUT
 35071 00005BA8 E868BF                          CALL	CRLF
 35072                                  around_deadlock:
 35073 00005BAB 16                              PUSH    SS
 35074 00005BAC 1F                              POP     DS
 35075 00005BAD 803E[5703]00                    CMP     BYTE [CONSWAP],0
 35076 00005BB2 7403                            JZ      SHORT NOSWAP
 35077 00005BB4 E82DDE                          CALL	SWAPBACK
 35078                                  NOSWAP:
 35079 00005BB7 FA                      	CLI				; Prepare to play with stack
 35080 00005BB8 8E16[8605]              	MOV	SS,[USER_SS]		; User stack now restored
 35081 00005BBC 8B26[8405]              	MOV	SP,[USER_SP]
 35082 00005BC0 E892A8                          CALL	restore_world       ; User registers now restored
 35083                                  
 35084                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 
 35085                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56ACh)
 35086                                          ; 14/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 35087                                  	;MOV	BYTE [CS:INDOS],0	
 35088                                          ;MOV	BYTE [CS:ERRORMODE],0
 35089                                          ;MOV	[CS:ConC_Spsave],SP
 35090                                  	;clc	;30/07/2018
 35091                                          ;INT	int_ctrl_c ; 23h    ; Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 35092                                  	;;int	23h	; DOS - CONTROL "C" EXIT ADDRESS
 35093                                  			; Return: return via RETF 2 with CF set
 35094                                  			; DOS will abort program with errorlevel 0
 35095                                  			; else
 35096                                  			; interrupted DOS call continues
 35097                                  
 35098                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35099                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS,91ECh) 
 35100                                  
 35101                                  	; CS was used to address these variables. We have to use DOSDATA
 35102                                  	
 35103 00005BC3 07                      	pop	es ; *	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, DOSCODE:91ECh)
 35104                                  			; (pop es, after 'call restore_world')	
 35105 00005BC4 1E                      	push	ds
 35106                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 35107 00005BC5 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35108 00005BCA C606[2103]00            	mov	byte [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 35109                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35110                                  	;;;
 35111 00005BCF C606[C011]00            	mov	byte [INDOS_FLAG],0	; 2nd 'in dos' flag (what for?)
 35112                                  	;;;
 35113 00005BD4 C606[2003]00            	mov	byte [ERRORMODE],0
 35114 00005BD9 8926[3203]              	mov	[ConC_Spsave],SP	; save his SP
 35115                                  	; User SP has changed because of push. Adjust for it
 35116 00005BDD 8306[3203]02            	add	word [ConC_Spsave],2
 35117                                  
 35118 00005BE2 803E[660D]00            	cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],0	; Q: is dos running in HMA (M021)
 35119 00005BE7 1F                       	pop	ds	; restore ds
 35120 00005BE8 7505                    	jne	short do_low_int23	; Y: the int must be done from low mem
 35121 00005BEA F8                      	CLC				
 35122 00005BEB CD23                    	INT	int_ctrl_c  ; int 23h	; N: Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 35123 00005BED EB06                    	jmp	short ctrlc_ret_addr
 35124                                  
 35125                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35126                                  do_low_int23:
 35127 00005BEF F8                      	clc
 35128 00005BF0 2EFF1E[535A]            	call	far [cs:LowInt23Addr]
 35129                                  
 35130                                  	; 30/07/2018 
 35131                                  
 35132                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56C0h)
 35133                                  
 35134                                  ; The user has returned to us. The circumstances we allow are:
 35135                                  ;
 35136                                  ;   IRET	We retry the operation by redispatching the system call
 35137                                  ;   CLC/RETF	POP the stack and retry
 35138                                  ;   ... 	Exit the current process with ^C exit
 35139                                  ;
 35140                                  ; User's may RETURN to us and leave interrupts on. 
 35141                                  ; Turn 'em off just to be sure
 35142                                  
 35143                                  ctrlc_ret_addr: ; 05/05/2019
 35144                                  
 35145 00005BF5 FA                      	CLI
 35146                                  
 35147                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 
 35148                                  	;MOV	[CS:USER_IN_AX],ax	; save the AX
 35149                                  	;PUSHF				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 35150                                  	;POP	AX
 35151                                  
 35152                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35153                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35154                                  
 35155                                  	; We have to use DOSDATA for these variables. Previously CS was used 
 35156                                  
 35157 00005BF6 50                      	push	ax
 35158 00005BF7 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds
 35159                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 35160 00005BF9 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35161 00005BFE A3[630D]                	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax
 35162 00005C01 58                      	pop	ax
 35163 00005C02 A3[3A03]                	MOV	[USER_IN_AX],ax		; save the AX
 35164 00005C05 9C                      	pushf				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 35165 00005C06 58                      	pop	ax
 35166                                  
 35167                                  ; See if the input stack is identical to the output stack
 35168                                  
 35169                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35170                                  	;CMP	SP,[CS:ConC_Spsave]
 35171                                  	;JNZ	SHORT ctrlc_try_new	; current SP not the same as saved SP
 35172                                  
 35173                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35174 00005C07 3B26[3203]              	CMP	SP,[ConC_Spsave]
 35175 00005C0B 750A                    	JNZ	SHORT ctrlc_try_new	; current SP not the same as saved SP
 35176                                  
 35177                                  ; Repeat the operation by redispatching the system call.
 35178                                  
 35179                                  ctrlc_repeat:
 35180                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35181                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:USER_IN_AX]
 35182                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35183                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35184 00005C0D A1[3A03]                	mov	ax,[USER_IN_AX]
 35185 00005C10 8E1E[630D]              	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]		; restore ds and original sp
 35186                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0 
 35187                                  	;transfer COMMAND
 35188                                  COMMANDJ:
 35189 00005C14 E9EEA6                  	JMP	COMMAND
 35190                                  
 35191                                  ; The current SP is NOT the same as the input SP. Presume that he 
 35192                                  ; RETF'd leaving some flags on the stack and examine the input
 35193                                  
 35194                                  ctrlc_try_new:
 35195                                  	; 29/02/2024
 35196                                  	;ADD	SP,2			; pop those flags
 35197                                  	;
 35198                                  	;;test	ax,1

 35407                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35408                                  ;
 35409                                  ; Procedure Name : HardErr
 35410                                  ;
 35411                                  ; Hard disk error handler. Entry conditions:
 35412                                  ;	DS:BX = Original disk transfer address
 35413                                  ;	DX = Original logical sector number
 35414                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors to go (first one gave the error)
 35415                                  ;	AX = Hardware error code
 35416                                  ;	DI = Original sector transfer count	
 35417                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 35418                                  ;	[READOP] = 0 for read, 1 for write
 35419                                  ;	Allowed Set with allowed responses to this error (other bits MUST BE 0)
 35420                                  ; Output:
 35421                                  ;	[FAILERR] will be set if user responded FAIL
 35422                                  ;
 35423                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35424                                  
 35425                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35426                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35427                                  HARDERR:
 35428                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35429                                  	; 30/07/2018
 35430                                  	; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 35432                                  	;and	di,0FFh

 35436 00005CB5 83FF00                  	cmp	DI,error_I24_write_protect ; Write Protect Error?

 35438 00005CBA 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35439                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)

 35441                                  	;;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+0]

 35444                                  		; 15/03/2018

 35462                                  	;;;

 35469 00005CDF 263B5606                	CMP	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]

 35471

 35480 00005CEE 52                      	push	dx
 35481 00005CEF 368B16[0706]            	mov	dx,[ss:HIGH_SECTOR]
 35482                                  	;cmp	dx,[es:bp+2Bh]
 35483 00005CF4 263B562B                	cmp	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FCLUS_FSECTOR+2]
 35484 00005CF8 5A                      	pop	dx
 35485 00005CF9 7504                    	jnz	short TESTDIR1	; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace

 35567                                  ; Entry point used by REDIRector on Network I 24 errors.

 35572                                  ;	EXITHOLD set for restore of ES:BP.

 35576                                  GOT_RIGHT_CODE:

 35586                                  	; Wango!!! We may need to free some user state info... In 
 35587                                  	; particular, we may have locked down a JFN for a user and he may

 35589                                  	; reallocate it when we come back.

 35647 00005DBE 06                      	push	es
 35648 00005DBF 17                      	pop	ss
 35649                                  passi24:
 35650 00005DC0 368B26[8805]            	MOV	SP,[SS:CONTSTK]
 35651 00005DC5 36FE06[2103]            	INC	BYTE [SS:INDOS]		; Back in the DOS
 35652                                  
 35653                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35654                                  	;;;
 35655 00005DCA 36FE06[C011]            	inc	byte [ss:INDOS_FLAG]
 35656                                  	;;;
 35657                                  
 35658 00005DCF 36C606[2003]00          	MOV	BYTE [SS:ERRORMODE],0	; Back from INT 24
 35659 00005DD5 FB                      	STI
 35660                                  FailRet:
 35661 00005DD6 36C42E[8005]            	LES	BP,[SS:EXITHOLD]
 35662                                  	
 35663                                  	; 08/07/2018
 35664                                  
 35665                                  	; Triage the user's reply.
 35666                                  
 35667 00005DDB 3C01                    	CMP	AL,1
 35668 00005DDD 723D                    	JB	short CheckIgnore	; 0 => ignore
 35669 00005DDF 7445                    	JZ	short CheckRetry	; 1 => retry
 35670 00005DE1 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3			; 3 => fail
 35671 00005DE3 7549                    	JNZ	short DoAbort 		; 2, invalid => abort
 35672

 35674                                  
 35675                                  					; SS override for ALLOWED, EXTOPEN_ON,
 35676                                  					; ALLOWED, FAILERR, WPERR, SFN, pJFN
 35677                                  	;test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],8

 35679 00005DEB 7441                    	jz	short DoAbort		; No, do abort
 35680                                  DoFail:
 35681 00005DED B003                    	MOV	AL,3			; just in case...

 35685 00005DEF 36F606[F605]02          	test	byte [ss:EXTOPEN_ON],EXT_OPEN_I24_OFF ; 2
 35686 00005DF5 7505                    	jnz	short CleanUp 		; AN000;EO. no

 35689                                  CleanUp:

 35691 00005E02 36833E[AA05]FF          	CMP	word [SS:SFN],-1
 35692                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 35693                                  	;jnz	short CleanUp2
 35694                                  	;retn
 35695                                  	; 17/12/2022
 35696 00005E08 7411                    	jz	short Cleanup_retn ; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35697                                  CleanUp2:
 35698 00005E0A 1E                      	push	ds
 35699 00005E0B 56                      	push	si
 35700 00005E0C 50                      	push	ax
 35701 00005E0D 36A1[AA05]              	MOV	AX,[ss:SFN]
 35702 00005E11 36C536[AE05]            	LDS	SI,[ss:PJFN]

 35704 00005E18 58                      	pop	ax
 35705 00005E19 5E                      	pop	si
 35706 00005E1A 1F                      	pop	ds
 35707                                  Cleanup_retn:
 35708 00005E1B C3                      	retn
 35709                                  
 35710                                  	; The reply was IGNORE. See if we are allowed to ignore.
 35711                                  
 35712                                  CheckIgnore:
 35713                                  	;test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],20h
 35714 00005E1C 36F606[4B03]20          	test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_IGNORE ; Can we?
 35715                                  CheckRI:	; 29/02/2024
 35716 00005E22 74C9                    	jz	short DoFail			; No, do fail
 35717 00005E24 EBD6                    	jmp	short CleanUp
 35718                                  
 35719                                  	; The reply was RETRY. See if we are allowed to retry.
 35720                                  
 35721                                  CheckRetry:

 35723 00005E26 36F606[4B03]10          	test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_RETRY	; Can we?
 35724                                  	;jz	short DoFail			; No, do fail
 35725                                  	;JMP	short CleanUp
 35726                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35727 00005E2C EBF4                    	jmp	short CheckRI
 35728                                  	
 35729                                  	; The reply was ABORT.
 35730                                  DoAbort:
 35731 00005E2E 16                      	push	ss
 35732 00005E2F 1F                      	pop	ds
 35733                                  
 35734 00005E30 803E[5703]00            	CMP	byte [CONSWAP],0
 35735 00005E35 7403                    	JZ	short NOSWAP2
 35736 00005E37 E8AADB                  	call	SWAPBACK
 35737                                  NOSWAP2:
 35738                                  	; See if we are to truly abort. If we are in the process of aborting, 
 35739                                  	; turn this abort into a fail.
 35740                                  
 35741                                  	;test	[fAborting],0FFh
 35742                                  	;jnz	short DoFail
 35743

 35745 00005E3F 75AC                    	JNZ	short DoFail

 35748                                  
 35749 00005E41 C606[7C05]02            	MOV	BYTE [EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_HARD_ERROR ; 2
 35750 00005E46 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 35751                                  
 35752                                  	; we are truly aborting the process. Go restore information from 
 35753                                  	; the PDB as necessary.
 35754                                  
 35755 00005E48 E95410                  	jmp	exit_inner
 35756                                  
 35757                                  ;** --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35758                                  ;
 35759                                  ; reset_environment checks the DS value against the CurrentPDB. If they are
 35760                                  ; different, then an old-style return is performed. If they are the same,
 35761                                  ; then we release jfns and restore to parent. We still use the PDB at DS:0 as
 35762                                  ; the source of the terminate addresses.
 35763                                  ;
 35764                                  ; Some subtlety: We are about to issue a bunch of calls that *may* generate
 35765                                  ; INT 24s. We *cannot* allow the user to restart the abort process; we may
 35766                                  ; end up aborting the wrong process or turn a terminate/stay/resident into a
 35767                                  ; normal abort and leave interrupt handlers around. What we do is to set a
 35768                                  ; flag that will indicate that if any abort code is seen, we just continue the
 35769                                  ; operation. In essence, we dis-allow the abort response.
 35770                                  ;
 35771                                  ; output:   none.
 35772                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35773                                  
 35774                                  	;entry	reset_environment
 35775                                  	
 35776                                  reset_environment:
 35777                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35778                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 588Ah 
 35779                                  
 35780                                  ;***	invoke	Reset_Version		; AN007 ;MS. reset version number
 35781                                  
 35782 00005E4B 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save PDB of process
 35783                                  
 35784                                  	; There are no critical sections in force. Although we may enter
 35785                                  	; here with critical sections locked down, they are no longer 
 35786                                  	; relevant. We may safely free all allocated resources.
 35787                                  
 35788 00005E4C B482                    	MOV	AH,82h
 35789                                  		; Microsoft Networks - END DOS CRITICAL SECTIONS 0 THROUGH 7
 35790                                  	;int	2Ah 	
 35791 00005E4E CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM
 35792                                  
 35793                                  					; SS override
 35794 00005E50 36C606[5903]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:fAborting],-1	; signal abort in progress
 35795                                  
 35796                                  					; DOS 4.00 doesn't need it
 35797                                  	;CallInstall NetResetEnvironment, MultNET, 34  
 35798                                  					; Allow REDIR to clear some stuff
 35799                                  					; On process exit.
 35800 00005E56 B82211                  	mov	ax, 1122h
 35801 00005E59 CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - PROCESS TERMINATION HOOK
 35802                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 35803                                  	;mov	al,22h	
 35804 00005E5B B022                    	MOV	AL,int_terminate
 35805 00005E5D E8FAB0                  	call	_$GET_INTERRUPT_VECTOR	; and who to go to
 35806                                  
 35807 00005E60 59                      	POP	CX			; get ThisPDB
 35808 00005E61 06                      	push	es
 35809 00005E62 53                      	push	bx			; save return address
 35810                                  
 35811 00005E63 368B1E[3003]            	MOV	BX,[SS:CurrentPDB] 	; get currentPDB
 35812 00005E68 8EDB                    	MOV	DS,BX
 35813 00005E6A A11600                  	MOV	AX,[PDB.PARENT_PID]	; get parentPDB
 35814                                  
 35815                                  	; AX = parentPDB, BX = CurrentPDB, CX = ThisPDB
 35816                                  	; Only free handles if AX <> BX and BX = CX and [exit_code].upper
 35817                                  	; is not Exit_keep_process
 35818                                  	
 35819 00005E6D 39D8                    	CMP	AX,BX
 35820 00005E6F 7418                    	JZ	short reset_return	; parentPDB = CurrentPDB
 35821 00005E71 39CB                    	CMP	BX,CX
 35822 00005E73 7514                    	JNZ	short reset_return	; CurrentPDB <> ThisPDB
 35823 00005E75 50                      	PUSH	AX			; save parent
 35824                                  
 35825                                  					; SS override
 35826                                  	;cmp	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 35827 00005E76 36803E[7C05]03          	CMP	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS ; 15/08/2018
 35828 00005E7C 7406                    	JZ	short reset_to_parent 	; keeping this process
 35829                                  
 35830                                  	; We are truly removing a process. Free all allocation blocks
 35831                                  	; belonging to this PDB
 35832                                  
 35833                                  	;invoke	arena_free_process
 35834 00005E7E E85D10                  	call	arena_free_process
 35835                                  
 35836                                  	; Kill off remainder of this process. Close file handles and signal
 35837                                  	; to relevant network folks that this process is dead. Remember that
 35838                                  	; CurrentPDB is STILL the current process!
 35839                                  
 35840                                  	;invoke	DOS_ABORT
 35841 00005E81 E813D7                  	call	DOS_ABORT
 35842                                  
 35843                                  reset_to_parent:
 35844                                  					; SS override
 35845 00005E84 368F06[3003]            	POP	word [SS:CurrentPDB]	; set up process as parent
 35846                                  
 35847                                  reset_return:				; come here for normal return
 35848                                  	;Context DS			; DS is used to refer to DOSDATA
 35849 00005E89 16                      	push	ss
 35850 00005E8A 1F                      	pop	ds	
 35851                                  
 35852 00005E8B B0FF                    	MOV	AL,-1
 35853                                  
 35854                                  	; make sure that everything is clean In this case ignore any errors,
 35855                                  	; we cannot "FAIL" the abort, the program being aborted is dead.
 35856                                  
 35857                                  	;EnterCrit critDisk
 35858 00005E8D E808BA                  	call	ECritDisk
 35859                                  	;invoke	FLUSHBUF
 35860 00005E90 E86108                  	call	FLUSHBUF
 35861                                  	;LeaveCrit critDisk
 35862 00005E93 E82FBA                  	call	LCritDisk
 35863

 35868

 35870                                  %endif
 35871                                  
 35872 00005E96 FA                      	CLI
 35873 00005E97 C606[2103]00            	MOV	BYTE [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 35874

 35876                                  	;;;

 35878                                  	;;;
 35879

 35893                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35894 00005EC2 07                      	pop	es ; * ; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:94A8h, MSDOS.SYS)
 35895                                  
 35896                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 35940 00005EEC CF                      	IRET			; Long return back to user terminate address

 35942                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35943                                  ;
 35944                                  ; Procedure Name : SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 35945                                  ;
 35946                                  ; This routine handles extended error codes.
 35947                                  ; Input : DI = error code from device
 35948                                  ; Output: All EXTERR fields are set
 35949                                  ;
 35950                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35951                                  
 35952                                  SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR:
 35953 00005EED 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35954                                  					; ErrMap24End is in DOSDATA
 35955 00005EEE B8[BB0E]                	MOV	AX,ErrMap24End
 35956 00005EF1 2D[AB0E]                	SUB	AX,ErrMap24
 35957                                  					; Change to dosdata to access
 35958                                  					; ErrMap24 and EXTERR -SR
 35959                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35960                                  	
 35961                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35962 00005EF4 1E                      	push	ds
 35963                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds ->dosdata
 35964 00005EF5 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35965                                  
 35966                                  	; AX is the index of the first unavailable error. Do not translate
 35967                                  	; if greater or equal to AX.
 35968                                  
 35969 00005EFA 39C7                    	CMP	DI,AX
 35970 00005EFC 89F8                    	MOV	AX,DI
 35971 00005EFE 7306                    	JAE	short NoTrans
 35972                                  
 35973                                  	;MOV	AL,[CS:DI+ErrMap24]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 35974 00005F00 8A85[AB0E]              	mov	al,[ErrMap24+di] ; MSDOS 6.0
 35975 00005F04 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 35976                                  NoTrans:

 35978 00005F06 A3[2403]                	mov	[EXTERR],AX
 35979 00005F09 1F                      	pop	ds

 35981 00005F0A 58                      	POP	AX

 35984                                  	; error locus class and recommended action.
 35985

 35987                                  					; ERR_TABLE_24 is in DOSCODE 
 35988 00005F0C BE[5B0E]                	MOV	SI,ERR_TABLE_24
 35989 00005F0F E8B0A7                  	call	CAL_LK			; Set other extended error fields
 35990 00005F12 5E                      	POP	SI

 35993                                  ;============================================================================
 35994                                  ; FAT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 35995                                  ;============================================================================
 35996                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35997                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35998                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 35999                                  
 36000                                  ;	TITLE	FAT - FAT maintenance routines
 36001                                  ;	NAME	FAT
 36002                                  
 36003                                  ;**	FAT.ASM
 36004                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36005                                  ;	Low level local device routines for performing disk change sequence,
 36006                                  ;	setting cluster validity, and manipulating the FAT
 36007                                  ;
 36008                                  ;	IsEof
 36009                                  ;	UNPACK
 36010                                  ;	PACK
 36011                                  ;	MAPCLUSTER
 36012                                  ;	FATREAD_SFT
 36013                                  ;	FATREAD_CDS
 36014                                  ;	FAT_operation
 36015                                  ;
 36016                                  ;	Revision history:
 36017                                  ;
 36018                                  ;	  AN000  version Jan. 1988
 36019                                  ;	   A001  PTM	      -- disk changed for look ahead buffers
 36020                                  ;
 36021                                  ;	M014 - if a request for pack\unpack cluster 0 is made we write\read
 36022                                  ;	       from CL0FATENTRY rather than disk.
 36023                                  
 36024                                  ; DOSCODE:94FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36025                                  
 36026                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36027                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:A40Ch
 36028                                  
 36029                                  ;Break <IsEOF - check the quantity in BX for EOF>
 36030                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36031                                  ;
 36032                                  ; Procedure Name : IsEOF
 36033                                  ;
 36034                                  ; IsEOF - check the fat value in BX for eof.
 36035                                  ;
 36036                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:BP point to DPB
 36037                                  ;		BX has fat value
 36038                                  ;   Outputs:	JAE eof
 36039                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 36040                                  ;
 36041                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36042                                  
 36043                                  IsEOF:
 36044                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36045                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36046                                  	;;;
 36047 00005F14 E89801                  	call	IsFAT32			; is it FAT32 drive ?
 36048 00005F17 730D                    	jnc	short IsEOF_FAT		; no, it has 12 or 16 bit FAT
 36049                                  
 36050                                  	; FAT32 fs
 36051 00005F19 36813E[E80A]FF0F        	cmp	word [ss:CLUSTNUM_HW],0FFFh
 36052 00005F20 7503                    	jnz     short IsEOF_other1	; not EOF
 36053 00005F22 83FBF8                  	cmp     bx,0FFF8h		; 32 bit compare
 36054                                  IsEOF_other1:
 36055 00005F25 C3                      	retn 				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36056                                  
 36057                                  IsEOF_FAT:
 36058                                  	;;;
 36059                                  
 36060                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 36061 00005F26 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; is this 16 bit fat?
 36062 00005F2C 730B                    	JAE	short EOF16			; yes, check for eof there
 36063                                  
 36064                                  ;J.K. 8/27/86
 36065                                  ;Modified to accept 0FF0h as an eof. This is to handle the diskfull case
 36066                                  ;of any media that has "F0"(Other) as a MediaByte.
 36067                                  ;Hopely, this does not create any side effect for those who may use any value
 36068                                  ;other than "FF8-FFF" as an EOF for their own file.
 36069                                  
 36070 00005F2E 81FBF00F                	cmp	bx,0FF0h
 36071 00005F32 7404                    	je	short IsEOF_other
 36072                                  
 36073 00005F34 81FBF80F                	CMP	BX,0FF8h		; do the 12 bit compare
 36074                                  IsEOF_other:
 36075 00005F38 C3                      	retn
 36076                                  EOF16:
 36077 00005F39 83FBF8                  	CMP	BX,0FFF8h		; 16 bit compare
 36078 00005F3C C3                      	retn				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36079                                  
 36080                                  ; DOSCODE:9511h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36081                                  
 36082                                  ;Break	<UNPACK -- UNPACK FAT ENTRIES>
 36083                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36084                                  ;
 36085                                  ; Procedure Name : UNPACK
 36086                                  ;
 36087                                  ; Inputs:
 36088                                  ;	BX = Cluster number (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36089                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 36090                                  ; Outputs:
 36091                                  ;	DI = Contents of FAT for given cluster (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36092                                  ;	Zero set means DI=0 (free cluster)
 36093                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36094                                  ; SI Destroyed, No other registers affected. Fatal error if cluster too big.
 36095                                  ;
 36096                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 36097                                  ;
 36098                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36099                                  
 36100                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36101                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A44Eh
 36102                                  	;
 36103                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS .SYS - DOSCODE:9511h)
 36104                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C368h)
 36105                                  
 36106                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36107                                  	; DOSCODE:94B5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36108                                  
 36109                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36110                                  UNPACK:
 36111                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - Start
 36112 00005F3D 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we unpacking cluster 0
 36113 00005F3F 7519                    	jnz	short up_cont		; N: proceed with normal unpack
 36114                                  
 36115                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36116                                  %if 0
 36117                                  	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]	; Y: return value in CL0FATENTRY
 36118                                  	or	di,di 			; return z if di=0
 36119                                  	retn				; done
 36120                                  %else
 36121                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:A435h
 36122                                  	;;;
 36123                                  up_1:
 36124 00005F41 391E[E80A]              	cmp	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx ; 0
 36125 00005F45 7513                    	jne	short up_cont
 36126 00005F47 8B3E[350F]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY_HW]
 36127 00005F4B 09FF                    	or	di,di
 36128 00005F4D 893E[EC0A]              	mov	[CCONTENT_HW],di
 36129 00005F51 8B3E[8100]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]
 36130 00005F55 7502                    	jnz	short unpack_retn

 36298                                  ;Break	<PACK -- PACK FAT ENTRIES>
 36299                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36300                                  ;
 36301                                  ; Procedure Name : PACK
 36302                                  ;
 36303                                  ; Inputs:
 36304                                  ;	BX = Cluster number
 36305                                  ;	DX = Data
 36306                                  ;	ES:BP = Pointer to drive DPB
 36307                                  ; Outputs:
 36308                                  ;	The data is stored in the FAT at the given cluster.
 36309                                  ;	SI,DX,DI all destroyed
 36310                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36311                                  ;	No other registers affected
 36312                                  ;
 36313                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then data in DX is stored in CL0FATENTRY.
 36314                                  ;
 36315                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36316                                  
 36317                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36318                                  
 36319                                  	; INPUT:
 36320                                  	;  [CLUSDATA_HW]:DX = cluster data/content
 36321                                  	;  [CLUSTNUM_HW]:BX = cluster number (to be updated)
 36322                                  	;  ES:BP = pointer to DPB
 36323

 36325                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 36329 00005FEE 7513                    	jnz	short p_cont		; N: proceed with normal pack
 36330                                  
 36331                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36332                                  %if 0
 36333                                  	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx	; Y: place value in CL0FATENTRY
 36334                                  	retn				; done
 36335                                  %else
 36336                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36337                                  	;;;
 36338 00005FF0 391E[E80A]              	cmp	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx ; 0
 36339 00005FF4 750D                    	jnz	short p_cont
 36340                                  
 36341                                  	;push	ax
 36342                                  	;mov	ax,[CLUSDATA_HW]	; Cluster Data/Content (High Word)
 36343                                  	;mov	[CL0FATENTRY_HW],ax
 36344                                  	;pop	ax
 36345 00005FF6 FF36[EA0A]              	push	word [CLUSDATA_HW]
 36346 00005FFA 8F06[350F]              	pop	word [CL0FATENTRY_HW]
 36347                                  
 36348 00005FFE 8916[8100]              	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx
 36349 00006002 C3                      	retn
 36350                                  	;;;
 36351                                  %endif
 36352

 36354                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0

 36360 0000600D B104                    	MOV	CL,4

 36362 00006011 59                      	POP	CX

 36364 00006015 EB2B                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN

 36516                                  
 36517                                  ;Break	<MAPCLUSTER - BUFFER A FAT SECTOR>
 36518                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36519                                  ;
 36520                                  ; Procedure Name : MAPCLUSTER
 36521                                  ;
 36522                                  ; Inputs:
 36523                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 36524                                  ;	BX Is cluster number
 36525                                  ; Function:
 36526                                  ;	Get a pointer to the cluster
 36527                                  ; Outputs:
 36528                                  ;	DS:DI Points to contents of FAT for given cluster
 36529                                  ;	DS:SI Points to start of buffer
 36530                                  ;	Zero Not set if cluster data is in high 12 bits of word
 36531                                  ;	Zero set if cluster data is in low 12 or 16 bits
 36532                                  ;	Carry set if failed.
 36533                                  ; SI is destroyed.
 36534                                  ;
 36535                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36536                                  
 36537                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36538                                  	; DOSCODE:9601h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36539                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36540                                  	; DOSCODE:95A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36541                                  
 36542                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36543                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A5D7h
 36544                                  
 36545                                  MAPCLUSTER:
 36546                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5A15h
 36547 000060C4 C606[7805]00            	MOV	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT],0
 36548                                  	;SAVE	<AX,BX,CX,DX>
 36549 000060C9 50                      	push	ax
 36550 000060CA 53                      	push	bx
 36551 000060CB 51                      	push	cx
 36552 000060CC 52                      	push	dx
 36553                                  	; 02/03/2024
 36554                                  	;MOV	AX,BX			; AX = BX
 36555                                  
 36556                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36557                                  	;;;
 36558                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36559 000060CD 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx
 36560 000060CF 8B16[E80A]              	mov	dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36561                                  	;
 36562 000060D3 52                      	push	dx ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36563                                  	;
 36564 000060D4 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 36565 000060D6 E8D6FF                  	call	IsFAT32
 36566 000060D9 730E                    	jnc	short mapcl1 ; not FAT32
 36567                                  	; FAT32
 36568 000060DB D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 36569 000060DD D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 36570 000060DF D1D7                    	rcl	di,1
 36571 000060E1 D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 36572 000060E3 D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 36573 000060E5 D1D7                    	rcl	di,1
 36574                                  	; DI:DX:AX = 4*(DX:AX)
 36575 000060E7 EB14                    	jmp	short Map16		; 32 bit FAT	
 36576                                  mapcl1:
 36577                                  	;;;
 36578 000060E9 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10  ; MZ 16 bit fat?
 36579                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36580                                  	;JAE	short Map16		; MZ yes, do 16 bit algorithm
 36581                                  	;SHR	AX,1			; AX = BX/2
 36582                                  	;
 36583                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36584                                  	;;;
 36585 000060EF 7304                    	jae	short mapcl2		; 16 bit FAT
 36586                                  	; 12 bit FAT
 36587 000060F1 D1EA                    	shr	dx,1
 36588 000060F3 D1D8                    	rcr     ax,1
 36589                                  mapcl2:
 36590 000060F5 01D8                    	add     ax,bx
 36591 000060F7 1316[E80A]              	adc     dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36592 000060FB 11FF                    	adc	di,di
 36593                                  	;;;
 36594                                  Map16:	
 36595                                  
 36596                                  ; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36597                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36598                                  %if 0
 36599                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; MZ skip prev => AX=2*BX
 36600                                  	XOR	DI,DI ; *		; >32mb fat ;AN000;
 36601                                  	
 36602                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36603                                  	ADD	AX,BX			; AX = 1.5*fat = byte offset in fat
 36604                                  	ADC	DI,DI ; * MSDOS 6.0	; >32mb fat ;DI is zero before op;AN000;
 36605                                  %endif
 36606                                  
 36607 000060FD 268B4E02                	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 36608                                  
 36609                                  ;IF FastDiv
 36610                                  ;
 36611                                  ; Gross hack: 99% of all disks have 512 bytes per sector. We test for this
 36612                                  ; case and apply a really fast algorithm to get the desired results
 36613                                  ;
 36614                                  ; Divide method takes 157+4*4=173 (MOV and DIV)
 36615                                  ; Fast method takes 39+20*4=119
 36616                                  ;
 36617                                  ; This saves a bunch.
 36618                                  
 36619 00006101 81F90002                	CMP	CX,512			; 4  Is this 512 byte sector?
 36620 00006105 751C                    	jne	short _DoDiv		; 4  for no jump
 36621                                  
 36622                                  ; 02/04/2024
 36623                                  %if 0
 36624                                  	MOV	DX,AX			; 2  get set for remainder
 36625                                  	AND	DX,512-1		; 4  Form remainder
 36626                                  	MOV	AL,AH			; 2  Quotient in formation in AL
 36627                                  	; MDOS 3.3
 36628                                  	;shr	al,1
 36629                                  	; MDOS 6.0
 36630                                  	shr	di,1			; 2
 36631                                  	rcr	al,1			; 2
 36632                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36633                                  	xor	ah,ah			; 3
 36634                                  %else
 36635                                  	; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36636                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36637                                  	;;;
 36638 00006107 50                      	push	ax
 36639 00006108 D1EF                    	shr	di,1
 36640 0000610A D1DA                    	rcr	dx,1
 36641 0000610C D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 36642 0000610E 88E0                    	mov	al,ah			; 9 bit shift to right
 36643 00006110 88D4                    	mov	ah,dl
 36644 00006112 88F2                    	mov	dl,dh
 36645 00006114 30F6                    	xor	dh,dh
 36646 00006116 D1EF                    	shr	di,1
 36647 00006118 10F6                    	adc	dh,dh
 36648 0000611A 87FA                    	xchg	dx,di		; DI:AX = sector contains requested cluster data
 36649 0000611C 5A                      	pop	dx
 36650 0000611D 81E2FF01                	and	dx,1FFh			; offset in sector
 36651                                  	;;;
 36652                                  %endif
 36653 00006121 EB07                    	jmp	short DivDone		; 16
 36654                                  
 36655                                  _DoDiv:
 36656                                  ;ENDIF
 36657                                  
 36658                                  ; 02/04/2024
 36659                                  %if 0
 36660                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 36661                                  	;xor	dx,dx
 36662                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36663                                  	mov	dx,di			; 2
 36664                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36665                                  	DIV	CX			; 155 AX is FAT sector # DX is sector index
 36666                                  %else
 36667                                  	; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36668                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36669                                  	;;;
 36670 00006123 97                      	xchg	ax,di
 36671 00006124 92                      	xchg	ax,dx
 36672 00006125 F7F1                    	div	cx
 36673 00006127 97                      	xchg	ax,di
 36674 00006128 F7F1                    	div	cx
 36675                                  	;jmp	short DivDone
 36676                                  	;;;
 36677                                  %endif
 36678                                  
 36679                                  ;IF FastDiv
 36680                                  DivDone:
 36681                                  ;ENDIF
 36682                                  	;add	ax,[es:bp+6]
 36683 0000612A 26034606                	ADD	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]
 36684                                  	
 36685                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36686                                  	;;;
 36687 0000612E 83D700                  	adc	di,0
 36688                                  	;;;
 36689                                  
 36690 00006131 49                      	DEC	CX			; CX is sector size - 1
 36691                                  
 36692                                  	;SAVE	<AX,DX,CX>
 36693                                  
 36694                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36695                                  	;;;
 36696 00006132 57                      	push	di ; 4*
 36697                                  	;;;
 36698 00006133 50                      	push	ax ; 3*
 36699 00006134 52                      	push	dx ; 2*

 36701

 36703

 36705                                  	; mov [HIGH_SECTOR],di ; *!* ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36706 00006138 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 36707                                  	;
 36708                                  
 36709                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36710                                  	; 22/09/2023
 36711                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb  low sector #
 36712                                  	;
 36713                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)

 36717                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 36718                                  	; 22/09/2023
 36719 0000613A E83D04                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *! ; *!* ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36720

 36725                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 36728                                  	;;;

 36734                                  	;;lea	di,[si+20] ; MSDOS 6.0

 36738 0000614C 39C8                    	CMP	AX,CX
 36739 0000614E 7530                    	JNZ	short MAPRET	; ds<>ss

 36784                                  	;;;

 36815                                  	;;;
