 36832                                  ;Break	<FATREAD_SFT/FATREAD_CDS -- CHECK DRIVE GET FAT>
 36833                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36834                                  ;
 36835                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_SFT
 36836                                  ;
 36837                                  ; Inputs:
 36838                                  ;	ES:DI points to an SFT for the drive of interest (local only,
 36839                                  ;		giving a NET SFT will produce system crashing results).
 36840                                  ;	DS DOSDATA
 36841                                  ; Function:
 36842                                  ;	Can be used by an SFT routine (like CLOSE) to invalidate buffers
 36843                                  ;	if disk changed.
 36844                                  ;	In other respects, same as FATREAD_CDS.
 36845                                  ;	(note ES:DI destroyed!)
 36846                                  ; Outputs:
 36847                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36848                                  ; NOTE: This routine may cause FATREAD_CDS to "miss" a disk change
 36849                                  ;	as far as invalidating curdir_ID is concerned.
 36850                                  ;	Since getting a true disk changed on this call is a screw up
 36851                                  ;	anyway, that's the way it goes.
 36852                                  ;
 36853                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36854                                  
 36855                                  FATREAD_SFT:
 36856 000061A6 26C46D07                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]
 36857                                  
 36858                                  fatread_gotdpb:	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36859                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36860                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 36861                                  	; 15/12/2022
 36862 000061AA 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 36863 000061AE A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 36864 000061B1 E8C2A4                  	call	GOTDPB			; Set THISDPB
 36865                                  	;CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36866                                  	; 17/12/2022
 36867 000061B4 E99C00                  	jmp	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36868                                  ;fatread_sft_retn:
 36869                                  	;retn
 36870                                  
 36871                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36872                                  ;
 36873                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_CDS
 36874                                  ;
 36875                                  ; Inputs:
 36876                                  ;	DS:DOSDATA
 36877                                  ;	ES:DI points to an CDS for the drive of interest (local only,
 36878                                  ;		giving a NET or NUL CDS will produce system crashing results).
 36879                                  ; Function:
 36880                                  ;	If disk may have been changed, media is determined and buffers are
 36881                                  ;	flagged invalid. If not, no action is taken.
 36882                                  ; Outputs:
 36883                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameter block
 36884                                  ;	THISDPB = ES:BP
 36885                                  ;	THISDRV set
 36886                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36887                                  ; DS preserved , all other registers destroyed
 36888                                  ;
 36889                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36890                                  
 36891                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36892                                  	; DOSCODE:96C5h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36893                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36894                                  	; DOSCODE:9669h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36895                                  
 36896                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36897                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A6D8h
 36898                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C644h)
 36899                                  
 36900                                  FATREAD_CDS:
 36901 000061B7 06                      	PUSH	ES
 36902 000061B8 57                      	PUSH	DI
 36903                                  
 36904                                  	;les	bp,[es:di+45h]
 36905 000061B9 26C46D45                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36906                                  
 36907                                  ; 03/03/2024
 36908                                  %if 0
 36909                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36910                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 36911                                  	; 15/12/2022
 36912                                  	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 36913                                  	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 36914                                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 36915                                  	CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36916                                  %else
 36917                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36918                                  	;;;
 36919 000061BD E8EAFF                  	call	fatread_gotdpb
 36920                                  	;;;
 36921                                  %endif
 36922 000061C0 5F                      	POP	DI			;Get back CDS pointer
 36923 000061C1 07                      	POP	ES
 36924 000061C2 72E1                    	jc	short fatread_sft_retn
 36925 000061C4 7542                    	JNZ	short NO_CHANGE		;Media NOT changed
 36926                                  
 36927                                  ;	Media changed. We now need to find all CDS structures which use this
 36928                                  ;	DPB and invalidate their ID pointers.
 36929                                  
 36930                                  MED_CHANGE:
 36931                                  	;XOR	AX,AX
 36932                                  	;DEC	AX			; AX = -1
 36933                                  	; 03/03/2024
 36934 000061C6 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh ; -1
 36935                                  	
 36936 000061C9 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 36937 000061CA 8A0E[4700]              	MOV	CL,[CDSCOUNT]
 36938 000061CE 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH			; CX is number of structures
 36939                                  	;lds	si,[es:di+45h]
 36940 000061D0 26C57545                	LDS	SI,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr] ; Find all CDS with this devptr
 36941                                  
 36942                                  ;hkn; SS override
 36943                                  
 36944                                  ;	Find all CDSs with this DevPtr
 36945                                  ;
 36946                                  ;	(ax) = -1
 36947                                  ;	(ds:si) = DevPtr
 36948                                  
 36949 000061D4 36C43E[3C00]            	LES	DI,[SS:CDSADDR]		; (es:di) = CDS pointer
 36950                                  frcd20: 
 36951                                  	;;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 36952                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 36953 000061D9 26F6454480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 36954 000061DE 7522                    	JNZ	short frcd25		; Leave NET guys alone!!
 36955                                  
 36956                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 36957                                  	;push	es
 36958                                  	;push	di
 36959                                  	;les	di,[es:di+45h]
 36960                                  	;;les	di,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36961                                  	;call	POINTCOMP
 36962                                  	;pop	di
 36963                                  	;pop	es
 36964                                  	;jnz	short frcd25
 36965                                  
 36966                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36967 000061E0 263B7545                	cmp	si,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36968 000061E4 751C                    	jne	short frcd25		; no match
 36969 000061E6 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds
 36970 000061E8 263B5D47                	cmp	bx,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr+2]
 36971 000061EC 7514                    	jne	short frcd25		; CDS not for this drive
 36972                                  
 36973                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36974                                  	;test	[es:di+49h],ax	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A70Fh

 36976                                  	;JZ	short frcd25 ; = 0	; If root (0), leave root
 36977                                  		; !!! test es:[di+49h],ax
 36978                                  		; !!! jz short frcd25	
 36979                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM bug (!?) ; Erdogan Tan - 03/03/2024
 36980                                  		; test dword ptr es:[di+49h],-1 ; Win ME - BIOSCODE:0C694h
 36981                                  		; jz short frcd25
 36982                                  		;
 36983                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36984 000061F2 7506                    	jnz	short frcd24
 36985

 36987                                  	;;;
 36988                                  	;test	[es:di+4Bh],ax

 36990 000061F8 7408                    	jz	short frcd25 ; = 0
 36991                                  frcd24:		; 03/03/2024
 36992                                  	;;;
 36993                                  	;mov	[es:di+49h],ax
 36994 000061FA 26894549                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX	; else invalid
 36995                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36996                                  	;;;
 36997                                  	;mov	[es:di+4Bh],ax
 36998 000061FE 2689454B                	mov	[es:di+curdir.ID+2],ax ; -1
 36999                                  	;;;
 37000                                  frcd25:	
 37001                                  	;;add	di,81  ; MSDOS 3.3
 37002                                  	;add	di,88  ; MSDOS 6.0	 
 37003 00006202 83C758                  	ADD	DI,curdir.size		; Point to next CDS
 37004 00006205 E2D2                    	LOOP	frcd20
 37005 00006207 1F                      	POP	DS
 37006                                  NO_CHANGE:
 37007 00006208 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 37008 0000620C F8                      	CLC
 37009 0000620D C3                      	retn
 37010                                  
 37011                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E =======================================
 37012                                  ; 05/01/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 37013                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A7Fh
 37014                                  ;;;
 37015                                  chk_set_first_access:
 37016                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0
 37017 0000620E 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0
 37018 00006213 750D                    	jnz	short chk_set_fa_1	; FAT (FAT12 or FAT16)
 37019                                  	; FAT32
 37020                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh
 37021 00006215 26837E21FF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT_HW],0FFFFh ; -1

 37028                                  chk_set_fa_2:

 37030 00006227 26C7461FFFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh ; -1
 37031 0000622D 7405                    	je	short chk_set_fa_3
 37032                                  	;or	byte [es:bp+18h],1
 37033 0000622F 26804E1801              	or	byte [es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],1
 37034                                  chk_set_fa_3:
 37035 00006234 C3                      	retn
 37036                                  ;;;

 37043                                  ; Procedure Name : FAT_operation
 37044                                  ;

 37046                                  
 37047                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 37050                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37051                                  
 37052                                  FAT_operation:
 37053                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37054                                  FATERR:
 37055                                  
 37056                                  ; 03/03/2024
 37057                                  %if 0
 37058                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 37059                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 37060                                  	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 
 37061                                  					; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 37062                                  %else
 37063                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37064                                  	;;;
 37065 00006235 E8D6FF                  	call    chk_set_first_access
 37066                                  	;;;
 37067                                  %endif
 37068                                  	;and	di,0FFh

 37738                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 37742                                  ;
 37743                                  ;CODE	SEGMENT BYTE PUBLIC  'CODE'
 37744                                  ;       ASSUME  SS:DOSGROUP,CS:DOSGROUP
 37745                                  ;
 37746                                  ;SUBTTL SETVISIT,SKIPVISIT -- MANAGE BUFFER SCANS
 37747                                  ;
 37748                                  ;SETVISIT:
 37749                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37750                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CAFh
 37751                                  ;; Inputs:
 37752                                  ;;      None
 37753                                  ;; Function:
 37754                                  ;;      Set up a scan of I/O buffers
 37755                                  ;; Outputs:
 37756                                  ;;      All visit flags = 0
 37757                                  ;;              NOTE: This pre-scan is needed because a hard disk error
 37758                                  ;;                    may cause a scan to stop in the middle leaving some
 37759                                  ;;                    visit flags set, and some not set.
 37760                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to [BUFFHEAD]
 37761                                  ;; No other registers altered
 37762                                  ;
 37763                                  ;       LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 37764                                  ;	PUSH    AX
 37765                                  ;       ;;XOR	AX,AX	  ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37766                                  ;	;mov	al,0DFh
 37767                                  ;	mov	al,~buf_visit
 37768                                  ;SETLOOP:
 37769                                  ;       ;;MOV	[DI+7],AL ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37770                                  ;	;and	[DI+5],al
 37771                                  ;	AND	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],AL
 37772                                  ;       LDS     DI,[DI]
 37773                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 37774                                  ;       JNZ     SHORT SETLOOP
 37775                                  ;       POP     AX ; 09/09/2018
 37776                                  ;	LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 37777                                  ;SVISIT_RETN:
 37778                                  ;       RETN
 37779                                  ;
 37780                                  ;SKIPVISIT:
 37781                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37782                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CC8h
 37783                                  ;
 37784                                  ;; Inputs:
 37785                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to a buffer
 37786                                  ;; Function:
 37787                                  ;;      Skip visited buffers
 37788                                  ;; Outputs:
 37789                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to next unvisited buffer
 37790                                  ;;      Zero is set if skip to LAST buffer
 37791                                  ;; No other registers altered
 37792                                  ;
 37793                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 37794                                  ;       ;retz
 37795                                  ;       JZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 37796                                  ;
 37797                                  ;	;;CMP	BYTE [DI+7],1 ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37798                                  ;       ;;;retnz
 37799                                  ;       ;;JNZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 37800                                  ;
 37801                                  ;	;test	byte [di+5],20h
 37802                                  ;	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_visit	
 37803                                  ;	JNZ	short SKIPLOOP
 37804                                  ;	
 37805                                  ;	push	ax
 37806                                  ;	or	al,1
 37807                                  ;	pop	ax
 37808                                  ;	retn	
 37809                                  ;
 37810                                  ;SKIPLOOP:
 37811                                  ;	LDS     DI,[DI]
 37812                                  ;       JMP     SHORT SKIPVISIT

 37822                                  ;	NAME	BUF

 37824                                  ;**	BUF.ASM - Low level routines for buffer cache management
 37825                                  ;
 37826                                  ;	GETCURHEAD

 37829                                  ;	PLACEHEAD

 37837                                  ;	Revision history:
 37838                                  ;
 37839                                  ;		AN000  version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 37840                                  ;		A004   PTM 3765 -- Disk reset failed
 37841                                  ;		M039 DB 10/17/90 - Disk write optimization
 37842                                  ;		I001   5.0 PTR 722211 - Preserve CY when in buffer in HMA

 37844                                  ;Break	<GETCURHEAD -- Get current buffer header>
 37845                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37846                                  ; Procedure Name : GetCurHead
 37847                                  ; Inputs:
 37848                                  ;	 No Inputs
 37849                                  ; Function:
 37850                                  ;	Returns the pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 37851                                  ;	and updates FIRST_BUFF_ADDR
 37852                                  ;       and invalidates LASTBUFFER (recency pointer)
 37853                                  ; Outputs:
 37854                                  ;	DS:DI = pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 37855                                  ;	FIRST_BUFF_ADDR = offset ( DI ) of First buffer in Queue
 37856                                  ;       LASTBUFFER = -1
 37857                                  ; No other registers altered
 37858                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37859                                  
 37860                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37861                                  ; DOSCODE:98D2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37862                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37863                                  ; DOSCODE:9876h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37864                                  
 37865                                  ; 06/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37866                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0AA4Bh
 37867                                  
 37868                                  GETCURHEAD:
 37869 00006515 36C53E[6D00]            	lds	di,[ss:BufferQueue]	; Pointer to the first buffer
 37870 0000651A 36C706[1E00]FFFF        	mov	word [ss:LastBuffer],-1	; invalidate last buffer
 37871 00006521 36893E[1711]            	mov	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di	; save first buffer address
 37872 00006526 C3                      	retn
 37873                                  
 37874                                  ;Break	<SCANPLACE, PLACEBUF -- PUT A BUFFER BACK IN THE POOL>
 37875                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37876                                  ; Procedure Name : ScanPlace
 37877                                  ; Inputs:
 37878                                  ;	Same as PLACEBUF
 37879                                  ; Function:
 37880                                  ;	Save scan location and call PLACEBUF
 37881                                  ; Outputs:
 37882                                  ;	DS:DI Points to saved scan location
 37883                                  ; All registers, except DS:DI, preserved.
 37884                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37885                                  ;M039: Rewritten to preserve registers.
 37886                                  
 37887                                  ;SCANPLACE:
 37888                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37889                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5DDCh
 37890                                  ;	push	es
 37891                                  ;	les	si,[di]
 37892                                  ;	;les	si,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_link]
 37893                                  ;	call	PLACEBUF
 37894                                  ;	push	es
 37895                                  ;	pop	ds
 37896                                  ;	mov	di,si
 37897                                  ;	pop	es
 37898                                  ;scanplace_retn:
 37899                                  ;	retn	
 37900                                  	
 37901                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37902                                  SCANPLACE:
 37903 00006527 FF35                    	push	word [di]
 37904                                  	;push	word [di+BUFFINFO.buf_next] ;Save scan location
 37905 00006529 E80200                  	call	PLACEBUF
 37906 0000652C 5F                      	pop	di
 37907 0000652D C3                      	retn
 37908                                  
 37909                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37910                                  ; Procedure Name : PlaceBuf
 37911                                  ; Input:
 37912                                  ;	DS:DI points to buffer (DS->BUFFINFO array, DI=offset in array)
 37913                                  ; Function:
 37914                                  ;	Remove buffer from queue and re-insert it in proper place.
 37915                                  ; NO registers altered
 37916                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37917                                  
 37918                                  ;procedure PLACEBUF,NEAR
 37919                                  
 37920                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37921                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37922                                  PLACEBUF:
 37923                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37924                                  
 37925                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37926 0000652E 50                      	push	AX			;Save only regs we modify	;AN000;
 37927 0000652F 53                      	push	BX							;AN000;
 37928                                  	; 23/09/2023
 37929                                  	;push	SI							;AN000;
 37930                                  	
 37931 00006530 8B05                    	mov	ax,[di]
 37932                                  	;mov	ax,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]
 37933 00006532 368B1E[6D00]            	mov	bx,[ss:BufferQueue]	; bx = offset of head of list;smr;SS Override
 37934                                  	
 37935 00006537 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx				;Buf = last?		;AN000;
 37936 00006539 7422                    	je	short nret			;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 37937 0000653B 39DF                    	cmp	di,bx				;Buf = first?		;AN000;
 37938 0000653D 7506                    	jne	short not_first 		;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 37939 0000653F 36A3[6D00]              	mov	[ss:BufferQueue],ax		;smr;SS Override
 37940 00006543 EB18                    	jmp	short nret 			;Continue with repositioning;AN000;
 37941                                  not_first:
 37942                                  	; 23/09/2023
 37943 00006545 56                      	push	si
 37944                                  	;mov	si,[di+2]
 37945 00006546 8B7502                  	mov	SI,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_prev]	;No, SI = prior Buf	;AN000;
 37946 00006549 8904                    	mov	[si],ax
 37947                                  	;mov	[SI+BUFFINFO.buf_next],AX	; ax has di->buf_next	;AN000;
 37948 0000654B 96                      	xchg	si,ax
 37949                                  	;mov	[si+2],ax
 37950 0000654C 894402                  	mov	[SI+BUFFINFO.buf_prev],AX	;			;AN000;
 37951                                  	
 37952 0000654F 8B7702                  	mov	SI,[BX+BUFFINFO.buf_prev]	;SI-> last buffer	;AN000;
 37953 00006552 893C                    	mov	[si],di
 37954                                  	;mov	[SI+BUFFINFO.buf_next],DI	;Add Buf to end of list ;AN000;
 37955 00006554 897F02                  	mov	[BX+BUFFINFO.buf_prev],DI				;AN000;

 38100                                  ;Break	<POINTCOMP -- 20 BIT POINTER COMPARE>
 38101                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38102                                  ;
 38103                                  ; Procedure Name : PointComp
 38104                                  ; Inputs:
 38105                                  ;         DS:SI & ES:DI
 38106                                  ; Function:
 38107                                  ;          Checks for ((SI==DI) && (ES==DS))
 38108                                  ;	   Assumes that pointers are normalized for the
 38109                                  ;	   same segment
 38110                                  ;
 38111                                  ; Compare DS:SI to ES:DI (or DS:DI to ES:SI) for equality
 38112                                  ; DO NOT USE FOR < or >
 38113                                  ; No Registers altered
 38114                                  ;
 38115                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38116                                  
 38117                                  POINTCOMP:
 38118                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38119                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D84h
 38120 0000656B 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 38121 0000656D 750A                    	jnz	short _ret_label	; return if nz
 38122                                  	;jnz	short placehead_retn 
 38123 0000656F 51                      	PUSH	CX
 38124 00006570 52                      	PUSH	DX
 38125 00006571 8CD9                    	MOV	CX,DS
 38126 00006573 8CC2                    	MOV	DX,ES
 38127 00006575 39D1                    	CMP	CX,DX
 38128 00006577 5A                      	POP	DX
 38129 00006578 59                      	POP	CX
 38130                                  _ret_label:
 38131 00006579 C3                      	retn

 38133                                  ; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38134                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D93h 
 38135                                  
 38136                                  ;Break	<GETBUFFR, GETBUFFRB -- GET A SECTOR INTO A BUFFER>
 38137                                  
 38138                                  ;**	GetBuffr - Get a non-FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38139                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38140                                  ;	GetBuffr does normal ( non-FAT ) sector buffering
 38141                                  ;	It gets the specified local sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38142                                  ;	and shuffles the queue
 38143                                  ; 
 38144                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38145                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38146                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	      (LOW)
 38147                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38148                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38149                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38150                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38151                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38152                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38153                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38154                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38155                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38156                                  
 38157                                  ;**	GetBuffrb - Get a FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38158                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38159                                  ;	GetBuffrb reads a sector from the FAT file system's FAT table.
 38160                                  ;	It gets the specified sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38161                                  ;	and shuffles the queue. We need a special entry point so that
 38162                                  ;	we can read the alternate FAT sector if the first read fails, also
 38163                                  ;	so we can mark the buffer as a FAT sector.
 38164                                  ; 
 38165                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38166                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38167                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	     (LOW)
 38168                                  ;		(SI) != 0
 38169                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38170                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38171                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38172                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38173                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38174                                  ;		CUR ddBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38175                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38176                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38177                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38178                                  
 38179                                  	; 22/09/2023 - RetroDOS v4.2 MSDOS.SYS (optimization)

 38850                                  ;Break	<BUFWRITE -- WRITE OUT A BUFFER IF DIRTY>
 38851                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38852                                  ;
 38853                                  ;	BufWrite writes a buffer to the disk, if it's dirty.
 38854                                  ;
 38855                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:DI Points to the buffer
 38856                                  ;

 38858                                  ;		Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 38859                                  ;
 38860                                  ;	USES	All buf DS:DI
 38861                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR

 38863                                  
 38864                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 38865                                  	; DOSCODE:9AA0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)

 39158                                  ;============================================================================
 39159                                  ; MSPROC.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1992
 39160                                  ;============================================================================
 39161                                  ; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39162                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39163                                  ; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 39164                                  
 39165                                  ; (15/04/2018 - RetrO DOS v2.0, MSDOS 2.11 - PROC.ASM - 1983)
 39166                                  
 39167                                  ; Pseudo EXEC system call for DOS
 39168                                  
 39169                                  ;	TITLE	MSPROC - process maintenance
 39170                                  ;	NAME	MSPROC
 39171                                  
 39172                                  ; =========================================================================
 39173                                  ;**	Process related system calls and low level routines for DOS 2.X.
 39174                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 39175                                  ;
 39176                                  ;	$WAIT
 39177                                  ;	$EXEC
 39178                                  ;	$Keep_process
 39179                                  ;	Stay_resident
 39180                                  ;	$EXIT
 39181                                  ;	$ABORT
 39182                                  ;	abort_inner
 39183                                  ;
 39184                                  ;	Modification history:
 39185                                  ;
 39186                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 39187                                  ;		AN000	version 4.0 jan. 1988
 39188                                  ;		A007	PTM 3957 - fake vesrion for IBMCACHE.COM
 39189                                  ;		A008	PTM 4070 - fake version for MS WINDOWS
 39190                                  ;
 39191                                  ;		M000	added support for loading programs into UMBs 7/9/90
 39192                                  ;
 39193                                  ;		M004 - MS PASCAL 3.2 support. Please see under tag M003 in 
 39194                                  ;		       dossym.inc. 7/30/90
 39195                                  ;		M005 - Support for EXE programs with out STACK segment and 
 39196                                  ;		       with resident size < 64K - 256 bytes. A 256 byte 
 39197                                  ;		       stack is provided at the end of the program. Note that
 39198                                  ;		       only SP is changed.
 39199                                  ;		M020 - Fix for Rational bug for details see exepatch.asm
 39200                                  ;
 39201                                  ;		M028 - 4b04 implementation
 39202                                  ;
 39203                                  ;		M029 - Support for EXEs without stack rewritten. If EXE is
 39204                                  ;			in memory block >= 64K, sp = 0. If memory block
 39205                                  ;			obtained is <64K, point sp at the end of the memory
 39206                                  ;			block. For EXEs smaller than 64K, 256 bytes are still
 39207                                  ;			added for a stack segment which may be needed if it
 39208                                  ;			is loaded in low memory situations.
 39209                                  ;
 39210                                  ;		M030 - Fixing bug in EXEPACPATCH & changing 4b04 to 4b05
 39211                                  ;
 39212                                  ;		M040 - Bug #3052. The environment sizing code would flag a
 39213                                  ;			a bad environment if it reached 32767 bytes. Changed
 39214                                  ;			to allow 32768 bytes of environment.
 39215                                  ;
 39216                                  ;		M047 - Release the allocated UMB when we failed to load a 
 39217                                  ;		       COM file high. Also ensure that if the biggest block
 39218                                  ;		       into which we load the com file is less than 64K then
 39219                                  ;		       we provide atleast 256 bytes of stack to the user.
 39220                                  ;
 39221                                  ;		M050 - Made Lie table search CASE insensitive
 39222                                  ;
 39223                                  ;		M060 - Removed special version table from the kernal and
 39224                                  ;                      put it in a device drive which puts the address
 39225                                  ;                      in the DOS DATA area location UU_IFS_DOS_CALL
 39226                                  ;		       as a DWORD.
 39227                                  ;
 39228                                  ;		M063 - Modified UMB support. If the HIGH_ONLY bit is set on
 39229                                  ;		       entry do not try to load low if there is no space in
 39230                                  ;		       UMBs.
 39231                                  ;
 39232                                  ;		M068 - Support for copy protect apps. Call ChkCopyProt to 
 39233                                  ;		       set a20off_count. Set bit EXECA20BIT in DOS_FLAG. Also
 39234                                  ;		       change return address to LeaveDos if AL=5.
 39235                                  ;
 39236                                  ;               20-Jul-1992 bens  Added ifdef RESTRICTED_BUILD code that
 39237                                  ;                      controls building a version of MSDOS.SYS that only
 39238                                  ;                      runs programs from a fixed list (defined in the
 39239                                  ;                      file RESTRICT.INC).  Search for "RESTRICTED_BUILD"
 39240                                  ;                      for details.  This feature is used to build a
 39241                                  ;                      "special" version of DOS that can be handed out to
 39242                                  ;                      OEM/ISV customers as part of a "service" disk.
 39243                                  ;
 39244                                  ; =========================================================================
 39245                                  
 39246                                  ;SAVEXIT  EQU  10
 39247                                  
 39248                                  ;BREAK	<$WAIT - return previous process error code>
 39249                                  ; =========================================================================
 39250                                  ;	$WAIT - Return previous process error code.
 39251                                  ;
 39252                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 39253                                  ;
 39254                                  ;	    MOV     AH, WaitProcess
 39255                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 39256                                  ;
 39257                                  ;	ENTRY	none
 39258                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = exit code
 39259                                  ;	USES	all
 39260                                  ; =========================================================================
 39261                                  
 39262                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39263                                  	; DOSCODE:9B55h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 39264                                  
 39265                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39266                                  	; DOSCODE:9A5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 39267                                  
 39268                                  	; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 39269                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0AD78h	
 39270                                  
 39271                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:9B55h)
 39272                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:944Ch)
 39273                                  
 39274                                  _$WAIT:
 39275                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39276                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E1h
 39277                                  
 39278 0000683A 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 39279 0000683C 368706[3403]            	xchg	AX,[ss:exit_code]
 39280 00006841 E93B9E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 39281                                  
 39282                                  ; =========================================================================
 39283                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 39284                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 39285                                  ;
 39286                                  ;
 39287                                  ; Assembler usage:
 39288                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 39289                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 39290                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 39291                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 39292                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 39293                                  ;
 39294                                  ;	AL  Function
 39295                                  ;	--  --------
 39296                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 39297                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 39298                                  ;	    begin execution.
 39299                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 39300                                  ;
 39301                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 39302                                  ;
 39303                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39304                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 39305                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 39306                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39307                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 39308                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 39309                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39310                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39311                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 39312                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39313                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39314                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 39315                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39316                                  ;
 39317                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 39318                                  ;
 39319                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39320                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 39321                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 39322                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39323                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 39324                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 39325                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39326                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39327                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 39328                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39329                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39330                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 39331                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39332                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 39333                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 39334                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39335                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 39336                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 39337                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39338                                  ;
 39339                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 39340                                  ;
 39341                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39342                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 39343                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 39344                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39345                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 39346                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 39347                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39348                                  ;
 39349                                  ; Returns:
 39350                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 39351                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 39352                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 39353                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 39354                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found
 39355                                  ; =========================================================================
 39356                                  ;
 39357                                  ;   Revision history:
 39358                                  ;
 39359                                  ;	 A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 39360                                  ;
 39361                                  ; =========================================================================
 39362                                  
 39363                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer		EQU	OPENBUF
 39364                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer_Size	EQU	(128+128+53+curdirLen)
 39365

 39367

 39369                                  ;%out	Please make sure that the following are contiguous and of the
 39370                                  ;%out	following sizes:
 39371                                  ;%out
 39372                                  ;%out	OpenBuf     128
 39373                                  ;%out	RenBuf	    128
 39374                                  ;%out	SearchBuf    53
 39375                                  ;%out	DummyCDS    curdirLen
 39376                                  ;ENDIF

 39397                                  _$EXEC:
 39398                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39399                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5EF1h
 39400                                  
 39401                                  EXEC001S:

 39441                                  	; ==================================================================
 39442                                  	; validate function
 39443                                  	; ==================================================================
 39444                                  		      	
 39445                                  	; M068 - Start
 39446                                  	;
 39447                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a
 39448                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 39449                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep
 39450                                  	; the A20 off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 39451                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 39452                                  
 39453                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39454 00006844 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 39455                                  
 39456                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack
 39457                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 39458                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExecReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 39459                                  
 39460 0000684A 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; Q: is this ExecReady call
 39461                                  	;jne	short @f
 39462 0000684C 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue
 39463                                  					; Y: change ret addr. to LeaveDos.
 39464 0000684E 59                      	pop	cx			; Note CX is not input to ExecReady
 39465 0000684F B9[0A04]                	mov	cx,LeaveDOS
 39466 00006852 51                      	push	cx
 39467                                  ;@@:

 41051                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41052                                  ;SUBTTL Terminate and stay resident handler
 41053                                  ;
 41054                                  ; Input:    DX is an offset from CurrentPDB at which to
 41055                                  ;	    truncate the current block.
 41056                                  ;
 41057                                  ; output:   The current block is truncated (expanded) to be [DX+15]/16
 41058                                  ;	    paragraphs long. An exit is simulated via resetting CurrentPDB
 41059                                  ;	    and restoring the vectors.
 41060                                  ;
 41061                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41062                                  
 41063                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41064                                  	; DOSCODE:A19Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41065                                  
 41066                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41067                                  	; DOSCODE:A13Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41068                                  
 41069                                  	; 09/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 41070                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B3BCh
 41071                                  
 41072                                  _$KEEP_PROCESS:
 41073 00006E50 50                      	push	AX			; keep exit code around
 41074                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 41075 00006E51 36C606[7C05]03          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS
 41076 00006E57 368E06[3003]            	mov	ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]
 41077 00006E5C 83FA06                  	cmp	DX,6h			; keep enough space around for system
 41078 00006E5F 7303                    	jae	short Keep_Shrink	; info
 41079                                  
 41080 00006E61 BA0600                  	mov	DX,6h
 41081                                  
 41082                                  Keep_Shrink:
 41083 00006E64 89D3                    	mov	BX,DX
 41084 00006E66 53                      	push	BX
 41085 00006E67 06                      	push	ES
 41086 00006E68 E82F02                  	call	_$SETBLOCK		; ignore return codes.
 41087 00006E6B 1F                      	pop	DS
 41088 00006E6C 5B                      	pop	BX
 41089 00006E6D 7207                    	jc	short Keep_Done		; failed on modification
 41090                                  
 41091 00006E6F 8CD8                    	mov	AX,DS
 41092 00006E71 01D8                    	add	AX,BX
 41093                                  	;mov	[2],ax
 41094 00006E73 A30200                  	mov	[PDB.BLOCK_LEN],AX	;PBUGBUG
 41095                                  
 41096                                  Keep_Done:
 41097 00006E76 58                      	pop	AX
 41098 00006E77 EB26                    	jmp	SHORT exit_inner	; and let abort take care of the rest
 41099

 41134                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41135                                  	; IBMDOSDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 6375h

 41153                                  
 41154                                  ;BREAK <$ABORT -- Terminate a process>
 41155                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41156                                  ; Inputs:
 41157                                  ;	user_CS:00 must point to valid program header block
 41158                                  ; Function:
 41159                                  ;	Restore terminate and Cntrl-C addresses, flush buffers and transfer
 41160                                  ;	to the terminate address
 41161                                  ; Returns:
 41162                                  ;	TO THE TERMINATE ADDRESS
 41163                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41164                                  
 41165                                  _$ABORT:
 41166 00006EAC 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL
 41167                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],0
 41168                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],AL ; = 0
 41169 00006EAE 36C606[7C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_ABORT
 41170                                  
 41171                                  	; abort_inner must have AL set as the exit code! The exit type
 41172                                  	; is retrieved from exit_type. Also, the PDB at user_CS needs
 41173                                  	; to be correct as the one that is terminating.
 41174                                  
 41175                                  abort_inner:
 41176 00006EB4 368A26[7C05]            	mov	AH,[SS:EXIT_TYPE]
 41177 00006EB9 36A3[3403]              	mov	[SS:exit_code],AX
 41178 00006EBD E8CB95                  	call	Get_User_Stack
 41179                                  
 41180                                  	;mov	ds,[si+14h]
 41181 00006EC0 8E5C14                  	mov	DS,[SI+user_env.user_CS] ; set up old interrupts ;PBUGBUG
 41182 00006EC3 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 41183 00006EC5 8EC0                    	mov	ES,AX
 41184                                  	;mov	si,10
 41185 00006EC7 BE0A00                  	mov	SI,SAVEXIT
 41186                                  	;mov	di,88h
 41187 00006ECA BF8800                  	mov	DI,addr_int_terminate
 41188 00006ECD A5                      	movsw
 41189 00006ECE A5                      	movsw
 41190 00006ECF A5                      	movsw
 41191 00006ED0 A5                      	movsw
 41192 00006ED1 A5                      	movsw
 41193 00006ED2 A5                      	movsw
 41194 00006ED3 E975EF                  	jmp	reset_environment

 41229                                  ;
 41230                                  ;	Memory related system calls and low level routines for MSDOS 2.X.
 41231                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 41232                                  ;
 41233                                  ;	$ALLOC
 41234                                  ;	$SETBLOCK
 41235                                  ;	$DEALLOC
 41236                                  ;	$AllocOper
 41237                                  ;	arena_free_process
 41238                                  ;	arena_next
 41239                                  ;	check_signature
 41240                                  ;	Coalesce
 41241                                  ;
 41242                                  ;	Modification history:
 41243                                  ;
 41244                                  ;	    Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 41245                                  ;
 41246                                  ;	    Revision: M000 - added support for allocing UMBs. 7/9/90
 41247                                  ;		      M003 - added support for link/unlink UMBs from
 41248                                  ;			     DOS arena chain. 7/18/90
 41249                                  ;		      M009 - Added error returns invalid function and 
 41250                                  ;			     arena trashed in set link state call.
 41251                                  ;		      M010 - Release UMB arenas allocated to current PDB
 41252                                  ;			     if UMB_HEAD is initialized.
 41253                                  ;
 41254                                  ;		      M016 - MACE utilities mkeyrate.com version 1.0 
 41255                                  ;			     support. Please see under M009 in 
 41256                                  ;			     ..\inc\dossym.inc. 8/31/90.
 41257                                  ;
 41258                                  ;		      M061 - In GetLastArena, if linking in UMBs check to make
 41259                                  ;			     sure that umb_head arena is valid and also make
 41260                                  ;			     sure that the previous arena is pointing to 
 41261                                  ;			     umb_head.
 41262                                  ;
 41263                                  ;		      M064 - allow HIGH_ONLY bit to be set by a call to 
 41264                                  ;			     set allloc strategy.
 41265                                  ;			     use STRAT_MASK to mask out bits 6 & 7 of 
 41266                                  ;			     bx in AllocSetStrat.
 41267                                  ;
 41268                                  ;		      M068 - use a count value (A20OFF_COUNT) rather than
 41269                                  ;			     a bit to indicate to dos dispatcher to turn
 41270                                  ;			     a20 off before iret. See M016.

 41390                                  ;**	Arena_Next - Find Next item in Arena
 41391                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41392                                  ;	ENTRY	DS - pointer to block head
 41393                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41394                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 41395                                  ;		'C' set iff arena damaged
 41396                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41397                                  
 41398                                  arena_next:
 41399 00006F10 8CD8                            MOV     AX,DS                   ; AX <- current block
 41400 00006F12 03060300                        ADD     AX,[ARENA.SIZE]		; AX <- AX + current block length
 41401 00006F16 40                              INC     AX                      ; remember that header!
 41402                                  
 41403                                  ;       fall into check_signature and return
 41404                                  ;
 41405                                  ;       CALL    check_signature         ; ES <- AX, carry set if error
 41406                                  ;       RETN
 41407                                  
 41408                                  ;**	Check_Signature - Check Memory Block Signature
 41409                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41410                                  ;	ENTRY	(AX) = address of block header
 41411                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41412                                  ;	EXIT	 ES = AX
 41413                                  ;		'C' clear if signature good
 41414                                  ;		'C' set if signature bad
 41415                                  ;	USES	ES, Flags
 41416                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41417                                  
 41418                                  check_signature:        
 41419                                  
 41420 00006F17 8EC0                    	MOV     ES,AX                   ; ES <- AX
 41421                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di],4Dh ; 'M'
 41422 00006F19 26803D4D                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_normal
 41423                                                                          ; IF next signature = not_end THEN
 41424 00006F1D 7407                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 41425                                  	;cmp 	byte [es:di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 41426 00006F1F 26803D5A                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_end
 41427                                                                          ; IF next signature = end then
 41428 00006F23 7401                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 41429 00006F25 F9                              STC                             ; set error
 41430                                  ret_label: ; MSDOS 6.0
 41431                                  ;AFP_RETN:	; 10/03/2024
 41432                                   	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 41433                                  check_signature_ok:
 41434                                  COALESCE_RETN:
 41435 00006F26 C3                      	RETN
 41436                                  
 41437                                  ;**	Coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 41438                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41439                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 41440                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 41441                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 41442                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 41443                                  ;
 41444                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds) = pointer to the head of a free block
 41445                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41446                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 41447                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 41448                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 41449                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 41450                                  ;	USES	(cx)
 41451                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41452                                          
 41453                                  Coalesce:
 41454                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 41455 00006F27 803D5A                  	CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 41456                                                                          ; IF current signature = END THEN
 41457                                          ;retz				;   GOTO ok
 41458 00006F2A 74FA                            jz	short COALESCE_RETN
 41459 00006F2C E8E1FF                  	CALL    arena_next              ; ES, AX <- next block, Carry set if error
 41460                                          ;retc				; IF no error THEN GOTO check
 41461 00006F2F 72F5                    	jc	short COALESCE_RETN
 41462                                  
 41463                                  coalesce_check:
 41464                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 41465 00006F31 26393E0100                      CMP     [ES:ARENA.OWNER],DI
 41466                                          ;retnz				; IF next block isnt free THEN return
 41467 00006F36 75EE                            JNZ	SHORT COALESCE_RETN
 41468                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:3]
 41469 00006F38 268B0E0300              	MOV     CX,[ES:ARENA.SIZE]	; CX <- next block size
 41470 00006F3D 41                              INC     CX                      ; CX <- CX + 1 (for header size)
 41471                                          ;ADD	[3],CX
 41472 00006F3E 010E0300                	ADD     [ARENA.SIZE],CX		; current size <- current size + CX
 41473 00006F42 268A0D                          MOV     CL,[ES:DI]              ; move up signature
 41474 00006F45 880D                            MOV     [DI],CL
 41475 00006F47 EBDE                            JMP     SHORT Coalesce		; try again

 41477                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41478                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 641Fh
 41479                                  
 41480                                  ;	BREAK  <$Alloc - allocate space in memory>
 41481                                  
 41482                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 41483                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41484                                  ;**	$Alloc - Allocate Memory Space
 41485                                  ;
 41486                                  ;	$Alloc services the INT21 that allocates memory space to a program.
 41487                                  ;	Alloc returns a pointer to a free block of memory that
 41488                                  ;	has the requested size in paragraphs.
 41489                                  ;
 41490                                  ;	If the allocation strategy is HIGH_FIRST or HIGH_ONLY memory is 
 41491                                  ;	scanned from umb_head if not from arena_head. If the strategy is
 41492                                  ; 	HIGH_FIRST the scan is continued from arena_head if a block of 
 41493                                  ;	appropriate size is not found in the UMBs. If the strategy is 
 41494                                  ;	HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY only the UMBs are scanned for memory.
 41495                                  ;
 41496                                  ;	In either case if bit 0 of UmbFlag is not initialized then the scan
 41497                                  ;	starts from arena_head.
 41498                                  ;
 41499                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 41500                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 41501                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 41502                                  ;           INT     21h
 41503                                  ;
 41504                                  ;	BUGBUG - a lot can be done to improve performance. We can set marks
 41505                                  ;	so that we start searching the arena at it's first non-trivial free
 41506                                  ;	block, we can peephole the code, etc. (We can move some subr calls
 41507                                  ;	inline, etc.) I assume that this is called rarely and that the arena
 41508                                  ;	doesn't have too many memory objects in it beyond the first free one.
 41509                                  ;	verify that this is true; if so, this can stay as is
 41510                                  ;
 41511                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = requested size, in bytes
 41512                                  ;		(DS) = (ES) = DOSGROUP
 41513                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if memory allocated
 41514                                  ;		  (ax:0) = address of requested memory
 41515                                  ;		'C' set if request failed
 41516                                  ;		  (AX) = error_not_enough_memory
 41517                                  ;		    (bx) = max size we could have allocated
 41518                                  ;		  (ax) = error_arena_trashed
 41519                                  ;	USES	All
 41520                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41521                                  
 41522                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 41523                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41524                                  ;SUBTTL $Alloc - allocate space in memory
 41525                                  ;
 41526                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 41527                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 41528                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 41529                                  ;           INT     21h
 41530                                  ;         AX:0 is pointer to allocated memory
 41531                                  ;         BX is max size if not enough memory
 41532                                  ;
 41533                                  ;   Description:
 41534                                  ;           Alloc returns  a  pointer  to  a  free  block of
 41535                                  ;       memory that has the requested  size  in  paragraphs.
 41536                                  ;
 41537                                  ;   Error return:
 41538                                  ;           AX = error_not_enough_memory
 41539                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 41540                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41541                                  
 41542                                  ; DOSCODE:A28Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41543                                  
 41544                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 41880                                  ;	BREAK $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 41881                                  
 41882                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 41883                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41884                                  ;**	$SETBLOCK - Change size of an Allocated Block
 41885                                  ;
 41886                                  ;	Setblock changes the size of an allocated block. First, we coalesce
 41887                                  ;	any following free space onto this block; then we try to trim the
 41888                                  ;	block down to the size requested.
 41889                                  ;
 41890                                  ;	Note that if the guy wants to grow the block but that growth fails,
 41891                                  ;	we still go ahead and coalesce any trailing free blocks onto it.
 41892                                  ;	Thus the maximum-size-possible value that we return has already
 41893                                  ;	been allocated! This is a bug, dare we fix it? BUGBUG
 41894                                  ;
 41895                                  ;	NOTE - $SETBLOCK is in bed with $ALLOC and jumps into $ALLOC to
 41896                                  ;		finish it's work. For this reason we build the allocsf
 41897                                  ;		structure on the frame, to make us compatible with $ALLOCs
 41898                                  ;		code.
 41899                                  ;
 41900                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = segment of old block
 41901                                  ;		(bx) = newsize
 41902                                  ;		(ah) = SETBLOCK
 41903                                  ;
 41904                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 41905                                  ;		'C' set if error
 41906                                  ;		  (ax) = error_invalid_block
 41907                                  ;		       = error_arena_trashed
 41908                                  ;		       = error_not_enough_memory
 41909                                  ;		       = error_invalid_function
 41910                                  ;		  (bx) = maximum size possible, iff (ax) = error_not_enough_memory
 41911                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 41912                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41913                                  
 41914                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 41915                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41916                                  ;SUBTTL $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 41917                                  ;
 41918                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 41919                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 41920                                  ;           MOV     BX,newsize
 41921                                  ;           MOV     AH,setblock
 41922                                  ;           INT     21h
 41923                                  ;         if setblock fails for growing, BX will have the maximum
 41924                                  ;         size possible
 41925                                  ;   Error return:
 41926                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 41927                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 41928                                  ;              = error_not_enough_memory
 41929                                  ;              = error_invalid_function
 41930                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41931                                  
 41932                                  _$SETBLOCK:        
 41933                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41934                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 41935 0000709A E8FBA7                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 41936                                  
 41937 0000709D BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE
 41938 000070A0 8CC0                            MOV     AX,ES
 41939 000070A2 48                              DEC     AX
 41940 000070A3 E871FE                          CALL    check_signature
 41941 000070A6 7303                            JNC     SHORT setblock_grab
 41942
