 42027                                  ;	BREAK $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42028                                  
 42029                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42030                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42031                                  ;**	$AllocOper - Get/Set Allocation Mechanism
 42032                                  ;
 42033                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 42034                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42035                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42036                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42037                                  ;           INT     21h
 42038                                  ;
 42039                                  ;	ENTRY	
 42040                                  ;		(al) = 0
 42041                                  ;		  Get allocation Strategy in (ax)
 42042                                  ;
 42043                                  ;		(al) = 1, (bx) = method = zw0000xy
 42044                                  ;		  Set allocation strategy.
 42045                                  ;		   w  = 1  => HIGH_ONLY
 42046                                  ;		   z  = 1  => HIGH_FIRST
 42047                                  ;		   xy = 00 => FIRST_FIT
 42048                                  ;		      = 01 => BEST_FIT
 42049                                  ;		      = 10 => LAST_FIT
 42050                                  ;
 42051                                  ;		(al) = 2
 42052                                  ;		  Get UMB link state in (al)
 42053                                  ;
 42054                                  ;		(al) = 3
 42055                                  ;		  Set UMB link state
 42056                                  ;		   (bx) = 0 => Unlink UMBs
 42057                                  ;		   (bx) = 1 => Link UMBs
 42058                                  ;
 42059                                  ;
 42060                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42061                                  ;
 42062                                  ;		 if (al) = 0
 42063                                  ;		  (ax) = existing method
 42064                                  ;		 if (al) = 1
 42065                                  ;		  Sets allocation strategy
 42066                                  ;		 if (al) = 2
 42067                                  ;		  (al) = 0 => UMBs not linked
 42068                                  ;		  (al) = 1 => UMBs linked in
 42069                                  ;		 if (al) = 3
 42070                                  ;		  Links/Unlinks the UMBs into DOS chain
 42071                                  ;
 42072                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42073                                  ;		  AX = error_invalid_function
 42074                                  ;
 42075                                  ;	Rev. M000 - added support for HIGH_FIRST in (al) = 1. 7/9/90
 42076                                  ; 	Rev. M003 - added functions (al) = 2 and (al) = 3. 7/18/90
 42077                                  ;	Rev. M009 - (al) = 3 will return 'invalid function' in ax if
 42078                                  ;		    umbhead has'nt been initialized by sysinit and 'trashed
 42079                                  ;		    arena' if an arena sig is damaged.
 42080                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42081                                  
 42082                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 42083                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42084                                  ;SUBTTL $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42085                                  ;
 42086                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42087                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42088                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42089                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42090                                  ;           INT     21h
 42091                                  ;
 42092                                  ;   Error return:
 42093                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_function
 42094                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42095                                  
 42096                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 42315                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42316                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42317                                  ; Procedure Name : GetLastArena		-  M003
 42318                                  ;
 42319                                  ; Inputs	 : cx = umb_head
 42320                                  ;
 42321                                  ;
 42322                                  ; Outputs	 : If UMBs are linked
 42323                                  ;			ES = umb_head
 42324                                  ;			DS = arena before umb_head
 42325                                  ;		   else
 42326                                  ;			DS = last arena
 42327                                  ;			ES = next arena. will be umb_head if NC.
 42328                                  ;
 42329                                  ;		   CY if error
 42330                                  ;
 42331                                  ; Uses		 : DS, ES, DI, BX
 42332                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42333                                  
 42334                                  ; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42335                                  ; DOSCODE:A4D6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 42336                                  
 42337                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42338                                  ; DOSCODE:A476h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 42339                                  
 42340                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42341                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B6D9h
 42342                                  
 42343                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A4D6h)
 42344                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:9F25h)
 42345                                  
 42346                                  GetLastArena:
 42347 00007163 50                      	push	ax			; save ax
 42348                                  
 42349 00007164 36A1[2400]              	mov	ax,[ss:arena_head]
 42350 00007168 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; es = arena_head
 42351 0000716A 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 42352                                  
 42353 0000716C 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 42354                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 42355 00007170 7416                    	je	short GLA_done		; Y: return last arena in ES
 42356                                  
 42357                                  GLA_next:
 42358 00007172 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 42359 00007174 E899FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 42360                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42361                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 42362                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42363 00007177 7222                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 42364                                  
 42365                                  ; 10/03/2024
 42366                                  %if 0
 42367                                  	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 42368                                  	jnz	short GLA_chkumb	; Y: terminating condition is
 42369                                  					;    umb_head
 42370                                  					; N: terminating condition is 05Ah
 42371                                  %else
 42372                                  	; 10/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42373                                  	;;;
 42374 00007179 E85BFD                  	call	test_umb_flag
 42375 0000717C 7506                    	jnz	short GLA_chkumb
 42376                                  	;;;
 42377                                  %endif
 42378 0000717E 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 42379                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 42380 00007182 EB02                    	jmp	short GLA_@f
 42381                                  GLA_chkumb:
 42382 00007184 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 42383                                  GLA_@f:
 42384 00007186 75EA                    	jne	short GLA_next		; N: get next arena
 42385                                  
 42386                                  GLA_done:
 42387                                  
 42388                                  ; 10/03/2024
 42389                                  %if 0
 42390                                  					; M061 - Start
 42391                                  	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 42392                                  	jnz	short GLA_ret		; Y: we're done
 42393                                  					; N: let us confirm that the next
 42394                                  					;    arena is umb_head
 42395                                  %else
 42396                                  	; 10/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42397                                  	;;;
 42398 00007188 E84CFD                  	call	test_umb_flag
 42399 0000718B 750B                    	jnz	short GLA_ret ; cf=0
 42400                                  	;;;
 42401                                  %endif
 42402 0000718D 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 42403 0000718F E87EFD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 42404                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 42405 00007192 7207                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 42406 00007194 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 42407 00007196 7502                    	jne	short GLA_err		; N: error
 42408                                  					; M061 - End
 42409                                  GLA_ret:
 42410                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42411                                  	;clc
 42412                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42413                                  	;clc
 42414 00007198 58                      	pop	ax			; M061
 42415 00007199 C3                      	retn				; M061
 42416                                  
 42417                                  GLA_err:
 42418 0000719A F9                      	stc				; M061
 42419                                  GLA_err2:
 42420 0000719B 58                      	pop	ax
 42421                                  
 42422                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 
 42423                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42424                                  	;;;
 42425 0000719C 58                      	pop	ax	; return address to _$ALLOCOPER (the caller)
 42426 0000719D E841A1                  	call	set_exerr_locus_mem
 42427 000071A0 E910FE                  	jmp	alloc_trashed2	; (error return from _$ALLOCOPER)
 42428                                  	;;;
 42429                                  
 42430                                  	; 10/03/2024
 42431                                  	;retn

 42500                                  ;
 42501                                  ; Procedure Name : $ServerCall
 42502                                  ;
 42503                                  ; Inputs:
 42504                                  ;	DS:DX -> DPL  (except calls 7,8,9)
 42505                                  ; Function:
 42506                                  ;	AL=0	Server DOS call
 42507                                  ;	AL=1	Commit All files
 42508                                  ;	AL=2	Close file by name (SHARING LOADED ONLY) DS:DX in DPL -> name
 42509                                  ;	AL=3	Close all files for DPL_UID
 42510                                  ;	AL=4	Close all files for DPL_UID/PID_PID
 42511                                  ;	AL=5	Get open file list entry
 42512                                  ;		    IN: BX File Index
 42513                                  ;			CX User Index
 42514                                  ;		    OUT:ES:DI -> Name
 42515                                  ;			BX = UID
 42516                                  ;		    CX = # locked blocks held by this UID
 42517                                  ;	AL=6	Get DOS data area
 42518                                  ;		    OUT: DS:SI -> Start
 42519                                  ;			CX size in bytes of swap if indos
 42520                                  ;			DX size in bytes of swap always
 42521                                  ;	AL=7	Get truncate flag
 42522                                  ;	AL=8	Set truncate flag
 42523                                  ;	AL=9	Close all spool files
 42524                                  ;	AL=10	SetExtendedError
 42525                                  ;
 42526                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42527                                  
 42528                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42529                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B735h
 42530                                  
 42531                                  _$ServerCall:
 42532                                  	; 13/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 42534                                  	; 10/06/2019
 42535                                  	; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 42564                                  NO_SET_ID:

 42580                                  servercall_error:

 42584 000071F6 C3                      	retn
 42585                                  
 42586                                  ; Commit - iterate through the open file list and make sure that the
 42587                                  ; directory entries are correctly updated.
 42588                                  
 42589                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42590                                  COMMIT_ALL:
 42591 000071F7 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; for (i=0; ThisSFT=getSFT(i); i++)
 42592 000071F9 16                      	push	ss
 42593 000071FA 1F                      	pop	ds
 42594 000071FB E89AA6                  	call	ECritSFT		; Gonna scan SFT cache, lock it down
 42595                                  CommitLoop:

 42598 00007202 7222                    	JC	short CommitDone
 42599 00007204 26833D00                	cmp	word [es:di],0
 42600                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0
 42601                                  					; if (ThisSFT->refcount != 0)
 42602 00007208 7418                    	JZ	short CommitNext

 42611 00007215 750B                    	JNZ	short CommitNext	; Skip Network SFTs so the SERVER
 42612                                  					;      doesn't deadlock

 42707                                  SRV_CALL:

 42709 0000725D 1E                      	push	ds

 42714

 42716                                  ; ES:DI point to DPL
 42717

 42719                                  
 42720                                  ; DS:SI point to DPL
 42721                                  ; ES:DI point to stack
 42722                                  ;
 42723                                  ; We now copy the registers from DPL to save stack
 42724

 42729 0000726E 47                      	INC	DI			; Skip user_BP
 42730 0000726F A5                      	MOVSW				; DS
 42731 00007270 A5                      	MOVSW				; ES

 42802                                  ; $SetExtendedError takes extended error information and loads it up for the
 42803                                  ; next extended error call. This is used by interrupt-level proccessors to

 42852                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 42853                                  
 42854                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 42855                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42856                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 42857                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 42858                                  ;
 42859                                  ;	NOTE:
 42860                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 42861                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42862                                  ;
 42863                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 42864                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 42865                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 42866                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42867                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 42868                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 42869                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42870                                  
 42871                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42872                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42873                                  
 42874                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 42875                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42876                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 42877 000072F1 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42878                                  	
 42879                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 42880 000072F6 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 42881                                  
 42882                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 42883 000072FB 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 42884 00007300 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 42885                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42886                                  	;mov	al,6
 42887 00007302 B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42888                                  ReturnCarry:
 42889 00007304 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 42890 00007305 C3                      	retn				; go back
 42891                                  pjfn10: 
 42892                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 42893 00007306 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 42894 0000730B 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 42895                                  	;clc
 42896                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 42897 0000730D C3                      	retn
 42898                                  
 42899                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 42900                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42901                                  ;
 42902                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 42903                                  ;
 42904                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 42905                                  ;
 42906                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 42907                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 42908                                  ;                   AX has error code
 42909                                  ;               Carry Reset
 42910                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 42911                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 42912                                  ; NOTE:
 42913                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 42914                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42915                                  ;
 42916                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42917                                  
 42918                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42919                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42920                                  
 42921                                  SFFromHandle:
 42922 0000730E E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 42923                                  	;retc				; return if error
 42924 00007311 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 42925 00007313 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 42926                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 42927                                  	;;mov	al,6
 42928                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42929                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 42930                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42931                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42932 00007317 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 42933                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 42934                                  	;;mov	al,6
 42935                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42936                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 42937                                  GetSF:
 42938 00007319 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 42939 0000731A 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 42940 0000731D 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 42941 0000731F E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 42942 00007322 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 42943 00007323 C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 42944                                  
 42945                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 42946                                  
 42947                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 42948                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42949                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 42950                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 42951                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 42952                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 42953                                  ;
 42954                                  ;   NOTE:
 42955                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 42956                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42957                                  ;
 42958                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 42959                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42960                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 42961                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 42962                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 42963                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42964                                  
 42965                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42966                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42967                                  
 42968                                  SFFromSFN:
 42969                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42970                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 42971 00007324 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42972                                  
 42973                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 42974 00007329 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 42975                                  sfsfn5:	
 42976                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 42977 0000732E 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 42978 00007332 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 42979                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 42980 00007334 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 42981 00007338 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 42982                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 42983 0000733B 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 42984 0000733E 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 42985 00007340 F9                      	STC
 42986 00007341 C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 42987                                  sfsfn7:
 42988 00007342 50                      	push	ax
 42989                                  	;;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 42990                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 5.0 to PCDOS 7.1 (to Win ME) ; 11/03/2024
 42991                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 42992                                  	
 42993                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42994 00007343 B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 42995                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42996                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 42997                                  	
 42998 00007345 F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 42999 00007347 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 43000 00007349 58                      	pop	ax
 43001                                  	;add	di,6
 43002 0000734A 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 43003 0000734D C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 43004                                  
 43005                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 43006                                  
 43007                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 43008                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43009                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 43010                                  ;
 43011                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43012                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 43013                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 43014                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 43015                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43016                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43017                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 43018                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43019                                  
 43020                                  JFNFree:
 43021 0000734E 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 43022                                  jfnf1:	
 43023 00007350 E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 43024 00007353 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 43025 00007355 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 43026 00007359 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 43027 0000735B 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 43028 0000735C EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 43029                                  
 43030                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 43031                                  jfnf5:	
 43032                                  	;mov	al,4
 43033 0000735E B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 43034                                  jfnfx:	
 43035 00007360 C3                      	retn				; bye
 43036                                  
 43037                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 43038                                  
 43039                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 43040                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43041                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 43042                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43043                                  ;
 43044                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 43045                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 43046                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 43047                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 43048                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 43049                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 43050                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 43051                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 43052                                  ;
 43053                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 43054                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 43055                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 43056                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 43057                                  ;
 43058                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43059                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 43060                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 43061                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43062                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43063                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43064                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43065                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 43066                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43067                                  
 43068                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43069                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43070                                  
 43071                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43072                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B8DEh
 43073                                  
 43074                                  SFNFree:
 43075                                  	; 12/08/2018
 43076                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43077                                  	;
 43078                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 43079 00007361 50                      	push	ax
 43080 00007362 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 43081                                  sfnf5:	
 43082 00007364 53                      	push	bx
 43083 00007365 E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 43084 00007368 5B                      	pop	bx
 43085 00007369 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 43086 0000736B 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 43087                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0 ; free?
 43088 0000736F 741D                    	je	short sfnf20			; yep, got one
 43089                                  	
 43090                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 43091 00007371 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43092                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43093 00007375 7403                    	je	short sfnf10		; special busy mark
 43094                                  sfnf7:	
 43095 00007377 43                      	inc	bx			; try the next one
 43096 00007378 EBEA                    	jmp	short sfnf5
 43097                                  
 43098                                  ;	The SFT has the special "busy" mark; if it belongs to us then
 43099                                  ;	it was abandoned during a earlier call and we can use it.
 43100                                  ;
 43101                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43102                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43103                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43104                                  
 43105                                  sfnf10:	
 43106 0000737A 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43107                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43108 0000737E 2639452F                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43109 00007382 75F3                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; not ours
 43110 00007384 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43111                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 43112 00007388 26394531                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43113 0000738C 75E9                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; can't use this one, try the next
 43114                                  
 43115                                  ;	We have an SFT to allocate
 43116                                  ;
 43117                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43118                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43119                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43120                                  
 43121                                  sfnf20:
 43122                                  	; cf = 0 ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43123                                  
 43124                                  	;mov	word [es:di],0FFFFh
 43125 0000738E 26C705FFFF              	mov	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43126                                  					; make sure that this is allocated
 43127                                  	;mov	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43128                                  
 43129 00007393 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43130                                  	;mov	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43131 00007397 2689452F                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43132 0000739B 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43133                                  	;mov	[es:di+31h],ax
 43134 0000739F 26894531                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43135                                  sfnf21: ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43136                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43137                                  	;pop	ax
 43138                                  	;;clc
 43139                                  	;retn				; return with no error
 43140                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43141 000073A3 58                      	pop	ax
 43142                                  	;clc
 43143 000073A4 C3                      	retn
 43144                                  
 43145                                  ;**	Error - no more free SFNs
 43146                                  ;
 43147                                  ;	'C' set
 43148                                  ;	(TOS) = saved ax
 43149                                  
 43150                                  sfnf95: 
 43151 000073A5 58                      	pop	ax
 43152                                  
 43153                                  ; 11/03/2024
 43154                                  %if 0
 43155                                  	;mov	al,4
 43156                                  	mov	al,error_too_many_open_files
 43157                                  	retn				; return with 'C' and error
 43158                                  %else
 43159                                  	; 11/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43160                                  	;;;
 43161 000073A6 EBB6                    	jmp	short jfnf5
 43162                                  	;;;
 43163                                  %endif
 43164

 43171                                  
 43172                                  ; DOSCODE:A72Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 43173                                  
 43174                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>
 43175                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43176                                  ;
 43177                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 43178                                  ;
 43179                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 43180                                  ;		path
 43181                                  ;
 43182                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 43183                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 43184                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close
 43185                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 43186                                  ;
 43187                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 43188                                  ;	EXIT	<normal INT21 return convention>
 43189                                  ;	USES	all
 43190                                  ;
 43191                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43192                                  
 43193                                  ; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43194                                  ; DOSCODE:A6CBh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43195

 43204

 43210 000073B3 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 43211                                  
 43212                                  ; DS:SI point to JFN table entry.
 43213                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 43214                                  ;
 43215                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network
 43216                                  ; FCB, we examine the ref count on the SFT; if it was 1, we free the JFN.
 43217                                  ; If the file was not a net FCB, we free the JFN too.
 43218

 43229

 43231                                  ; -1.

 44305                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 44306                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44307                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 44308                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 44309                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 44310                                  ;   that it does not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 44311                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 44312                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 44313                                  ;
 44314                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 44315                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 44316                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 44317                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 44318                                  ;	USES	none
 44319                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44320                                  
 44321                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44322                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44323                                  CheckOwner:
 44324                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 44325                                  
 44326 000076A1 E86AFC                  	call	SFFromHandle
 44327 000076A4 721B                    	jc	short co_ret_label	; retc
 44328                                  
 44329 000076A6 50                      	push	ax
 44330                                  
 44331                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 44332                                  
 44333                                  ;SR; WIN386 patch - Do not check for USER_ID for using handles since these 
 44334                                  ;SR; are shared across multiple VMs in win386.
 44335                                  
 44336 000076A7 36F606[450F]01          	test	byte [ss:IsWin386],1 ; 02/06/2019
 44337 000076AD 7404                    	jz	short no_win386		;win386 is not present
 44338 000076AF 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			;set the zero flag
 44339 000076B1 EB08                    	jmp	short _skip_win386	
 44340

 44347 000076BB 58                      	pop	ax

 44366                                  ; Retro	DOS v3.0 - 11/07/2018

 44369                                  
 44370                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 44371                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 44372                                  
 44373                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 44374                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 44375                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 44376                                  
 44377                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 44378                                  ;
 44379                                  ;	$AssignOper
 44380                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 44381                                  ;	InitCDS
 44382                                  ;	$UserOper
 44383                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 44384                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 44385                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 44386                                  ;
 44387                                  ;   Revision history:
 44388                                  ;
 44389                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 44390                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 44391                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 44392                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 44393                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 44394                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 44395                                  ;				    aliasing.
 44396                                  ;
 44397                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 44398                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 44399                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 44400                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 44401                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 44402                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 44403                                  ;
 44404                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 44405                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 44406                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 44407                                  ;
 44408                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 44409                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 44410                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 44411                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 44412                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 44413                                  ;
 44414                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 44415                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 44416                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 44417                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 44418                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 44419                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 44420                                  ;
 44421                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 44422                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 44423                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 44424                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 44425                                  ;   number.
 44426                                  ;
 44427                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 44428                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 44429                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 44430                                  ;   TransPath.
 44431                                  ;
 44432                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 44433                                  
 44434                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 44435                                  
 44436                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 44437                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 44438                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 44439                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 44440                                  ;					; current drive)
 44441                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 44442                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 44443                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 44444                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 44445                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 44446                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 44447                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 44448                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 44449                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error
 44450                                  
 44451                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 44452                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44453                                  ; Inputs:
 44454                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 44455                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 44456                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 44457                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 44458                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 44459                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 44460                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 44461                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 44462                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 44463                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 44464                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 44465                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 44466                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 44467                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 44468                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 44469                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 44470                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 44471                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 44472                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 44473                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,
 44474                                  ; Function:
 44475                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 44476                                  ; Returns:
 44477                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return
 44478                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44479                                  
 44480                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44481                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 44551                                  ;Break <FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a drive number>
 44552                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44553                                  ;**	FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a Drive #
 44554                                  ;
 44555                                  ;	ENTRY	AL has drive number A = 0
 44556                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set
 44557                                  ;		    No DPB for this drive number
 44558                                  ;		'C' clear
 44559                                  ;		    DS:SI points to DPB for drive
 44560                                  ;	USES	SI, DS, Flags
 44561                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44562                                  
 44563                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44564                                  FIND_DPB:
 44565 000076FB 36C536[2600]            	LDS	SI,[SS:DPBHEAD]		;smr;SS Override
 44566                                  fdpb5:	
 44567 00007700 83FEFF                  	CMP	SI,-1
 44568 00007703 7409                    	JZ	short fdpb10
 44569 00007705 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si]
 44570                                  	;CMP	AL,[SI+DPB.DRIVE]
 44571 00007707 7406                    	jz	short ret_label15	; Carry clear (retz)
 44572                                  	;;lds	si,[si+18h] ; MSDOS 3.3
 44573                                  	;lds	si,[si+19h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 44574 00007709 C57419                  	LDS	SI,[SI+DPB.NEXT_DPB]
 44575 0000770C EBF2                    	JMP	short fdpb5
 44576                                  fdpb10:	
 44577 0000770E F9                      	STC
 44578                                  ret_label15:
 44579 0000770F C3                      	retn

 44581                                  ;	Break <InitCDS - set up an empty CDS>
 44582                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44583                                  ;**	InitCDS - Setup an Empty CDS
 44584                                  ;
 44585                                  ;	ENTRY	ThisCDS points to CDS
 44586                                  ;		AL has uppercase drive letter
 44587                                  ;	EXIT	ThisCDS is now empty
 44588                                  ;		(ES:DI) = CDS
 44589                                  ;		'C' set if no DPB associated with drive
 44590                                  ;	USES	AH,ES,DI, Flags

 44651                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 44652                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44653                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 44654                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 44655                                  ;
 44656                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 44657                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 44658                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 44659                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 44660                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 44661                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 44662                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 44663                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 44664                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number
 44665                                  ;		If AL = 3 then CX bytes have been put at input ES:DI
 44666                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word
 44667                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44668                                  
 44669                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 44670                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44671                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44672                                  _$UserOper:
 44673                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 44674                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 44675                                  	;PUSH	AX
 44676                                  	;SUB	AL,1			; quick dispatch on 0,1
 44677                                  	;POP	AX
 44678                                  	; 01/07/2024

 44683 00007765 763A                    	JBE	short UserPrint		; yep

 44694                                  	;;;
