 44963                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 44964                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44965                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 44966                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 44967                                  ;
 44968                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 44969                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 44970                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 44971                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 44972                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 44973                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 44974                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 44975                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44976                                  
 44977                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44978                                  TransFCB:
 44979                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44980                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 44981                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 44982                                  	;ENTER
 44983 00007837 55                      	push	bp
 44984 00007838 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 44985                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 44986 0000783A 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 44987 0000783D 16                      	push	ss
 44988 0000783E 07                      	pop	es
 44989 0000783F 06                      	push	es
 44990 00007840 57                      	push	di
 44991                                  	;lea	di,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 44992                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp 
 44993 00007841 8D7EF0                  	lea	di,[bp-16]		; point to FCB temp area
 44994 00007844 36C606[6C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0	; no extended FCB found ;smr;SS Override
 44995 0000784A 36C606[6D05]00          	mov	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0	; default search attributes;smr;SS Override
 44996 00007850 E8ADA9                  	call	GetExtended             ; get FCB, extended or not
 44997                                  	; 06/12/2022
 44998 00007853 740D                    	jz	short GetDrive		; not an extended FCB, get drive
 44999 00007855 8A44FF                  	mov	AL,[SI-1]               ; get attributes
 45000 00007858 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],AL		; store search attributes;smr;SS Override
 45001 0000785C 36C606[6C05]FF          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],-1	; signal extended FCB  ;smr;SS Override
 45002                                  GetDrive:
 45003 00007862 AC                      	lodsb				; get drive byte
 45004 00007863 E862FF                  	call	GETTHISDRV
 45005 00007866 722A                    	jc	short BadPack
 45006 00007868 E86F03                  	call	TextFromDrive           ; convert 0-based drive to text
 45007                                  
 45008                                  ; Scan the source to see if there are any illegal chars
 45009                                  
 45010                                  	;mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 45011 0000786B B90B00                  	mov	cx,11
 45012 0000786E 56                      	push	si			; back over name, ext
 45013                                  FCBScan:
 45014 0000786F AC                      	lodsb				; get a byte
 45015                                  	
 45016                                  	; 09/08/2018
 45017                                  	;;xlat	byte [es:bx]
 45018                                  	;es	xlat
 45019                                  
 45020                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 45021 00007870 E8B8E1                  	call	GetCharType		; get flags
 45022                                  
 45023                                  	;test	al,8	
 45024 00007873 A808                    	test	al,FFCB
 45025 00007875 741B                    	jz	short BadPack
 45026                                  NextCh: 
 45027 00007877 E2F6                    	loop	FCBScan
 45028 00007879 5E                      	pop	si
 45029 0000787A 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 45030 0000787C E8DEAD                  	call	PackName                ; crunch the path
 45031 0000787F 5F                      	pop	di			; get original destination
 45032 00007880 07                      	pop	es
 45033 00007881 16                      	push	ss			; get DS addressability
 45034 00007882 1F                      	pop	ds
 45035                                  	;lea	si,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 45036                                  	;LEA	SI,FCBTmp		; point at new pathname
 45037 00007883 8D76F0                  	lea	si,[bp-16]
 45038 00007886 803F00                  	cmp	byte [bx],0
 45039 00007889 7407                    	jz	short BadPack
 45040 0000788B 55                      	push	bp
 45041 0000788C E80E00                  	call	TransPathSet            ; convert the path
 45042 0000788F 5D                      	pop	bp
 45043 00007890 7303                    	jnc	short FCBRet		; bye with transPath error code
 45044                                  BadPack:
 45045 00007892 F9                      	STC
 45046                                  	;mov	al,3
 45047 00007893 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found
 45048                                  FCBRet: 
 45049                                  	;LEAVE
 45050 00007895 89EC                    	mov	sp,bp
 45051 00007897 5D                      	pop	bp
 45052                                  TransPath_retn:
 45053 00007898 C3                      	retn
 45054                                  
 45055                                  ; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 45056                                  
 45057                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 45058                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45059                                  ;
 45060                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 45061                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 45062                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 45063                                  ;       exactly.
 45064                                  ;
 45065                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 45066                                  ;       matches splice.
 45067                                  ;
 45068                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 45069                                  ;
 45070                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 45071                                  ;
 45072                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 45073                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 45074                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 45075                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 45076                                  ;
 45077                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 45078                                  ;
 45079                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 45080                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 45081                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 45082                                  ;
 45083                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 45084                                  ;
 45085                                  ;       if fSharing then
 45086                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45087                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45088                                  ;           splice
 45089                                  ;           fatRead
 45090                                  ;           return
 45091                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 45092                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 45093                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45094                                  ;           return
 45095                                  ;       if device then
 45096                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45097                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45098                                  ;           return
 45099                                  ;       if file then
 45100                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 45101                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 45102                                  ;           Copy current dir
 45103                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 45104                                  ;           splice
 45105                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 45106                                  ;           if local then
 45107                                  ;               fatread
 45108                                  ;           return
 45109                                  ;
 45110                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 45111                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 45112                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 45113                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 45114                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 45115                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 45116                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 45117                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 45118                                  ;
 45119                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45120                                  
 45121                                  ; 22/05/2019
 45122                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45123                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45124                                  
 45125                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45126                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 45127                                  
 45128                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45129                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0BE1Dh
 45130                                  
 45131                                  TransPath:
 45132 00007899 30C0                    	XOR     AL,AL
 45133 0000789B EB02                    	JMP     SHORT SetSplice
 45134                                  TransPathSet:
 45135 0000789D B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 45136                                  SetSplice:
 45137 0000789F 36A2[4C03]              	MOV	[SS:NoSetDir],AL	; NoSetDir = !fExact;	;smr;SS Override
 45138 000078A3 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 45139                                  TransPathNoSet:
 45140 000078A5 36A2[7105]              	MOV	[SS:FSPLICE],AL		; fSplice = TRUE;	;smr;SS Override
 45141 000078A9 36C606[7A05]FF          	MOV	byte [ss:CMETA],-1      			;smr;SS Override
 45142 000078AF 36893E[B205]            	MOV     [SS:WFP_START],DI 				;smr;SS Override
 45143 000078B4 36C706[B605]FFFF        	MOV	word [SS:CURR_DIR_END],-1 ; crack from start	;smr;SS Override
 45144 000078BB 16                      	push	ss
 45145 000078BC 07                      	pop	es
 45146                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 45147 000078BD 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; end of buffer
 45148                                  ;
 45149                                  ; if this is through the server dos call, fsharing is set. We set up a
 45150                                  ; dummy cds and let the operation go.
 45151                                  ;
 45152                                  	;TEST	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; if no sharing		;smr;SS Override
 45153                                  	;JZ	short CheckUNC		; skip to UNC check
 45154                                  	; 13/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45155                                  	;;;
 45156 000078C1 36803E[7205]00          	cmp	byte [ss:FSHARING],0
 45157 000078C7 7435                    	jz	short CheckUNC
 45158                                  	;;;
 45159                                  ;
 45160                                  ; ES:DI point to buffer
 45161                                  ;
 45162 000078C9 E8F802                  	CALL	DriveFromText           ; get drive and advance DS:SI
 45163 000078CC E8F9FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; Set ThisCDS and convert to 0-based
 45164 000078CF 722A                    	jc	short NoPath
 45165 000078D1 E80603                  	CALL	TextFromDrive		; drop in new
 45166 000078D4 8D5D01                  	LEA	BX,[DI+1]               ; backup limit
 45167 000078D7 E83401                  	CALL	Canonicalize            ; copy and canonicalize
 45168 000078DA 72BC                    	jc	short TransPath_retn	; errors
 45169                                  ;
 45170                                  ; Perform splices for net guys.
 45171                                  ;
 45172 000078DC 16                      	push	ss
 45173 000078DD 1F                      	pop	ds
 45174 000078DE 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START] 		; point to name
 45175 000078E2 F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 45176 000078E7 7403                    	JZ	short NoServerSplice
 45177 000078E9 E82D02                  	CALL    Splice
 45178                                  NoServerSplice:
 45179 000078EC 16                      	push	ss
 45180 000078ED 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; for FATREAD
 45181 000078EE C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; for fatread
 45182 000078F2 E8A39F                  	call	ECritDisk
 45183 000078F5 E8BFE8                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 45184 000078F8 E8CA9F                  	call	LCritDisk
 45185                                  NoPath:
 45186                                  	;mov	al,3
 45187 000078FB B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45188 000078FD C3                      	retn				; any errors are in Carry flag
 45189                                  
 45190                                  ; Let the network decide if the name is for a spooled device. It will map
 45191                                  ; the name if so.
 45192                                  
 45193                                  CheckUNC:
 45194 000078FE 36C706[A205]FFFF        	MOV     WORD [SS:THISCDS],-1	; NULL thisCDS		;smr;SS Override
 45195                                  	;CallInstall NetSpoolCheck,MultNET,35
 45196 00007905 B82311                  	mov	ax,1123h
 45197 00007908 CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - QUALIFY REMOTE FILENAME
 45198                                  			; DS:SI -> ASCIZ filename to canonicalize
 45199                                  			; ES:DI -> 128-byte buffer for qualified name
 45200                                  			; Return: CF set if not resolved
 45201 0000790A 7329                    	JNC	short UNCDone
 45202                                  
 45203                                  ; At this point the name is either a UNC-style name (prefixed with two leading
 45204                                  ; \\s) or is a local file/device. Remember that if a net-spooled device was
 45205                                  ; input, then the name has been changed to the remote spooler by the above net
 45206                                  ; call. Also, there may be a drive in front of the \\.
 45207                                  
 45208                                  NO_CHECK:
 45209 0000790C E8B502                  	CALL    DriveFromText		; eat drive letter
 45210 0000790F 50                      	PUSH    AX                      ; save it
 45211 00007910 8B04                    	MOV     AX,[SI]			; get first two bytes of path
 45212 00007912 E831E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 45213 00007915 86C4                    	XCHG    AH,AL                   ; swap for second byte
 45214 00007917 E82CE1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 45215 0000791A 751F                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; not a path char
 45216 0000791C 38C4                    	CMP     AH,AL                   ; are they same?
 45217 0000791E 751B                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; nope
 45218                                  
 45219                                  ; We have a UNC request. We must copy the string up to the beginning of the
 45220                                  ; local machine root path
 45221                                  
 45222 00007920 58                      	POP     AX
 45223 00007921 A5                      	MOVSW                           ; get the lead \\.
 45224                                  UNCCpy:
 45225 00007922 AC                      	LODSB                           ; get a byte
 45226 00007923 E8CDE0                   	call	UCase                   ;AN000;; convert the char
 45227 00007926 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 45228 00007928 740E                    	JZ	short UNCTerm		; end of string. All done.
 45229 0000792A E819E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char?
 45230 0000792D 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; backup position
 45231 0000792F AA                      	STOSB
 45232 00007930 75F0                    	JNZ	short UNCCpy		; no, go copy
 45233 00007932 E8D900                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham (and set cMeta)
 45234                                  UNCDone:
 45235 00007935 16                      	push	ss
 45236 00007936 1F                      	pop	ds
 45237 00007937 C3                       	retn				; return error code
 45238                                  UNCTerm:
 45239 00007938 AA                      	STOSB                           ;AN000;
 45240 00007939 EBFA                    	JMP	short UNCDone		;AN000;
 45241                                  
 45242                                  CheckDevice:
 45243                                  
 45244                                  ; Check DS:SI for device. First eat any path stuff
 45245                                  
 45246 0000793B 58                      	POP     AX                      ; retrieve drive info
 45247 0000793C 803C00                  	CMP     BYTE [SI],0		; check for null file
 45248 0000793F 7504                    	JNZ	short CheckPath
 45249                                  	;mov	al,2 
 45250 00007941 B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; bad file error
 45251 00007943 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error on null input
 45252 00007944 C3                      	RETN				; bye!
 45253                                  CheckPath:
 45254 00007945 50                      	push	ax
 45255 00007946 55                      	push	bp			; save drive number
 45256                                  
 45257                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45258                                  %if 0
 45259                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 45260                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 45261                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 45262                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 45263                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 45264                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 45265                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 45266                                  ;;;
 45267                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 45268                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 45269                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 45270                                  ;;;
 45271                                  ;;;More info:
 45272                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 45273                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 45274                                  ;;;
 45275                                  	call	no5Dshere
 45276                                  start5Dhack:
 45277                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice
 45278                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 45279                                  
 45280                                  %endif
 45281                                  
 45282                                  ; 13/03/2024
 45283                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:BECBh
 45284                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:AC47h)
 45285                                  ; ((Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:A6C2h))
 45286                                  %if 0
 45287                                  	call	no5Dshere
 45288                                  %else
 45289                                  ; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 45290                                  
 45291                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45292                                  	; Note: 'call no5Dshere' is not required for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 45293 00007947 E8C0D3                  	call    CheckThisDevice	; E8h,6Fh,0D6h
 45294                                  %endif
 45295 0000794A 5D                      	pop	bp
 45296 0000794B 58                      	pop	ax			; get drive letter back
 45297 0000794C 731C                    	JNC	short DoFile		; yes we have a file.
 45298                                  
 45299                                  ; We have a device. AX has drive letter. At this point we may fake a CDS ala
 45300                                  ; sharing DOS call. We know by getting here that we are NOT in a sharing DOS
 45301                                  ; call.
 45302                                  
 45303 0000794E 36C606[7205]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; simulate sharing dos call;smr;SS Override
 45304 00007954 E871FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; set ThisCDS and init DUMMYCDS
 45305 00007957 36C606[7205]00          	MOV     byte [SS:FSHARING],0	;                       ;smr;SS Override
 45306                                  
 45307                                  ; Now that we have noted that we have a device, we put it into a form that
 45308                                  ; getpath can understand. Normally getpath requires d:\ to begin the input
 45309                                  ; string. We relax this to state that if the d:\ is present then the path
 45310                                  ; may be a file. If D:/ (note the forward slash) is present then we have
 45311                                  ; a device.
 45312                                  
 45313 0000795D E87A02                  	CALL    TextFromDrive
 45314 00007960 B02F                    	MOV     AL,'/'                  ; path sep.
 45315 00007962 AA                      	STOSB
 45316 00007963 E83C9E                  	call	StrCpy			; move remainder of string
 45317                                  
 45318 00007966 F8                      	CLC                             ; everything OK.
 45319 00007967 16                      	push	ss
 45320 00007968 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; remainder of OK stuff
 45321                                  DoFile_retn:
 45322 00007969 C3                      	retn
 45323                                  
 45324                                  ; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 45325                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:BEEEh
 45326                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:AC6Ah)
 45327                                  ; ((Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:A6F2h))
 45328                                  ;%if 1
 45329                                  
 45330                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45331                                  %if 0
 45332                                  
 45333                                  no5Dshere:
 45334                                  	; 10/08/2018
 45335                                  	jmp	CheckThisDevice		; snoop for device
 45336                                  %endif
 45337                                  
 45338                                  ;.erre (no5Dshere - start5Dhack - 5D)
 45339                                  
 45340                                  ; We have a file. Get the raw CDS.
 45341                                  
 45342                                  DoFile:
 45343                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 45344                                  
 45345 0000796A E83FFE                  	call	GetVisDrv               ; get proper CDS
 45346                                  	;mov	al,3 
 45347 0000796D B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad file error
 45348 0000796F 72F8                    	jc	short DoFile_retn  ; CARRY set -> bogus drive/spliced
 45349                                  
 45350                                  ; ThisCDS has correct CDS. DS:SI advanced to point to beginning of path/file.
 45351                                  ; Make sure that CDS has valid directory; ValidateCDS requires a temp buffer
 45352                                  ; Use the one that we are going to use (ES:DI).
 45353                                  
 45354                                  	;SAVE    <DS,SI,ES,DI>		; save all string pointers.
 45355 00007971 1E                      	push	ds
 45356 00007972 56                      	push	si
 45357 00007973 06                      	push	es
 45358 00007974 57                      	push	di
 45359 00007975 E8C5D2                  	call	ValidateCDS             ; poke CDS and make everything OK
 45360                                  	;RESTORE <DI,ES,SI,DS>		; get back pointers
 45361 00007978 5F                      	pop	di
 45362 00007979 07                      	pop	es
 45363 0000797A 5E                      	pop	si
 45364 0000797B 1F                      	pop	ds
 45365                                  	;mov	al,3
 45366 0000797C B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45367                                  	;retc				; someone failed an operation
 45368 0000797E 72E9                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 45369                                  
 45370                                  ; ThisCDS points to correct CDS. It contains the correct text of the
 45371                                  ; current directory. Copy it in.
 45372                                  
 45373 00007980 1E                      	push	ds
 45374 00007981 56                      	push	si
 45375 00007982 36C536[A205]            	LDS     SI,[SS:THISCDS]		; point to CDS	;smr;SS Override
 45376 00007987 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; point to destination
 45377                                  	;add	bx,[si+79] ; MSDOS 6.0
 45378 00007989 035C4F                  	ADD     BX,[SI+curdir.end]	; point to backup limit
 45379                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 45380 0000798C 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; regenerate end of buffer
 45381                                  					;AN000;
 45382 00007990 E81E9E                  	call	FStrCpy                 ; copy string. ES:DI point to end
 45383 00007993 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to NUL byte
 45384                                  
 45385                                  ; Make sure that there is a path char at end.
 45386                                  
 45387 00007994 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'
 45388 00007996 263845FF                	CMP     [ES:DI-1],AL
 45389 0000799A 7401                    	JZ	short GetOrig
 45390 0000799C AA                      	STOSB
 45391                                  
 45392                                  ; Now get original string.
 45393                                  
 45394                                  GetOrig:
 45395 0000799D 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to path char
 45396 0000799E 5E                      	pop	si
 45397 0000799F 1F                      	pop	ds
 45398                                  
 45399                                  ; BX points to the end of the root part of the CDS (at where a path char
 45400                                  ; should be). Now, we decide whether we use this root or extend it with the
 45401                                  ; current directory. See if the input string begins with a leading 
 45403 000079A0 E8CE00                  	CALL    PathSep                 ; is DS:SI a path sep?
 45404 000079A3 7511                    	JNZ	short PathAssure	; no, DI is correct. Assure a path char
 45405 000079A5 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL                   ; end of string?
 45406 000079A7 7410                    	JZ	short DoCanon		; yes, skip.
 45407                                  ;
 45408                                  ; The string does begin with a \. Reset the beginning of the canonicalization
 45409                                  ; to this root. Make sure that there is a path char there and advance the
 45410                                  ; source string over all leading \'s.
 45411                                  ;
 45412 000079A9 89DF                    	MOV     DI,BX                   ; back up to root point.
 45413                                  SkipPath:
 45414 000079AB AC                      	LODSB
 45415 000079AC E897E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 45416 000079AF 74FA                    	JZ	short SkipPath
 45417 000079B1 4E                      	DEC     SI
 45418 000079B2 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 45419 000079B4 7403                    	JZ	short DoCanon
 45420                                  
 45421                                  ; DS:SI start at some file name. ES:DI points at some path char. Drop one in
 45422                                  ; for yucks.
 45423                                  
 45424                                  PathAssure:
 45425 000079B6 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 45426 000079B8 AA                      	STOSB
 45427                                  
 45428                                  ; ES:DI point to the correct spot for canonicalization to begin.
 45429                                  ; BP is the max extent to advance DI
 45430                                  ; BX is the backup limit for ..
 45431                                  
 45432                                  DoCanon:
 45433 000079B9 E85200                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham.
 45434                                  	;retc				; badly formatted path.
 45435 000079BC 72AB                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 45436                                  
 45437                                  ; The string has been moved to ES:DI. Reset world to DOS context, pointers
 45438                                  ; to wfp_start and do string substitution. BP is still the max position in
 45439                                  ; buffer.
 45440                                  
 45441 000079BE 16                      	push	ss
 45442 000079BF 1F                      	pop	ds
 45443 000079C0 8B3E[B205]              	MOV     DI,[WFP_START]		; DS:SI point to string
 45444 000079C4 C536[A205]              	LDS     SI,[THISCDS]		; point to CDS
 45445 000079C8 E81702                  	CALL    PathPref                ; is there a prefix?
 45446 000079CB 7514                    	JNZ	short DoSplice		; no, do splice
 45447                                  
 45448                                  ; We have a match. Check to see if we ended in a path char.
 45449                                  
 45450 000079CD 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]		; last char to match
 45451 000079D0 E873E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; did we end on a path char? (root)
 45452 000079D3 740C                    	JZ	short DoSplice		; yes, no current dir here.
 45453                                  Pathline:                               ; 2/13/KK
 45454 000079D5 26803D00                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],0		; end at NUL?
 45455 000079D9 7406                    	JZ	short DoSplice
 45456 000079DB 47                      	INC     DI                      ; point to after current path char
 45457 000079DC 36893E[B605]            	MOV     [SS:CURR_DIR_END],DI	; point to correct spot ;smr;SS Override
 45458                                  
 45459                                  ; Splice the result.
 45460                                  
 45461                                  DoSplice:
 45462 000079E1 16                      	push	ss
 45463 000079E2 1F                      	pop	ds			; back to DOSDATA
 45464 000079E3 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START]		; point to beginning of string
 45465 000079E7 31C9                    	XOR     CX,CX
 45466 000079E9 F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 45467 000079EE 7403                    	JZ	short SkipSplice
 45468 000079F0 E82601                  	CALL    Splice                  ; replaces in place.
 45469                                  SkipSplice:
 45470                                  
 45471                                  ; The final thing is to assure ourselves that a FATREAD is done on the local
 45472                                  ; device.
 45473                                  
 45474 000079F3 16                      	push	ss
 45475 000079F4 1F                      	pop	ds
 45476 000079F5 C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; point to correct drive
 45477                                  	;test	word [es:di+67],8000h
 45478                                  	; 17/12/2022
 45479                                  	;test	byte [es:di+68],80h
 45480 000079F9 26F6454480              	test	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],curdir_isnet>>8 ; 04/12/2022
 45481                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet ; 8000h
 45482 000079FE 750D                    	JNZ	short Done		; net, no fatread necessary (retnz)
 45483 00007A00 E30B                    	JCXZ    Done
 45484 00007A02 E8939E                  	call	ECritDisk
 45485 00007A05 E8AFE7                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 45486 00007A08 E8BA9E                  	call	LCritDisk
 45487                                  	;mov	al, 3
 45488 00007A0B B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45489                                  Done:   
 45490 00007A0D C3                      	retn                         ; any errors in carry flag.
 45491                                  
 45492                                  ; 13/07/2018
 45493                                  
 45494                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 45495                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45496                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 45497                                  ;
 45498                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 45499                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 45500                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 45501                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 45502                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 45503                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 45504                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 45505                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 45506                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 45507                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 45508                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45509                                  
 45510                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45511                                  
 45512                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45513                                  
 45514                                  Canonicalize:
 45515                                  
 45516                                  ; We copy all leading path separators.
 45517                                  
 45518 00007A0E AC                      	LODSB                           ;   while (PathChr (*s))
 45519 00007A0F E834E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 45520 00007A12 7507                    	JNZ	short CanonDec
 45521 00007A14 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ;       if (d > dlim)
 45522 00007A16 7319                    	JAE	short CanonBad		;           goto error;
 45523 00007A18 AA                      	STOSB
 45524 00007A19 EBF3                    	JMP	short Canonicalize	;           *d++ = *s++;
 45525                                  CanonDec:
 45526 00007A1B 4E                      	DEC     SI
 45527                                  
 45528                                  ; Main canonicalization loop. We come here with DS:SI pointing to a textual
 45529                                  ; component (no leading path separators) and ES:DI being the destination
 45530                                  ; buffer.
 45531                                  
 45532                                  CanonLoop:
 45533                                  
 45534                                  ; If we are at the end of the source string, then we need to check to see that
 45535                                  ; a potential drive specifier is correctly terminated with a path sep char.
 45536                                  ; Otherwise, do nothing
 45537                                  
 45538 00007A1C 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 45539 00007A1E 3804                    	CMP     [SI],AL                 ;       if (*s == 0) {
 45540 00007A20 751A                    	JNZ	short DoComponent
 45541 00007A22 26807DFF3A              	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI-1],':'	;           if (d[-1] == ':')
 45542 00007A27 7505                    	JNZ	short DoTerminate
 45543 00007A29 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'                  ;               *d++ = '\';
 45544 00007A2B AA                      	STOSB
 45545 00007A2C 88E0                    	MOV     AL,AH
 45546                                  DoTerminate:
 45547 00007A2E AA                      	STOSB                           ;           *d++ = 0;
 45548 00007A2F F8                      	CLC                             ;           return (0);
 45549 00007A30 C3                      	retn
 45550                                  
 45551                                  CanonBad:
 45552 00007A31 E8C701                  	CALL	ScanPathChar            ; check for path chars in rest of string
 45553                                  	;mov	al,3
 45554 00007A34 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for bad path error
 45555 00007A36 7402                    	JZ	short PathEnc		; path character encountered in string
 45556                                  	;mov	al,2
 45557 00007A38 B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; Set bad file error
 45558                                  PathEnc:
 45559 00007A3A F9                      	STC
 45560                                  CanonBad_retn:
 45561 00007A3B C3                      	retn
 45562                                  
 45563                                  ; We have a textual component that we must copy. We uppercase it and truncate
 45564                                  ; it to 8.3
 45565                                  
 45566                                  DoComponent:                            ;           }
 45567 00007A3C E84C00                  	CALL    CopyComponent		;       if (!CopyComponent (s, d))
 45568 00007A3F 72FA                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn	;           return (-1);
 45569                                  
 45570                                  ; We special case the . and .. cases. These will be backed up.
 45571                                  
 45572                                  	;CMP	WORD PTR ES:[DI],'.' + (0 SHL 8)
 45573 00007A41 26833D2E                	CMP	WORD [ES:DI],002Eh
 45574 00007A45 7408                    	JZ	short Skip1
 45575                                  	;CMP	WORD PTR ES:[DI],'..'
 45576 00007A47 26813D2E2E              	CMP     WORD [ES:DI],2E2Eh
 45577 00007A4C 7508                    	JNZ	short CanonNormal
 45578 00007A4E 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ;           d--;
 45579                                  Skip1:  
 45580 00007A4F E82800                  	CALL    SkipBack                ;           SkipBack ();
 45581                                  	;;mov	al,3
 45582                                  	; 07/07/2024 (*)
 45583                                  	;MOV    AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45584 00007A52 72E7                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn ; AL=3 (*)
 45585 00007A54 EB02                    	JMP     short CanonPath         ;           }
 45586                                  
 45587                                  ; We have a normal path. Advance destination pointer over it.
 45588                                  
 45589                                  CanonNormal:                            ;       else
 45590 00007A56 01CF                    	ADD     DI,CX                   ;           d += ct;
 45591                                  
 45592                                  ; We have successfully copied a component. We are now pointing at a path
 45593                                  ; sep char or are pointing at a nul or are pointing at something else.
 45594                                  ; If we point at something else, then we have an error.
 45595                                  
 45596                                  CanonPath:
 45597 00007A58 E81600                  	CALL    PathSep
 45598 00007A5B 75D4                    	JNZ	short CanonBad		; something else...
 45599                                  
 45600                                  ; Copy the first path char we see.
 45601                                  
 45602 00007A5D AC                      	LODSB                           ; get the char
 45603 00007A5E E8E5DF                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it path char?
 45604 00007A61 75B8                    	JNZ	short CanonDec		; no, go test for nul
 45605 00007A63 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ; beyond buffer end?
 45606 00007A65 73CA                    	JAE	short CanonBad		; yep, error.
 45607 00007A67 AA                      	STOSB                           ; copy the one byte
 45608                                  
 45609                                  ; Skip all remaining path chars
 45610                                  
 45611                                  CanonPathLoop:
 45612 00007A68 AC                      	LODSB                           ; get next byte
 45613 00007A69 E8DADF                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; path char again?
 45614 00007A6C 74FA                    	JZ	short CanonPathLoop	; yep, grab another
 45615 00007A6E 4E                      	DEC     SI                      ; back up
 45616 00007A6F EBAB                    	JMP	short  CanonLoop	; go copy component
 45617                                  
 45618                                  ;BREAK <PathSep - determine if char is a path separator>
 45619                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45620                                  ;   PathSep - look at DS:SI and see if char is / \ or NUL
 45621                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to a char
 45622                                  ;   Outputs:    AL has char from DS:SI (/ => \)
 45623                                  ;               Zero set if AL is / \ or NUL
 45624                                  ;               Zero reset otherwise
 45625                                  ;   Registers modified: AL
 45626                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45627                                  
 45628                                  PathSep:
 45629 00007A71 8A04                    	MOV     AL,[SI]                 ; get the character
 45630                                  PathSepGotCh:				; already have character
 45631 00007A73 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL                   ; test for zero
 45632 00007A75 74C4                    	jz	short CanonBad_retn	; return if equal to zero (NUL)
 45633                                  	;call	PATHCHRCMP              ; check for path character
 45634                                  	;retn				; and return HIS determination
 45635                                  	; 18/12/2022
 45636 00007A77 E9CCDF                  	jmp	PATHCHRCMP
 45637                                  
 45638                                  
 45639                                  ;BREAK <SkipBack - move backwards to a path separator>
 45640                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45641                                  ;   SkipBack - look at ES:DI and backup until it points to a / ;   Inputs:     ES:DI - point to a char
 45643                                  ;               BX has current directory back up limit (point to a / \)
 45644                                  ;   Outputs:    ES:DI backed up to point to a path char
 45645                                  ;               AL has char from output ES:DI (path sep if carry clear)
 45646                                  ;               Carry set if illegal backup
 45647                                  ;               Carry Clear if ok
 45648                                  ;   Registers modified: DI,AL
 45649                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45650                                  
 45651                                  SkipBack:
 45652 00007A7A 39DF                    	CMP     DI,BX                   ;   while (TRUE) {
 45653 00007A7C 720A                    	JB	short SkipBad		;       if (d < dlim)
 45654 00007A7E 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ;           goto err;
 45655 00007A7F 268A05                  	MOV     AL,[ES:DI]		;       if (pathchr (*--d))
 45656 00007A82 E8C1DF                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ;           break;
 45657 00007A85 75F3                    	JNZ	short SkipBack		;       }
 45658                                  	;CLC				;   return (0);
 45659                                  	; 01/07/2024
 45660                                  	; cf=0
 45661 00007A87 C3                      	retn				;
 45662                                  SkipBad:                                ;err:
 45663                                  	;mov	al,3
 45664 00007A88 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; bad path error
 45665                                  	;STC				;   return (-1);
 45666                                  	; 01/07/2024
 45667                                  	; cf=1
 45668 00007A8A C3                      	retn				;
 45669                                  
 45670                                  ;Break <CopyComponent - copy out a file path component>
 45671                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45672                                  ;   CopyComponent - copy a file component from a path string (DS:SI) into ES:DI
 45673                                  ;
 45674                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source path
 45675                                  ;               ES:DI - destination
 45676                                  ;               ES:BP - end of buffer
 45677                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - too long
 45678                                  ;               Carry Clear - DS:SI moved past component
 45679                                  ;                   CX has length of destination
 45680                                  ;   Registers modified: AX,CX,DX
 45681                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45682                                  
 45683                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45684                                  
 45685                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45686                                  
 45687                                  CopyComponent:
 45688                                  
 45689                                  %define CopyBP	 [BP]		; word
 45690                                  %define CopyD	 [BP+2]		; dword
 45691                                  %define CopyDoff [BP+2]		; word
 45692                                  %define CopyS	 [BP+6]		; dword
 45693                                  %define CopySoff [BP+6]		; word
 45694                                  %define CopyTemp [BP+10]	; byte
 45695                                  
 45696 00007A8B 83EC0E                  	SUB     SP,14                   ; room for temp buffer
 45697 00007A8E 1E                      	push	ds
 45698 00007A8F 56                      	push	si
 45699 00007A90 06                      	push	es
 45700 00007A91 57                      	push	di
 45701 00007A92 55                      	push	bp
 45702 00007A93 89E5                    	MOV     BP,SP
 45703 00007A95 B42E                    	MOV     AH,'.'
 45704 00007A97 AC                      	LODSB
 45705 00007A98 AA                      	STOSB
 45706 00007A99 38E0                    	CMP     AL,AH                   ;   if ((*d++=*s++) == '.') {
 45707 00007A9B 7518                    	JNZ	short NormalComp
 45708 00007A9D E8D1FF                  	CALL    PathSep                 ;       if (!pathsep(*s))
 45709 00007AA0 740B                    	JZ	short NulTerm
 45710                                  TryTwoDot:
 45711 00007AA2 AC                      	LODSB                           ;           if ((*d++=*s++) != '.'
 45712 00007AA3 AA                      	STOSB
 45713 00007AA4 38E0                    	CMP     AL,AH
 45714 00007AA6 7557                    	JNZ	short CopyBad
 45715 00007AA8 E8C6FF                  	CALL    PathSep
 45716 00007AAB 7552                    	JNZ	short CopyBad		;               || !pathsep (*s))
 45717                                  NulTerm:                                ;               return -1;
 45718 00007AAD 30C0                    	XOR     AL,AL                   ;       *d++ = 0;
 45719 00007AAF AA                      	STOSB
 45720 00007AB0 897606                  	MOV     CopySoff,SI
 45721 00007AB3 EB47                    	JMP     SHORT _GoodRet		;       }
 45722                                  NormalComp:                             ;   else {
 45723 00007AB5 8B7606                  	MOV     SI,CopySoff ; [bp+6]
 45724 00007AB8 E8CFDE                  	call	NameTrans               ;       s = NameTrans (s, Name1);
 45725 00007ABB 3B7606                  	CMP     SI,CopySoff             ;       if (s == CopySOff)
 45726 00007ABE 743F                    	JZ	short CopyBad		;           return (-1);
 45727 00007AC0 36F606[7205]FF          	TEST	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	;       if (!fSharing) {;smr;SS Override
 45728 00007AC6 7510                    	JNZ	short DoPack
 45729 00007AC8 80E201                  	AND     DL,1                    ;           cMeta += fMeta;
 45730 00007ACB 360016[7A05]            	ADD	[ss:CMETA],DL		;           if (cMeta > 0);smr;SS Override
 45731 00007AD0 7F2D                    	JG	short CopyBad		;               return (-1);
 45732 00007AD2 7504                    	JNZ	short DoPack		;           else
 45733 00007AD4 08D2                    	OR      DL,DL                   ;           if (cMeta == 0 && fMeta == 0)
 45734 00007AD6 742F                    	JZ	short CopyBadPath	;               return (-1);
 45735                                  DoPack:                                 ;           }
 45736 00007AD8 897606                  	MOV     CopySoff,SI ; [bp+6]
 45737 00007ADB 16                      	push	ss
 45738 00007ADC 1F                      	pop	ds
 45739 00007ADD BE[4B05]                	MOV     SI,NAME1
 45740 00007AE0 8D7E0A                  	LEA     DI,CopyTemp ; [bp+10]
 45741 00007AE3 57                      	push	di
 45742 00007AE4 E876AB                  	call	PackName                ;       PackName (Name1, temp);
 45743 00007AE7 5F                      	pop	di
 45744 00007AE8 E8CF9C                  	call	StrLen                  ;       if (strlen(temp)+d > bp)
 45745 00007AEB 49                      	DEC     CX
 45746 00007AEC 034E02                  	ADD     CX,CopyDoff ; [bp+2]
 45747                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45748                                  	;cmp	cx,[bp+0]
 45749                                  	; 15/12/2022
 45750                                  	;cmp	cx,[bp]
 45751 00007AEF 3B4E00                  	CMP	CX,CopyBP   ; [bp+0]
 45752 00007AF2 730B                    	JAE	short CopyBad		;           return (-1);
 45753 00007AF4 89FE                    	MOV     SI,DI                   ;       strcpy (d, temp);
 45754 00007AF6 C47E02                  	LES     DI,CopyD    ; [bp+2]
 45755 00007AF9 E8B59C                  	call	FStrCpy
 45756                                  _GoodRet:				;       }
 45757 00007AFC F8                      	CLC
 45758 00007AFD EB0B                    	JMP     SHORT CopyEnd           ;   return 0;
 45759                                  CopyBad:
 45760 00007AFF F9                      	STC
 45761 00007B00 E8F800                  	CALL    ScanPathChar            ; check for path chars in rest of string
 45762                                  	;mov	al,2
 45763 00007B03 B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; Set up for bad file error
 45764 00007B05 7503                    	JNZ	short CopyEnd
 45765                                  CopyBadPath:
 45766 00007B07 F9                      	STC
 45767                                  	;mov	al,3
 45768 00007B08 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set bad path error
 45769                                  CopyEnd:
 45770 00007B0A 5D                      	pop	bp
 45771 00007B0B 5F                      	pop	di
 45772 00007B0C 07                      	pop	es
 45773 00007B0D 5E                      	pop	si
 45774 00007B0E 1F                      	pop	ds
 45775 00007B0F 9F                      	LAHF
 45776 00007B10 83C40E                  	ADD     SP,14                   ; reclaim temp buffer
 45777 00007B13 E8A49C                  	call	StrLen
 45778 00007B16 49                      	DEC     CX
 45779 00007B17 9E                      	SAHF
 45780 00007B18 C3                      	retn

 45788                                  ;Break <Splice - pseudo mount by string substitution>
 45789                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45790                                  ;   Splice - take a string and substitute a prefix if one exists. Change
 45791                                  ;       ThisCDS to point to physical drive CDS.
 45792                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to string
 45793                                  ;               NoSetDir = TRUE => exact matches with splice fail
 45794                                  ;   Outputs:    DS:SI points to thisCDS
 45795                                  ;               ES:DI points to DPB
 45796                                  ;               String at DS:SI may be reduced in length by removing prefix
 45797                                  ;               and substituting drive letter.
 45798                                  ;               CX = 0 If no splice done
 45799                                  ;               CX <> 0 otherwise
 45800                                  ;               ThisCDS points to proper CDS if spliced, otherwise it is
 45801                                  ;                   left alone
 45802                                  ;               ThisDPB points to proper DPB
 45803                                  ;   Registers modified: DS:SI, ES:DI, BX,AX,CX
 45804                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45805                                  
 45806                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45807                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C0A6h
 45808                                  
 45809                                  Splice:
 45810 00007B19 36F606[5A00]FF          	TEST	byte [SS:SPLICES],-1	;smr;SS Override
 45811 00007B1F 7469                    	JZ	short AllDone
 45812 00007B21 36FF36[A205]            	push	word [SS:THISCDS]
 45813 00007B26 36FF36[A405]            	push	word [SS:THISCDS+2]	; TmpCDS = ThisCDS;smr;SS Override
 45814 00007B2B 1E                      	push	ds
 45815 00007B2C 56                      	push	si
 45816 00007B2D 5F                      	pop	di
 45817 00007B2E 07                      	pop	es
 45818 00007B2F 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX                   ;   for (i=1; s = GetCDSFromDrv (i); i++)
 45819                                  SpliceScan:

 45824                                  	;test	byte [si+68],20h
 45825 00007B38 F6444420                	test	byte [si+curdir.flags+1],curdir_splice>>8 ; 04/12/2022
 45826                                  	;;test	word [si+67],2000h
 45827                                  	;TEST	word [SI+curdir.flags],curdir_splice
 45828 00007B3C 74F3                    	JZ	short SpliceScan 	;       if ( Spliced (i) ) {
 45829 00007B3E 57                      	push	di
 45830 00007B3F E8A000                  	CALL    PathPref                ;           if (!PathPref (s, d))
 45831 00007B42 7403                    	JZ	short SpliceFound	;
 45832                                  SpliceSkip:
 45833 00007B44 5F                      	pop	di
 45834 00007B45 EBEA                    	JMP	short SpliceScan	;               continue;
 45835                                  SpliceFound:
 45836 00007B47 26803D00                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],0		;           if (*s || NoSetDir) {
 45837 00007B4B 7508                    	JNZ	short SpliceDo
 45838 00007B4D 36F606[4C03]FF          	TEST	byte [ss:NoSetDir],-1			;smr;SS Override
 45839 00007B53 75EF                    	JNZ	short SpliceSkip
 45840                                  SpliceDo:
 45841 00007B55 89FE                    	MOV     SI,DI                   ;               p = src + strlen (p);
 45842 00007B57 06                      	push	es
 45843 00007B58 1F                      	pop	ds
 45844 00007B59 5F                      	pop	di
 45845 00007B5A E87F00                  	CALL	TextFromDrive1          ;               src = TextFromDrive1(src,i);
 45846 00007B5D 36A1[B605]              	MOV     AX,[SS:CURR_DIR_END]			;smr;SS Override
 45847 00007B61 09C0                    	OR      AX,AX
 45848 00007B63 7808                    	JS	short NoPoke

 45850 00007B67 29F0                    	SUB     AX,SI
 45851 00007B69 36A3[B605]              	MOV     [SS:CURR_DIR_END],AX			;smr;SS Override
 45852                                  NoPoke:
 45853 00007B6D 803C00                  	CMP     BYTE [SI],0		;               if (*p)
 45854 00007B70 7503                    	JNZ	short SpliceCopy	;                   *src++ = '\\';
 45855 00007B72 B05C                    	MOV     AL,"\"
 45856 00007B74 AA                      	STOSB
 45857                                  SpliceCopy:                             ;               strcpy (src, p);
 45858 00007B75 E8399C                  	call	FStrCpy

 45860 00007B7B 80C901                  	OR      CL,1                    ; signal splice done.
 45861 00007B7E EB0C                    	JMP     SHORT DoSet             ;               return;
 45862                                  SpliceDone:                             ;               }
 45863 00007B80 368F06[A405]            	pop	word [SS:THISCDS+2]     ;   ThisCDS = TmpCDS;
 45864 00007B85 368F06[A205]            	pop	word [SS:THISCDS]			;smr;SS Override
 45865                                  AllDone:
 45866 00007B8A 31C9                    	XOR     CX,CX
 45867                                  DoSet:
 45868 00007B8C 36C536[A205]            	LDS     SI,[SS:THISCDS]		;   ThisDPB = ThisCDS->devptr;;smr;SS Override
 45869                                  	;les	di,[si+69]
 45870 00007B91 C47C45                  	LES     DI,[SI+curdir.devptr]
 45871 00007B94 36893E[8A05]            	MOV	[SS:THISDPB],DI				;smr;SS Override
 45872 00007B99 368C06[8C05]            	MOV	[SS:THISDPB+2],ES			;smr;SS Override
 45873                                  Splice_retn:
 45874 00007B9E C3                      	retn

 45885                                  ;Break <$NameTrans - partially process a name>
 45886                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45887                                  ;   $NameTrans - allow users to see what names get mapped to. This call
 45888                                  ;   performs only string substitution and canonicalization, not splicing.  Due
 45889                                  ;   to Transpath playing games with devices, we need to insure that the output
 45890                                  ;   has drive letter and : in it.
 45891                                  ;
 45892                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source string for translation
 45893                                  ;               ES:DI - pointer to buffer
 45894                                  ;   Outputs:
 45895                                  ;       Carry Clear
 45896                                  ;               Buffer at ES:DI is filled in with data
 45897                                  ;               ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string in buffer
 45898                                  ;       Carry Set
 45899                                  ;               AX = error_path_not_found
 45900                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 45901                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45902                                  
 45903                                  _$NameTrans:
 45904 00007B9F 1E                      	push	ds
 45905 00007BA0 56                      	push	si
 45906 00007BA1 06                      	push	es
 45907 00007BA2 57                      	push	di
 45908 00007BA3 51                      	push	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 45909                                  	
 45910                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 45911                                  ; M027 - Start
 45912                                  ;
 45913                                  ; Sattrib must be set up with default values here. Otherwise, the value from
 45914                                  ; a previous DOS call is used for attrib and DevName thinks it is not a 
 45915                                  ; device if the old call set the volume attribute bit. Note that devname in
 45916                                  ; dir2.asm gets ultimately called by Transpath. See also M026. Also save
 45917                                  ; and restore CX.
 45918                                  
 45919                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 45920 00007BA4 B516                    	mov     ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 45921 00007BA6 E8EE02                  	call	SetAttrib
 45922                                  
 45923                                  ; M027 - End
 45924                                  
 45925                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 45926 00007BA9 BF[BE03]                	MOV     DI,OPENBUF
 45927 00007BAC E8EAFC                  	CALL    TransPath               ; to translation (everything)
 45928 00007BAF 59                      	pop	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 45929 00007BB0 5F                      	pop     di
 45930 00007BB1 07                      	pop	es

 45943                                  ;Break   <DriveFromText - return drive number from a text string>
 45944                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45945                                  ;   DriveFromText - examine DS:SI and remove a drive letter, advancing the
 45946                                  ;   pointer.

 45948                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to a text string
 45949                                  ;   Outputs:    AL has drive number

 45975                                  ;   trailing :. TextFromDrive1 takes a 1-based number.
 45976                                  ;

 45992                                  ;Break   <PathPref - see if one path is a prefix of another>
 45993                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45994                                  ;   PathPref - compare DS:SI with ES:DI to see if one is the prefix of the
 45995                                  ;   other.  Remember that only at a pathchar break are we allowed to have a
 45996                                  ;   prefix: A:\ and A:\FOO
 45997                                  ;
 45998                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI potential prefix
 45999                                  ;               ES:DI string
 46000                                  ;   Outputs:    Zero set => prefix found
 46001                                  ;                   DI/SI advanced past matching part
 46002                                  ;               Zero reset => no prefix, DS/SI garbage
 46003                                  ;   Registers modified: CX
 46004                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46005                                  
 46006                                  PathPref:

 46008 00007BE5 49                      	DEC     CX                      ; do not include nul byte
 46009 00007BE6 F3A6                    	REPZ    CMPSB                   ; compare
 46010 00007BE8 75F7                    	jnz	short PathPref_retn	; if NZ then return NZ
 46011 00007BEA 50                      	push	ax			; save char register
 46012 00007BEB 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]               ; get last byte to match
 46013 00007BEE E855DE                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char (Root!)
 46014 00007BF1 7406                    	JZ	short Prefix		; yes, match root (I hope)
 46015                                  NotSep:                                 ; 2/13/KK

 46018                                  Prefix:
 46019 00007BF9 58                      	pop	ax			; get back original
 46020 00007BFA C3                      	retn

 46026                                  ;

 46056                                  ;BREAK <$Open - open a file handle>
 46057                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46058                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 46059                                  ;           LDS     DX, Name
 46060                                  ;           MOV     AH, Open
 46061                                  ;           MOV     AL, access
 46062                                  ;           INT     int_command
 46063                                  ;
 46064                                  ;       ACCESS          Function
 46065                                  ;       ------          --------
 46066                                  ;       open_for_read   file is opened for reading
 46067                                  ;       open_for_write  file is opened for writing
 46068                                  ;       open_for_both   file is opened for both reading and writing.
 46069                                  ;
 46070                                  ;   Error returns:
 46071                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_access
 46072                                  ;              = error_file_not_found
 46073                                  ;              = error_access_denied
 46074                                  ;              = error_too_many_open_files
 46075                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46076                                  
 46077                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 46078                                  ;	BREAK <$Open - open a file from a path string>
 46079                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46080                                  ;
 46081                                  ;**	$OPen - Open a File
 46082                                  ;
 46083                                  ;	given a path name in DS:DX and an open mode in AL, $Open opens the
 46084                                  ;	file and and returns a handle
 46085                                  ;
 46086                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = pointer to asciz name
 46087                                  ;		(AL) = open mode
 46088                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 46089                                  ;		  (ax) = file handle
 46090                                  ;		'C' set if error
 46091                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 46092                                  ;	USES	all
 46093                                  ;
 46094                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46095                                  
 46096                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 46344                                  ;

 46346                                  ;	initial attributes contained in CX

 46369                                  ;	BREAK <$CHMOD - change file attributes>
 46370                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46371                                  ;
 46372                                  ;**	$CHMOD - Change File Attributes
 46373                                  ;
 46374                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 46375                                  ;	    LDS     DX, name
 46376                                  ;	    MOV     CX, attributes
 46377                                  ;	    MOV     AL,func (0=get, 1=set)
 46378                                  ;	    INT     21h
 46379                                  ;   Error returns:
 46380                                  ;	    AX = error_path_not_found
 46381                                  ;	    AX = error_access_denied
 46382                                  ;
 46383                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46384                                  
 46385                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46386                                  
 46387                                  	; 14/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46388                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C27Ch
 46389                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0AFF4h)
 46390                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0AAB2h)
 46391                                  
 46392                                  _$CHMOD:
 46393                                  	; 14/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46394                                  	;;;
 46395 00007CE9 3CFF                    	cmp	al,0FFh		; MS-DOS 7.20 (Win98) - EXTENDED-LENGTH FILENAME OPERATIONS
 46396                                  				; AX = 43FFh
 46397                                  				; BP = 5053h ('PS')
 46398                                  				; CL = function
 46399                                  				; 39h "mkdir" create directory
 46400                                  				; DS:DX -> ASCIZ pathname
 46401                                  				; 56h rename file
 46402                                  				; DS:DX -> ASCIZ filename of existing file (no wildcards)
 46403                                  				; ES:DI -> ASCIZ new filename (no wildcards)
 46404                                  				;
 46405                                  				; ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List
 46406 00007CEB 7520                    	jnz	short std_chmod
 46407 00007CED 81FD5350                	cmp	bp,5053h
 46408 00007CF1 7515                    	jnz	short chmod_x_2

 46511                                  ;	BREAK <$UNLINK - delete a file entry>
 46512                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46513                                  ;
 46514                                  ;**	$UNLINK - Delete a File
 46515                                  ;
 46516                                  ;
 46517                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 46518                                  ;	    LDS     DX, name
 46519                                  ;	    IF VIA SERVER DOS CALL
 46520                                  ;	     MOV     CX,SEARCH_ATTRIB
 46521                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Unlink
 46522                                  ;	    INT     21h
 46523                                  ;
 46524                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds:dx) = path name
 46525                                  ;		(cx) = search_attribute, if via server_dos
 46526                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 46527                                  ;		'C' set if error
 46528                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 46529                                  ;			= error_file_not_found
 46530                                  ;			= error_access_denied
 46531                                  ;
 46532                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46533                                  
 46534                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46535                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C2E4h
 46536                                  
 46537                                  _$UNLINK:
