 46539 00007D4F 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; Point at input string
 46540 00007D51 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; temp spot for path
 46541 00007D54 E846FB                  	call	TransPathSet		; go get normalized path
 46542 00007D57 59                      	pop	cx
 46543 00007D58 7216                    	JC	short ChModErr		; badly formed path
 46544 00007D5A 36803E[7A05]FF          	CMP	byte [ss:CMETA],-1	; meta chars?	;smr;SS Override
 46545 00007D60 750E                    	JNZ	short NotFound
 46546 00007D62 16                      	push	ss
 46547 00007D63 1F                      	pop	ds
 46548                                  	;mov	ch,6
 46549 00007D64 B506                    	mov	ch,attr_hidden+attr_system ; unlink appropriate files
 46550 00007D66 E82E01                  	call	SetAttrib
 46551 00007D69 E8AEAD                  	call	DOS_DELETE		; remove that file
 46552                                  	;JC	short UnlinkE 		; error is there
 46553                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46554 00007D6C 729C                    	jc	short NORERR
 46555

 46699                                  ;Break <$CreateNewFile - Create a new directory entry>
 46700                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46701                                  ;   CreateNew - Create a new directory entry. Return a file handle if there
 46702                                  ;	was no previous directory entry, and fail if a directory entry with
 46703                                  ;	the same name existed previously.
 46704                                  ;
 46705                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an ASCIZ file name
 46706                                  ;		CX contains default file attributes
 46707                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Clear:
 46708                                  ;		    AX has file handle opened for read/write
 46709                                  ;		Carry Set:
 46710                                  ;		    AX has error code
 46711                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 46712                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46713                                  
 46714                                  _$CreateNewFile:
 46715 00007DE8 51                      	push	cx			; Save attributes on stack
 46716 00007DE9 B9[D530]                	MOV	CX,DOS_Create_New	; routine to call
 46717 00007DEC E9F1FE                  	JMP	AccessSet		; use good ol' open
 46718                                  
 46719                                  ;**	BinToAscii - convert a number to a string.
 46720                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46721                                  ;	BinToAscii converts a 16 bit number into a 4 ascii characters.
 46722                                  ;	This routine is used to generate temp file names so we don't spend
 46723                                  ;	the time and code needed for a true hex number, we just use
 46724                                  ;	A thorugh O.
 46725                                  ;
 46726                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = value
 46727                                  ;		(es:di) = destination
 46728                                  ;	EXIT	(es:di) updated by 4
 46729                                  ;	USES	cx, di, flags
 46730                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46731                                  
 46732                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 46733                                  ;BinToAscii:
 46734                                  ;	mov     cx,4
 46735                                  ;bta5:
 46736                                  ;	push    cx
 46737                                  ;	mov     cl,4
 46738                                  ;	rol     ax,cl
 46739                                  ;	push    ax
 46740                                  ;	and     al,0Fh
 46741                                  ;	add     al,'0'
 46742                                  ;	cmp     al,'9'
 46743                                  ;	jbe     short bta6
 46744                                  ;	add     al,7
 46745                                  ;bta6: 
 46746                                  ;	stosb
 46747                                  ;	pop     ax
 46748                                  ;	pop     cx
 46749                                  ;	loop    bta5
 46750                                  ;	retn
 46751                                  
 46752                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46753                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 & Windows ME
 46754                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0B0D9h)
 46755                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0ABA4h)
 46756                                  %if 0
 46757                                  
 46758                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 46759                                  BinToAscii:
 46760                                  	mov	cx,404h			; (ch) = digit counter, (cl) = shift cnt
 46761                                  bta5:	
 46762                                  	ROL	AX,CL			; move leftmost nibble into rightmost
 46763                                  	push	ax			; preserve remainder of digits
 46764                                  	AND	AL,0Fh			; grab low nibble
 46765                                  	ADD	AL,'A'			; turn into ascii
 46766                                  	STOSB				; drop in the character
 46767                                  	pop	ax			; (ax) = shifted number
 46768                                  	dec	ch
 46769                                  	jnz	short bta5		; process 4 digits
 46770                                  	retn
 46771                                  %else
 46772                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46773                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C385h
 46774                                  
 46775                                  BinToAscii:
 46776 00007DEF 50                      	push	ax		; convert a number to a string ; ax = value
 46777 00007DF0 86C4                    	xchg	ah,al
 46778                                  	;db	0D4h,10h
 46779 00007DF2 D410                    	aam	10h		; AH = AL / 16 and AL = remainder
 46780 00007DF4 054141                  	add	ax,4141h	; 'AA'
 46781 00007DF7 AB                      	stosw
 46782 00007DF8 58                      	pop	ax
 46783                                  	;db	0D4h,10h
 46784 00007DF9 D410                    	aam	10h
 46785 00007DFB 054141                  	add	ax,4141h	; add ax,'AA'
 46786 00007DFE AB                      	stosw
 46787 00007DFF C3                      	retn	
 46788                                  %endif
 46789                                  
 46790                                  ;Break	<$CreateTempFile - create a unique name>
 46791                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46792                                  ;   $CreateTemp - given a directory, create a unique name in that directory.
 46793                                  ;	Method used is to get the current time, convert to a name and attempt
 46794                                  ;	a create new. Repeat until create new succeeds.
 46795                                  ;
 46796                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a null terminated directory name.
 46797                                  ;		CX  contains default attributes
 46798                                  ;   Outputs:	Unique name is appended to DS:DX directory.
 46799                                  ;		AX has handle
 46800                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 46801                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46802                                  
 46803                                  	; 10/07/2024
 46804                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46805                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46806                                  
 46807                                  _$CreateTempFile:
 46808                                  	;Enter
 46809 00007E00 55                      	push	bp
 46810 00007E01 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 46811                                  
 46812                                  	;LocalVar  EndPtr,DWORD
 46813                                  	;LocalVar  FilPtr,DWORD
 46814                                  	;LocalVar  Attr,WORD
 46815                                  
 46816 00007E03 83EC0A                  	sub	sp,10
 46817                                  
 46818                                  	;test	cx,0FFD8h
 46819 00007E06 F7C1D8FF                	test	CX,~attr_changeable
 46820 00007E0A 7405                    	JZ	short OKatts		; Ok if no non-changeable bits set
 46821                                  
 46822                                  ; We need this "hook" here to detect these cases (like user sets one both of
 46823                                  ; vol_id and dir bits) because of the structure of the or $CreateNewFile loop
 46824                                  ; below. The code loops on error_access_denied, but if one of the non
 46825                                  ; changeable attributes is specified, the loop COULD be infinite or WILL be
 46826                                  ; infinite because CreateNewFile will fail with access_denied always. Thus we
 46827                                  ; need to detect these cases before getting to the loop.
 46828                                  
 46829                                  	;mov	ax, 5
 46830 00007E0C B80500                  	MOV	AX,error_access_denied
 46831 00007E0F EB7A                    	JMP	SHORT SETTMPERR
 46832                                  
 46833                                  OKatts:
 46834                                  	;MOV	attr,CX 		; save attribute
 46835 00007E11 894EF6                  	mov     [bp-10],cx
 46836                                  	;MOV	FilPtrL,DX		; pointer to file
 46837 00007E14 8956F8                  	mov	[bp-8],dx
 46838                                  	;MOV	FilPtrH,DS
 46839 00007E17 8C5EFA                  	mov	[bp-6],ds
 46840                                  	;MOV	EndPtrH,DS		; seg pointer to end of dir
 46841 00007E1A 8C5EFE                  	mov	[bp-2],ds
 46842 00007E1D 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 46843 00007E1E 07                      	POP	ES			; destination for nul search
 46844 00007E1F 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX
 46845 00007E21 89F9                    	MOV	CX,DI
 46846 00007E23 F7D9                    	NEG	CX			; number of bytes remaining in segment
 46847                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46848 00007E25 09C9                    	OR	CX,CX			;AN000;MS. cx=0 ? ds:dx on segment boundary
 46849 00007E27 7501                    	JNZ	short okok		;AN000;MS. no
 46850                                  	;MOV	CX,-1			;AN000;MS.
 46851                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46852                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46853 00007E29 49                      	dec	cx  ; mov cx,-1
 46854                                  	;mov	cx,-1 ; 0FFFh
 46855                                  okok:					;AN000;
 46856 00007E2A 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			;AN000;
 46857 00007E2C F2AE                    	REPNZ	SCASB			;AN000;
 46858                                  					;AN000;
 46859 00007E2E 4F                      	DEC	DI			; point back to the null
 46860 00007E2F 268A45FF                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI-1]		; Get char before the NUL
 46861 00007E33 E810DC                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; Is it a path separator?
 46862 00007E36 7403                    	JZ	short SETENDPTR		; Yes
 46863                                  STOREPTH:
 46864 00007E38 B05C                    	MOV	AL,'\'
 46865 00007E3A AA                      	STOSB				; Add a path separator (and INC DI)
 46866                                  SETENDPTR:
 46867                                  	; 10/07/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 46868                                  	;MOV	EndPtrL,DI		; pointer to the tail
 46869                                  	; 09/07/2024 (Retro DOS v4 BugFix - Erdogan Tan - Istanbul)
 46870                                  	; (Note: I find this Retro DOS v4 Kernel bug while searching the reason
 46871                                  	;  of the AutoCAD R12 running/startup problem. Now it is solved here.)
 46872                                  	;mov	[bp-4],dl ; (Retro DOS v4 !Bug!)
 46873 00007E3B 897EFC                  	mov	[bp-4],di ; !Fix!
 46874                                  CreateLoop:
 46875 00007E3E 16                      	push	ss			; let ReadTime see variables
 46876 00007E3F 1F                      	pop	ds
 46877 00007E40 55                      	push	bp
 46878 00007E41 E8378D                  	call	READTIME		; go get time
 46879 00007E44 5D                      	pop	bp
 46880                                  ;
 46881                                  ; Time is in CX:DX. Go drop it into the string.
 46882                                  ;
 46883                                  	;les	di,EndPtr		; point to the string
 46884 00007E45 C47EFC                  	les	di,[BP-4]
 46885 00007E48 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx
 46886 00007E4A E8A2FF                  	call	BinToAscii		; store upper word
 46887 00007E4D 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx
 46888 00007E4F E89DFF                  	call	BinToAscii		; store lower word
 46889 00007E52 30C0                    	xor	al,al
 46890 00007E54 AA                      	STOSB				; nul terminate
 46891                                  	;LDS	DX,FilPtr		; get name
 46892 00007E55 C556F8                  	lds	dx,[bp-8]
 46893                                  	;MOV	CX,Attr 		; get attr
 46894 00007E58 8B4EF6                  	mov	cx,[bp-10]
 46895 00007E5B 55                      	push	bp
 46896 00007E5C E889FF                  	CALL	_$CreateNewFile		; try to create a new file
 46897 00007E5F 5D                      	pop	bp
 46898 00007E60 732A                    	JNC	short CreateDone	; failed, go try again
 46899                                  
 46900                                  ; The operation failed and the error has been mapped in AX. Grab the extended
 46901                                  ; error and figure out what to do.
 46902                                  
 46903                                  	;; MSDOS 3.3			; M049 - start
 46904                                  ;;	mov	ax,[ss:EXTERR]				;smr;SS Override
 46905                                  ;;	cmp	al,error_file_exists
 46906                                  ;;	jz	short CreateLoop	; file existed => try with new name
 46907                                  ;;	cmp	al,error_access_denied
 46908                                  ;;	jz	short CreateLoop	; access denied (attr mismatch)
 46909                                  
 46910                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46911                                  	;cmp	al,50h
 46912 00007E62 3C50                    	CMP	AL,error_file_exists	; Q: did file already exist
 46913 00007E64 74D8                    	JZ	short CreateLoop	; Y: try again
 46914                                  	;cmp	al,5
 46915 00007E66 3C05                    	CMP	AL,error_access_denied	; Q: was it access denied
 46916 00007E68 7521                    	JNZ	short SETTMPERR		; N: Error out
 46917                                  					; Y: Check to see if we got this due
 46918                                  					;    to the network drive. Note that
 46919                                  					;    the redir will set the exterr
 46920                                  					;    to error_cannot_make if this is 
 46921                                  					;    so.
 46922                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46923                                  %if 0
 46924                                  	CMP	byte [SS:EXTERR],error_net_access_denied ; M069
 46925                                  					; See if it's REALLY an att mismatch
 46926                                  	je	short SETTMPERR		; no, network error, stop
 46927                                  ;M070
 46928                                  ; If the user failed on an I24, we do not want to try again
 46929                                  ;
 46930                                  	cmp	byte [SS:EXTERR],error_FAIL_I24 ;User failed on I24? ;M070
 46931                                  	;je	short SETTMPERR		;yes, do not try again ;M070
 46932                                  
 46933                                  	;jmp	short CreateLoop	;attr mismatch, try again ;M070
 46934                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46935                                  	jne	short CreateLoop ; 10/06/2019 
 46936                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46937                                  	;jz	short SETTMPERR
 46938                                  	;jmp	short CreateLoop
 46939                                  %else
 46940                                  	; 15/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46941                                  	;;;
 46942 00007E6A 36A0[2403]              	mov	al,[ss:EXTERR]
 46943 00007E6E 3C41                    	cmp	al,41h			; error_net_access_denied
 46944 00007E70 7419                    	je	short SETTMPERR
 46945 00007E72 3C53                    	cmp	al,53h			; error_FAIL_I24
 46946 00007E74 7415                    	je	short SETTMPERR
 46947 00007E76 3C50                    	cmp	al,50h			; error_file_exists
 46948 00007E78 74C4                    	je	short CreateLoop
 46949 00007E7A 36C43E[A205]            	les	di,[ss:THISCDS]
 46950 00007E7F 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh ; -1
 46951 00007E82 74BA                    	je	short CreateLoop	; No CDS
 46952                                  	;;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 46953                                  	;test	word [es:di+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 46954 00007E84 26F6454480              	test	byte [es:di+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 46955 00007E89 75B3                    	jnz	short CreateLoop
 46956                                  	;;;
 46957                                  %endif
 46958                                  
 46959                                  ;;	MOV	AL,error_access_denied	; Return this "extended" error
 46960                                  					; M049 - end
 46961                                  SETTMPERR:
 46962 00007E8B F9                      	STC
 46963                                  CreateDone:
 46964                                  	;Leave
 46965 00007E8C 89EC                    	mov	sp,bp
 46966 00007E8E 5D                      	pop	bp
 46967 00007E8F 7203                    	JC	short CreateFail
 46968 00007E91 E9EB87                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK		; success!
 46969                                  CreateFail:
 46970 00007E94 E9F287                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 46971                                  
 46972                                  ;   SetAttrib will set the search attribute (SAttrib) either to the normal
 46973                                  ;   (CH) or to the value in CL if the current system call is through
 46974                                  ;   serverdoscall.
 46975                                  ;
 46976                                  ;   Inputs:	fSharing == FALSE => set sattrib to CH
 46977                                  ;		fSharing == TRUE => set sattrib to CL
 46978                                  ;   Outputs:	none
 46979                                  ;   Registers changed:	CX
 46980                                  
 46981                                  SetAttrib:
 46982                                  	;test	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1		;smr;SS Override
 46983                                  	;jnz	short Set
 46984                                  	; 15/03/2024
 46985 00007E97 36803E[7205]00          	cmp	byte [ss:FSHARING],0
 46986 00007E9D 7502                    	jnz	short Set
 46987                                  
 46988 00007E9F 88E9                    	mov	cl,ch
 46989                                  Set:
 46990 00007EA1 36880E[6D05]            	mov	byte [ss:SATTRIB],cl		;smr;SS Override
 46991 00007EA6 C3                      	retn

 47007                                  ;Break	<Extended_Open- Extended open the file>
 47008                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47009                                  ; Input: AL= 0 reserved  AH=6CH
 47010                                  ;	 BX= mode
 47011                                  ;	 CL= create attribute  CH=search attribute (from server)
 47012                                  ;	 DX= flag
 47013                                  ;	 DS:SI = file name
 47014                                  ;	 ES:DI = parm list
 47015                                  ;			   DD  SET EA list (-1) null
 47016                                  ;			   DW  n  parameters
 47017                                  ;			   DB  type (TTTTTTLL)
 47018                                  ;			   DW  IOMODE
 47019                                  ; Function: Extended Open
 47020                                  ; Output: carry clear
 47021                                  ;		     AX= handle
 47022                                  ;		     CX=1 file opened
 47023                                  ;			2 file created/opened
 47024                                  ;			3 file replaced/opened
 47025                                  ;	  carry set: AX has error code
 47026                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47027                                  
 47028                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47029                                  	; 16/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47030                                  
 47031                                  _$Extended_Open:			  ;AN000;
 47032                                  	;ASSUME	CS:DOSCODE,SS:DOSDATA	  ;AN000;
 47033 00007EAB 368916[F405]            	MOV	[SS:EXTOPEN_FLAG],DX	  ;AN000;EO. save ext. open flag;smr;SS Override
 47034 00007EB0 36C706[F705]0000        	MOV	word [SS:EXTOPEN_IO_MODE],0 ;AN000;EO. initialize IO mode;smr;SS Override
 47035                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47036 00007EB7 F6C6FE                  	test	dh,0FEh ; 04/12/2022 
 47037                                  	;;test	dx,0FE00h
 47038                                  	;TEST	DX,RESERVED_BITS_MASK	  ;AN000;EO. reserved bits 0 ?
 47039 00007EBA 75EB                    	JNZ	short ext_inval2	  ;AN000;EO. no
 47040 00007EBC 88D4                    	MOV	AH,DL			  ;AN000;EO. make sure flag is right
 47041 00007EBE 80FA00                  	CMP	DL,0			  ;AN000;EO. all fail ?
 47042 00007EC1 74E4                    	JZ	short ext_inval2	  ;AN000;EO. yes, error
 47043                                  	;and	dl,0Fh
 47044 00007EC3 80E20F                  	AND	DL,EXISTS_MASK		  ;AN000;EO. get exists action byte
 47045 00007EC6 80FA02                  	CMP	DL,2			  ;AN000;EO, > 2
 47046 00007EC9 77DC                    	JA	short ext_inval2	  ;AN000;EO. yes, error
 47047                                  	;and	ah,0F0h
 47048 00007ECB 80E4F0                  	AND	AH,NOT_EXISTS_MASK	  ;AN000;EO. get no exists action byte
 47049 00007ECE 80FC10                  	CMP	AH,10H			  ;AN000;EO. > 10
 47050 00007ED1 77D4                    	JA	short ext_inval2	  ;AN000;EO. yes, error
 47051                                  
 47052 00007ED3 368C06[FB05]            	MOV	[SS:SAVE_ES],ES		  ;AN000;EO. save API parms;smr;SS Override
 47053 00007ED8 36893E[F905]            	MOV	[SS:SAVE_DI],DI		  ;AN000;EO.;smr;SS Override
 47054 00007EDD 36FF36[F405]            	PUSH	word [SS:EXTOPEN_FLAG]	  ;AN000;EO.;smr;SS Override
 47055 00007EE2 368F06[FD05]            	POP	word [SS:SAVE_DX]	  ;AN000;EO.;smr;SS Override
 47056 00007EE7 36890E[FF05]            	MOV	[SS:SAVE_CX],CX		  ;AN000;EO.;smr;SS Override
 47057 00007EEC 36891E[0106]            	MOV	[SS:SAVE_BX],BX		  ;AN000;EO.;smr;SS Override
 47058 00007EF1 368C1E[0506]            	MOV	[SS:SAVE_DS],DS		  ;AN000;EO.;smr;SS Override
 47059 00007EF6 368936[0306]            	MOV	[SS:SAVE_SI],SI		  ;AN000;EO.;smr;SS Override
 47060 00007EFB 89F2                    	MOV	DX,SI			  ;AN000;EO. ds:dx points to file name
 47061 00007EFD 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX			  ;AN000;EO. ax= mode
 47062                                  ; 16/03/2024
 47063                                  %if 0
 47064                                  	JMP	SHORT goopen2		  ;AN000;;EO. do normal
 47065                                  ext_inval2:				  ;AN000;;EO.
 47066                                  	;mov	al,1
 47067                                  	mov	al,error_invalid_function ;AN000;EO.. invalid function
 47068                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 47069                                  eo_err:
 47070                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 47071                                  	jmp	short CreateFail
 47072                                  %endif
 47073                                  
 47074                                  ; 16/03/2024

 47252                                  ;
 47253                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47254                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle	       (DOS 3.3)
 47255                                  ;	    MOV     CX, OffsetHigh
 47256                                  ;	    MOV     DX, OffsetLow
 47257                                  ;	    MOV     SI, LengthHigh
 47258                                  ;	    MOV     DI, LengthLow
 47259                                  ;	    MOV     AH, LockOper
 47260                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 47261                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47262                                  ;
 47263                                  ;   Error returns:
 47264                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 47265                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 47266                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 47267                                  ;
 47268                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47269                                  ;	    MOV     AX, 5C??	       (DOS 4.00)
 47270                                  ;
 47271                                  ;				    0? lock all
 47272                                  ;				    8? lock write
 47273                                  ;				    ?2 lock multiple
 47274                                  ;				    ?3 unlock multiple
 47275                                  ;				    ?4 lock/read
 47276                                  ;				    ?5 write/unlock
 47277                                  ;				    ?6 add (lseek EOF/lock/write/unlock)
 47278                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle
 47279                                  ;	    MOV     CX, count or size
 47280                                  ;	    LDS     DX, buffer
 47281                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47282                                  ;
 47283                                  ;   Error returns:
 47284                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 47285                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 47286                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 47287                                  ;
 47288                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47289                                  
 47290                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 47553 00008024 50                      	push	ax ; MSDOS 6.0
 47554

 47556                                  	;Call	far [ss:JShare+(8*4)]	; 8 = chk_block
 47557                                  	;MSDOS 6.0

 47743 000080BA E8F3DB                  	call	HARDERR
 47744                                  ; 01/07/2024
 47745                                  %if 0
 47746                                  	POP	DI
 47747                                  	POP	ES
 47748                                  	POP	DS
 47749                                  	CMP	AL,1
 47750                                  	jz	short shchk_retn	; 1 = retry, carry clear
 47751                                  	STC
 47752                                  	retn
 47753                                  %else
 47754 000080BD EBAD                    	jmp	short sharev_3
 47755                                  %endif
 47756                                  
 47757                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47758                                  ;   ShareEnd - terminate sharing info on a particular SFT/UID/PID. This does
 47759                                  ;       NOT perform a close, it merely asserts that the sharing information
 47760                                  ;       for the SFT/UID/PID may be safely released.
 47761                                  ;
 47762                                  ;   Inputs:     ES:DI points to an SFT
 47763                                  ;   Outputs:    None
 47764                                  ;   Registers modified: all except DS,ES,DI
 47765                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47766                                  
 47767                                  ShareEnd:
 47768                                  	; 26/07/2019
 47769 000080BF FF1E[9800]              	call	far [JShare+(2*4)]	; 2 = MFTClose
 47770 000080C3 C3                      	retn
 47771                                  
 47772                                  ;Break <ShareEnter - attempt to enter a node into the sharing set>
 47773                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47774                                  ;   ShareEnter - perform a retried entry of a nodde into the sharing set. If
 47775                                  ;   the max number of retries is exceeded, we notify the user via int 24.
 47776                                  ;
 47777                                  ;   Inputs:     ThisSFT points to the SFT
 47778                                  ;               WFP_Start points to the WFP
 47779                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry clear => successful entry
 47780                                  ;               Carry set => failed system call
 47781                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 47782                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47783                                  
 47784                                  ShareEnter:
 47785 000080C4 51                      	push	cx
 47786                                  retry:
 47787 000080C5 8B0E[1A00]              	mov     cx,[RetryCount]
 47788                                  attempt:
 47789 000080C9 C43E[9E05]              	les     di,[THISSFT]		; grab sft
 47790 000080CD 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 47791                                   	;mov	[es:di+51],ax
 47792 000080CF 26894533                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],AX ; indicate free SFT
 47793 000080D3 51                      	push	cx
 47794 000080D4 E8ABFF                  	call    SHARE_CHECK             ; attempt to enter into the sharing set
 47795 000080D7 59                      	pop	cx
 47796 000080D8 730A                    	jnc	short done		; success, let the user see this
 47797 000080DA E8F896                  	call	Idle                    ; wait a while
 47798 000080DD E2EA                    	loop    attempt                 ; go back for another attempt
 47799 000080DF E8A5FF                  	call    SHARE_VIOLATION         ; signal the problem to the user
 47800 000080E2 73E1                    	jnc	short retry		; user said to retry, go do it
 47801                                  done:
 47802 000080E4 59                      	pop	cx
 47803 000080E5 C3                      	retn
 47804                                  
 47805                                  ;============================================================================
 47806                                  ; EXEPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 47807                                  ;============================================================================
 47808                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 47809                                  ; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 47810                                  
 47811                                  ;** EXEPATCH.ASM 
 47812                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47813                                  ;	Contains the foll:
 47814                                  ;
 47815                                  ;		- code to find and overlay buggy unpack code
 47816                                  ;		- new code to be overlayed on buggy unpack code 
 47817                                  ;		- old code sequence to identify buggy unpack code
 47818                                  ;
 47819                                  ;	Revision history:
 47820                                  ;
 47821                                  ;		Created: 5/14/90
 47822                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47823                                  
 47824                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47825                                  ;
 47826                                  ; M020 : Fix for rational bug - for details see routine header
 47827                                  ; M028 : 4b04 implementation
 47828                                  ; M030 : Fixing bug in EXEPACKPATCH (EXEC_CS is an un-relocated value)
 47829                                  ; M032 : set turnoff bit only if DOS in HMA.
 47830                                  ; M033 : if IP < 2 then not exepacked.
 47831                                  ; M046 : support for a 4th version of exepacked files.
 47832                                  ; M068 : support for copy protected apps.
 47833                                  ; M071 : use A20OFF_COUNT of 10.
 47834                                  ;
 47835                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47836                                  
 47837                                  PATCH1_COM_OFFSET	EQU	06CH
 47838                                  PATCH1_OFFSET		EQU	028H
 47839                                  PATCH1_CHKSUM		EQU	0EF4EH
 47840                                  CHKSUM1_LEN		EQU	11CH/2 ; 142
 47841                                  
 47842                                  PATCH2_COM_OFFSET	EQU	076H
 47843                                  PATCH2_OFFSET		EQU	032H
 47844                                  
 47845                                  	; The strings that start at offset 076h have two possible 
 47846                                  	; check sums that are defined as PATCH2_CHKSUM PATCH2A_CHKSUM
 47847                                  
 47848                                  PATCH2_CHKSUM		EQU	78B2H
 47849                                  CHKSUM2_LEN		EQU	119H/2
 47850                                  PATCH2A_CHKSUM		EQU	1C47H		; M046
 47851                                  CHKSUM2A_LEN		EQU	103H/2		; M046
 47852                                  
 47853                                  PATCH3_COM_OFFSET	EQU	074H
 47854                                  PATCH3_OFFSET		EQU	032H
 47855                                  PATCH3_CHKSUM		EQU	4EDEH
 47856                                  CHKSUM3_LEN		EQU	117H/2
 47857                                  
 47858                                  ;**	Data structure passed for ExecReady call
 47859                                  ;
 47860                                  ;struc ERStruc
 47861                                  ; .ER_Reserved:	resw	1	; reserved, should be zero
 47862                                  ; .ER_Flags:	resw	1
 47863                                  ; .ER_ProgName:	resd	1	; ptr to ASCIIZ str of prog name
 47864                                  ; .ER_PSP:	resw	1	; PSP of the program
 47865                                  ; .ER_StartAddr: resd	1	; Start CS:IP of the program
 47866                                  ; .ER_ProgSize:	resd	1	; Program size including PSP
 47867                                  ; .size:
 47868                                  ;endstruc
 47869                                  
 47870                                  ;DOSCODE SEGMENT
 47871                                  
 47872                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 47873                                  	; DOSCODE:B3DDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 47874                                  
 47875                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47876                                  	; DOSCODE:B37Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 47877                                  
 47878                                  	; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47879                                  	; DOSCODE:C697h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 47880                                  
 47881                                  ; M028 - BEGIN
 47882                                  
 47883                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47884                                  ;
 47885                                  ;	Procedure Name		: ExecReady
 47886                                  ;
 47887                                  ;	Input			: DS:DX -> ERStruc (see exe.inc)
 47888                                  ;
 47889                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47890                                  
 47891                                  ExecReady:
 47892 000080E6 89D6                    	mov	si,dx			; move the pointer into a friendly one
 47893                                  	;;test	word [si+2],1
 47894                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47895 000080E8 F6440201                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; 1
 47896                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; COM or EXE ?
 47897 000080EC 7418                    	jz	short er_setver		; only setver for .COM files
 47898                                  
 47899                                  	;mov	ax,[si+8]
 47900 000080EE 8B4408                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]
 47901 000080F1 83C010                  	add	ax,10h
 47902 000080F4 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 47903                                  
 47904                                  	;mov	cx,[si+10]
 47905 000080F6 8B4C0A                  	mov	cx,[si+ERStruc.ER_StartAddr]   ; M030
 47906                                  	;mov	ax,[si+12]	; 11/04/2024
 47907 000080F9 8B440C                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_StartAddr+2] ; M030
 47908                                  
 47909                                  	;call	[ss:FixExePatch]
 47910 000080FC 36FF16[670D]            	call	word [ss:FixExePatch] ; 28/12/2022
 47911                                  	
 47912                                  	; 20/03/2024
 47913                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 47914 00008101 36FF16[4612]            	call	word [ss:Rational386PatchPtr]
 47915                                  
 47916                                  er_setver:
 47917                                  	;;test	word [si+2],2		; Q: is this an overlay
 47918                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47919 00008106 F6440202                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_OVERLAY ; 2
 47920                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_OVERLAY
 47921 0000810A 7518                    	jnz	short er_chkdoshi	; Y: set A20OFF_COUNT if DOS high
 47922                                  					; N: set up lie version first
 47923 0000810C 1E                      	push	ds
 47924 0000810D 56                      	push	si
 47925                                  	;lds	si,[si+4]
 47926 0000810E C57404                  	lds	si,[si+ERStruc.ER_ProgName]
 47927 00008111 E8DCEC                  	call	Scan_Execname1
 47928 00008114 E8EDEC                  	call	Scan_Special_Entries
 47929 00008117 5E                      	pop	si
 47930 00008118 1F                      	pop	ds
 47931                                  	;mov	es,[si+8]
 47932 00008119 8E4408                  	mov	es,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]
 47933 0000811C 36A1[BB0E]              	mov	ax,[ss:SPECIAL_VERSION]
 47934                                  	;mov	[es:40h],ax ; 11/04/2024
 47935 00008120 26A34000                	mov	[es:PDB.Version],ax
 47936                                  
 47937                                  er_chkdoshi:
 47938 00008124 36803E[660D]00          	cmp	byte [ss:DosHasHMA],0	; M032: Q: is dos in HMA (M021)
 47939 0000812A 741E                    	je	short er_done		; M032: N: done
 47940                                  
 47941                                  					; M068 - Start
 47942                                  	;mov	ax,[si+8]
 47943 0000812C 8B4408                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]	; ax = PSP
 47944                                  
 47945                                  	;or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],4
 47946 0000812F 36800E[8600]04          	or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],EXECA20OFF ; Set bit to signal int 21
 47947                                  					; ah = 25 & ah= 49. See dossym.inc 
 47948                                  					; under TAG M003 & M009 for 
 47949                                  					; explanation
 47950                                  	;;test	word [si+2],1
 47951                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47952 00008135 F6440201                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; 1
 47953                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; Q: COM file
 47954 00008139 7506                    	jnz	short er_setA20		; N: inc a20off_count, set 
 47955                                  					;    a20off_psp and ret
 47956                                     	; 07/03/2025
 47957                                  	;push	ds
 47958                                  	;mov	ds,ax			; DS = load segment of com file.
 47959                                  	;call	IsCopyProt ; !*!	; check if copy protected
 47960                                  	;pop	ds
 47961                                  
 47962                                  	; 07/03/2025 (MiniDOS 1.0)
 47963 0000813B 36C606[8500]0A          	mov	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT],0Ah ; *!*
 47964                                  
 47965                                  er_setA20:
 47966                                  	; We need to inc the A20OFF_COUNT here. Note that if the count
 47967                                  	; is non-zero at this point it indicates that the A20 is to be 
 47968                                  	; turned off for that many int 21 calls made by the app. In 
 47969                                  	; addition the A20 has to be turned off when we exit from this 
 47970                                  	; call. Hence the inc.
 47971                                  
 47972 00008141 36FE06[8500]            	inc	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT]		
 47973 00008146 36A3[6300]              	mov	[ss:A20OFF_PSP],ax	; set the PSP for which A20 is to be
 47974                                  					; turned OFF.
 47975                                  er_done:				; M068 - End
 47976 0000814A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 47977 0000814C C3                      	retn
 47978

 47986                                  ; 22/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSINIT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 47987                                  ;
 47988                                  ; MAIN ENTRY FOR DOS INITIALIZATION
 47989                                  ;
 47990                                  	; 15/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 47992                                  
 47993                                  ; temp iret instruction
 47994                                  
 47995                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47996                                  ; DOSCODE:B76Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 47997                                  
 47998                                  initiret: ; MSDOS 6.0
 47999                                  SYSBUF:
 48000                                  ;IRETT: ; 06/05/2019
 48001 0000814D CF                      	iret
 48002                                  
 48003                                  ; 22/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48004                                  
 48005                                  ; pointer to the BIOS data segment that will be available just to the
 48006                                  ; initialization code
 48007                                  
 48008 0000814E 7000                    InitBioDataSeg:	dw 70h ; KERNEL_SEGMENT = 0070h
 48009                                  
 48010                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48011                                  ; DOSCODE:B76Dh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 48012                                  
 48013                                  ; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48014                                  ; DOSCODE:CCE1h (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48015                                  
 48016                                  ; Convert AX from a number of bytes to a number of paragraphs (round up).
 48017                                  
 48018                                  ParaRound:
 48019 00008150 83C00F                  	add	ax, 15
 48020 00008153 D1D8                    	rcr	ax, 1
 48021 00008155 D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1
 48022 00008157 D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1
 48023 00008159 D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1
 48024 0000815B C3                      	retn

 48032                                  
 48033                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48034                                  ;
 48035                                  ; Procedure Name : WhatCPUType
 48036                                  ;
 48037                                  ; Inputs	 : none
 48038                                  ;
 48039                                  ; Outputs	 : AL = 0 if CPU <  286
 48040                                  ;		      = 1 if CPU == 286
 48041                                  ;		      = 2 if CPU >= 386
 48042                                  ;
 48043                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : AX
 48044                                  ;
 48045                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48046                                  
 48047                                  WhatCPUType:
 48048                                  	; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48049                                  	;get_cpu_type	; done with a MACRO which can't be generated > once
 48050                                  
 48051                                  	;CPUTYPE.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 48052                                  
 48053                                  ; Note: this must be a macro, and not a subroutine in the BIOS since
 48054                                  ; 	it is called from both CODE and SYSINITSEG.
 48055                                  ;
 48056                                  ;------GET_CPU_TYPE-----------------------------------May, 88 by M.Williamson
 48057                                  ;  Returns: AX = 0 if 8086 or 8088
 48058                                  ;              = 1 if 80286
 48059                                  ;              = 2 if 80386
 48060                                  
 48061                                  	; 04/11/2022
 48062                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB03h
 48063                                  
 48064                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48065                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0CCEDh
 48066                                  
 48067                                  Get_CPU_Type:	;macro
 48068 0000815C 9C                      	pushf
 48069 0000815D 53                      	push	bx			; preserve bx
 48070 0000815E 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; init bx to zero
 48071                                  
 48072 00008160 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; 0000 into AX
 48073 00008162 50                      	push	ax			; put it on the stack...
 48074 00008163 9D                      	popf				; ...then shove it into the flags
 48075 00008164 9C                      	pushf				; get it back out of the flags...
 48076 00008165 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and into ax
 48077 00008166 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; mask off high four bits
 48078 00008169 3D00F0                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; was it all 1's?
 48079 0000816C 740E                    	je	short cpu_8086		; aye; it's an 8086 or 8088
 48080                                  
 48081 0000816E B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; now try to set the high four bits..
 48082 00008171 50                      	push	ax
 48083 00008172 9D                      	popf
 48084 00008173 9C                      	pushf
 48085 00008174 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and see what happens
 48086 00008175 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; any high bits set ?
 48087 00008178 7401                    	jz	short cpu_286		; nay; it's an 80286
 48088                                  cpu_386:				; bx starts as zero
 48089 0000817A 43                      	inc	bx			; inc twice if 386
 48090                                  cpu_286:				; just inc once if 286
 48091 0000817B 43                      	inc	bx
 48092                                  cpu_8086:				; don't inc at all if 086
 48093 0000817C 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx			; put CPU type value in ax
 48094 0000817E 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore original bx
 48095 0000817F 9D                      	popf
 48096                                  	
 48097                                  	;endm
 48098                                  
 48099                                  	; 04/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48100 00008180 C3                      	retn	; 19/09/2023
 48101                                  
 48102                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48103                                  %endif	; 28/12/2022

 48106                                  
 48107                                  ; MAIN ENTRY FOR DOS INITIALIZATION
 48108                                  
 48109                                  	; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48110                                  	; DOSCODE:B779h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48111                                  
 48112                                  	; 23/03/2024
 48113                                  	; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48114                                  	; DOSCODE:CCEDh (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48115                                  
 48116                                  	; DOSCODE:BA57h (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS)
 48117                                  	; BIOSCODE:CF81h (Windows ME IO.SYS)
 48118                                  	
 48119                                  	; 30/05/2019
 48120                                  	; 22/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48121                                  	; 07/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 48122                                  	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 03/03/2018
 48123                                  	; 03/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48124                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 79A9h
 48125                                  DOSINIT:
 48126                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 7C77h
 48127                                  	;
 48128                                  	; Far call from SYSINIT
 48129                                  	; DX = Memory size in paragraphs
 48130                                  	; DS:SI = [DEVICE_LIST] (SYSINIT.S) 
 48131                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v2.0, 16/03/2018)
 48132                                  	;
 48133                                  	; ES:DI = ptr to BIOS communication block (sysinit3.s)
 48134                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v4.0, 20/04/2019)
 48135                                  
 48136 00008181 FA                              CLI
 48137 00008182 FC                              CLD
 48138                                  
 48139                                  	; 03/11/2022
 48140                                  	;push	dx ; 30/05/2019		; save parameters from BIOS
 48141                                  	
 48142                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48143                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48144                                  	;push	dx ; =*=		; save parameters from BIOS
 48145                                  	
 48146 00008183 56                      	push	si
 48147 00008184 1E                      	push	ds
 48148 00008185 57                      	push	di			;save di (ptr to BiosComBlock)
 48149                                  
 48150 00008186 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			;bx:di = ptr to BiosComBlock
 48151                                  
 48152                                  ; First, move the DOS data segment to its final location in low memory
 48153                                  
 48154                                  	;;;mov	ax,0BF69h ; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS, file offset 7C7Fh
 48155                                  	;;mov	ax,0BC77h ; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS, file offset 79B1h
 48156                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48157                                  	;mov	ax,0D20Fh ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM, file offset 92FFh
 48158 00008188 B8[F885]                	mov	ax,MEMSTRT		; get offset of end of init code
 48159                                  
 48160                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48161 0000818B 83C00F                  	add	ax,15			; round to nearest paragraph
 48162                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; boundary
 48163                                  	; 12/04/2024
 48164 0000818E 24F0                    	and	al,0F0h
 48165                                  
 48166 00008190 89C6                    	mov	si,ax			; si = offset of DOSDATA in current
 48167                                  					; code segment
 48168                                  	; 05/12/2022
 48169                                  	; 30/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48170                                  	;xor	si,si
 48171                                  	
 48172                                  	;mov	ax,cs
 48173                                  	;mov	ds,ax			; ds = current code segment
 48174                                  					; DS:SI now points to dosdata
 48175                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48176 00008192 0E                      	push	cs
 48177 00008193 1F                      	pop	ds
 48178                                  
 48179                                  	;mov	es,[cs:0BA49h] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, offset 7C8Eh 
 48180                                  	;mov	es,[cs:InitBioDataSeg]	; First access to DosDataSg in
 48181                                  					;  BData segment. Cannot use
 48182                                  					;  getdseg macro here!!!
 48183                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48184 00008194 8E06[4E81]              	mov	es,[InitBioDataSeg]
 48185                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48186                                  	;mov	es,[cs:InitBioDataSeg]  ; ds = cs !
 48187                                  
 48188                                  	;mov	es,[es:3]
 48189 00008198 268E060300              	mov	es,[es:DosDataSg]	; Get free location in low memory
 48190                                  
 48191 0000819D 31FF                    	xor	di,di			; ES:DI now points to RAM data
 48192                                  
 48193                                  	;mov	cx,4970  ; Offset 0BA78h in MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
 48194                                  	;mov	cx,4976  ; 25/05/2019
 48195                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48196                                  	;mov	cx,4934	 ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 48197                                  	; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48198                                  	;mov	cx,4962
 48199                                  	;mov	cx,MSDAT001E		; get end of dosdata = size of dosdata
 48200 0000819F B94812                  	mov	cx,DOSDATASIZE	; = 4962 for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 48201                                  				; = 4934 for PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM ; 01/07/2024
 48202 000081A2 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; move data to final location
 48203                                  	
 48204 000081A4 5F                      	pop	di			; restore ptr to BiosComBlock
 48205 000081A5 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore parms from BIOS
 48206 000081A6 5E                      	pop	si
 48207                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48208                                  	;pop	dx ; 30/05/2019	
 48209                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48210                                  	;pop	dx ; =*=
 48211                                  
 48212 000081A7 06                      	push	es
 48213 000081A8 1E                      	push	ds
 48214 000081A9 07                      	pop	es			; es:si -> device chain
 48215 000081AA 1F                      	pop	ds			; ds points to dosdata
 48216

 49047                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49048                                  ;
 49049                                  ;	check_XMM: routine to check presence of XMM driver
 49050                                  ;
 49051                                  ;	Exit:   Sets up the XMM entry point in XMMcontrol in DOSDATA
 49052                                  ;
 49053                                  ;	USED:	none
 49054                                  ;
 49055                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49056                                  
 49057                                  check_XMM: ; proc near
 49058                                  ;
 49059                                  ; determine whether or not an XMM driver is installed
 49060                                  ;
 49061 0000847F 50                      	push	ax
 49062                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_INSTALL_CHECK
 49063 00008480 B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 49064 00008483 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 49065                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 49066                                  		; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 49067                                  		; AL <> 80h no driver
 49068 00008485 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h			; Q: installed
 49069 00008487 751D                    	jne	short cXMM_no_driver	; N: set error, quit
 49070                                  ;
 49071                                  ; get the XMM control functions entry point, save it, we
 49072                                  ; need to call it later.
 49073                                  ;
 49074 00008489 53                      	push	bx
 49075 0000848A 52                      	push	dx
 49076 0000848B 1E                      	push	ds
 49077 0000848C 06                      	push	es
 49078                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_FUNCTION_ADDR
 49079 0000848D B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 49080 00008490 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 49081                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 49082                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 49083                                  
 49084 00008492 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 49085                                  
 49086 00008497 891E[4D10]              	mov	[XMMcontrol],bx
 49087 0000849B 8C06[4F10]              	mov	[XMMcontrol+2],es
 49088                                  cXMMexit:
 49089 0000849F F8                      	clc
 49090 000084A0 07                      	pop	es
 49091 000084A1 1F                      	pop	ds
 49092 000084A2 5A                      	pop	dx
 49093 000084A3 5B                      	pop	bx
 49094 000084A4 58                      	pop	ax
 49095 000084A5 C3                      	retn				; done
 49096                                  ;
 49097                                  ; set carry if XMM driver not present
 49098                                  ;
 49099                                  cXMM_no_driver:
 49100 000084A6 F9                      	stc
 49101 000084A7 58                      	pop	ax
 49102 000084A8 C3                      	retn

 49104                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49105                                  ;
 49106                                  ; Procedure Name : seg_reinit
 49107                                  ;
 49108                                  ; Inputs	 : ES has final dos code location
 49109                                  ;		   AX = 0 / 1
 49110                                  ;
 49111                                  ; Outputs	 : Patch in the sharer and other tables with seg in ES
 49112                                  ;		   if AX =0
 49113                                  ;		      if first entry
 49114                                  ;			 patch segment & offset of vectors with stub
 49115                                  ;			 and stub with segment in ES
 49116                                  ;		      else
 49117                                  ;			 patch stub with segment in ES
 49118                                  ;
 49119                                  ;		   else if AX = 1
 49120                                  ;			patch segment of vectors with segment in ES
 49121                                  ;
 49122                                  ; NOTE		 : This routine can be called at most twice!
 49123                                  ;
 49124                                  ; Regs Mod.	 : es, ax, di, cx, bx
 49125                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49126                                  
 49127 000084A9 00                      num_entry: db	0		; keeps track of the # of times this routine
 49128                                  				; has been called. (0 or 1)
 49129                                  
 49130                                  	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 5.0)
 49131                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BAB7h
 49132                                  	; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 6.21)
 49133                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BDA5h
 49134                                  
 49135                                  	; 23/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (ref: PCDOS 7.1)
 49136                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0D07Eh
 49137                                  
 49138                                  seg_reinit:	; proc	far
 49139 000084AA 1E                      	push	ds
 49140

 49604                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49605                                  ;
 49606                                  ; 	Procedure Name	:	patch_in_nops
 49607                                  ;
 49608                                  ; 	Entry		: 	ES -> DOSDATA
 49609                                  ;
 49610                                  ;	Regs Mod	: 	cx, di
 49611                                  ;
 49612                                  ;	Description:
 49613                                  ;		This routine patches in 2 nops at the offsets specified in 
 49614                                  ;	patch_table. This basically enables the low mem stub to start 
 49615                                  ;	making XMS calls.
 49616                                  ;
 49617                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49618                                  
 49619                                  	; 04/11/2022
 49620                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BC50h
 49621                                  
 49622                                  	; 23/03/2024
 49623                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BF42h
 49624                                  	; 23/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 49625                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0D1E9h
 49626                                  
 49627                                  patch_table:	; label	byte
 49628                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i0patch
 49629                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i20patch
 49630                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i21patch
 49631                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i25patch
 49632                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i26patch
 49633                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i27patch
 49634                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i2fpatch
 49635                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:cpmpatch

 49872                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 49873                                  ;; NOTE: INT 21H AH=52H !  (http://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_21-52.html)
 49874                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 49875                                  ;; INT 21,52 - Get Pointer to DOS "INVARS" (Undocumented)
 49876                                  ;;
 49877                                  ;;	AH = 52h
 49878                                  ;;
 49879                                  ;;	on return:
 49880                                  ;;	ES:BX = pointer to DOS "invars", a table of pointers used by DOS.
 49881                                  ;;		Known "invars" fields follow (varies with DOS version):
 49882                                  ;;
 49883                                  ;;	Offset Size		 Description
 49884                                  ;;
 49885                                  ;;	 -12   word   sharing retry count (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 49886                                  ;;	 -10   word   sharing retry delay  (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 49887                                  ;;	  -8   dword  pointer to current disk buffer (DOS 3.x)
 49888                                  ;;	  -4   word   pointer in DOS code segment of unread CON input;
 49889                                  ;;		      0 indicates no unread input (DOS 3.x)
 49890                                  ;;	  -2   word   segment of first Memory Control Block (MCB)
 49891                                  ;;	  00   dword  pointer to first DRIVE PARAMETER TABLE (A:) in chain
 49892                                  ;;	  04   dword  pointer to DOS System File Table (SFT)
 49893                                  ;;	  08   dword  pointer to $CLOCK device driver
 49894                                  ;;	  0C   dword  pointer to CON device driver
 49895                                  ;;	  10   byte   number of logical drives in system
 49896                                  ;;	  11   word   maximum bytes/block of any block device
 49897                                  ;;	  13   dword  pointer to DOS cache buffer header
 49898                                  ;;	  17 18bytes  NUL device header, first 4 bytes of device header
 49899                                  ;;		      point to the next device in device chain
 49900                                  ;;
 49901                                  ;;***************************************************************************

 50114                                  
 50115                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 50116                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50117                                  
 50118                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 50119                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 50120                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 50121                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 50122                                  ;
 50123                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 50124                                  ; describing that data item.
 50125                                  
 50126                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 50127                                  
 50128                                  ;
 50129                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 50130                                  ;
 50131                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 50132                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 50133                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 50134                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 50135                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 50136                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 50137                                  ;
 50138                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 50139                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 50140                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 50141                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 50142                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 50143                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 50144                                  ;   as EOF).
 50145                                  
 50146                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 50147                                  
 50148                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 50149                                  
 50150                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table
 50151 000000CC FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link to next table
 50152 000000CE FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link seg to next table
 50153                                  		;dw 5 ; 24/03/2024
 50154 000000D0 0500                    		DW sf_default_number	; [SYSTEM] Number of entries in table
 50155                                  		;times 295 db 0 ; MSDOS 6.0 ; PCDOS 7.1  ; 24/03/2024
 50156 000000D2 00<rep 127h>            		times (sf_default_number*sf_entry_size) db 0
 50157                                  
 50158                                  ; the next two variables relate to the position of the logical stdout/stdin
 50159                                  ; cursor. They are only meaningful when stdin/stdout are assigned to the
 50160                                  ; console.
 50161                                  		; DOSDATA:01F9h (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 24/03/2024
 50162 000001F9 00                      CARPOS:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] cursor position in stdin
 50163 000001FA 00                      STARTPOS:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] position of cursor at beginning
 50164                                  					;	   of buffered input call
 50165 000001FB 00<rep 80h>             INBUF:		times 128 db 0		; [SYSTEM] general device input buffer
 50166 0000027B 00<rep 83h>             CONBUF:		times 131 db 0		; [SYSTEM] The rest of INBUF and console buffer
 50167                                  		; DOSDATA:02FEh (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1
 50168 000002FE 00                      PFLAG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] printer echoing flag
 50169 000002FF 00                      VERFLG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] Initialize with verify off
 50170 00000300 03                      CHARCO:		db 00000011b ; 3	; [SYSTEM] Allows statchks every 4 chars...
 50171                                  switch_character:
 50172 00000301 2F                      chSwitch:	db '/'			; UNUSED - obsolete datum, can be reused
 50173 00000302 00                      AllocMethod:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] how to alloc first(best)last
 50174 00000303 00                      fShare:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] TRUE => sharing installed
 50175 00000304 01                      DIFFNAM:	db 1			; [SYSTEM] Indicates when MYNAME has changed
 50176 00000305 20<rep 10h>             MYNAME:		times 16 db 20h		; [SYSTEM] My network name
 50177

 50179                                  ; PUSH AX to enable the critical sections
