 50386                                  ;============================================================================
 50387                                  ; MS_DATA.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 50388                                  ;============================================================================
 50389                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 50390                                  
 50391                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 50392                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 50393                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 50394                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 50395                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 50396                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 50397                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 50398                                  ; **********************************************************
 50399                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 50400                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 50401                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 50402                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 50403                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 50404                                  ; **********************************************************	
 50405                                  
 50406                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 50407                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50408                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 50409                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 50410                                  
 50411                                  ; 	ORG     0
 50412                                  
 50413                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 50414                                  
 50415                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 50416                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 50417 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 50418 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 50419                                  
 50420                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 50421                                  
 50422                                  ; DOSDATA:03BEh
 50423                                  OPENBUF: ;times 64  dw	0
 50424 000003BE 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for name operations
 50425                                  RENBUF:	
 50426 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 50427                                  
 50428                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 50429                                  SEARCHBUF:	
 50430 000004BE 00<rep 35h>             	times	53  db	0		; internal search buffer
 50431                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0
 50432 000004F3 00<rep 58h>             	times	curdirLen db 0
 50433                                  
 50434                                  ; End of contiguous buffer
 50435                                   
 50436                                  ; Temporary directory entry for use by many routines. Device directory
 50437                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.
 50438                                  
 50439                                  ; DOSDATA:054Bh
 50440                                  
 50441                                  DEVFCB:	; LABEL   BYTE			; Uses NAME1, NAME2, combined
 50442                                  
 50443                                  ; WARNING..  do not alter position of NAME1 relative to DEVFCB
 50444                                  ; without first examining BUILD_DEVICE_ENT. Look carefully at DOS_RENAME
 50445                                  ; as well as it is the only guy who uses NAME2 and DESTSTART.
 50446                                  
 50447                                  NAME1:	
 50448 0000054B 00<rep Ch>                      times 	12 db	0		; File name buffer
 50449                                  NAME2:
 50450 00000557 00<rep Dh>              	times	13 db	0 		;
 50451                                  DESTSTART:
 50452 00000564 0000                    	dw	0			;

 50454                                  	;times	5  db	0

 50456                                  
 50457                                  ; End Temporary directory entry.
 50458

 51001                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:0CF5h
 51002                                  ; 24/03/2024
 51003                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0D6Bh
 51004                                  
 51005                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51006                                  ;
 51007                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 51008                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 51009                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 51010                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 51011                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 51012                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51013                                  ; Example:
 51014                                  
 51015                                  MAP_CASE:
 51016                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 51017                                  
 51018 00000D6B 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 51019                                  	;JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 51020                                  	;RETF
 51021                                  	; 24/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 51022                                  	;;;
 51023 00000D6D 720C                    	jb	short L_RET     ;Map no chars below 80H ever
 51024                                  	;;;
 51025                                  Map1:
 51026 00000D6F 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 51027 00000D71 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 51028 00000D72 53                      	PUSH	BX
 51029 00000D73 BB[FC0A]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 51030                                  FINISH:
 51031 00000D76 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 51032 00000D77 1F                      	POP	DS
 51033 00000D78 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 51034 00000D79 5B                      	POP	BX
 51035 00000D7A 1F                      	POP	DS
 51036                                  L_RET:	
 51037 00000D7B CB                      	RETF
 51038                                  
 51039                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 51040                                  
 51041                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51042

 51387                                  ; DOSDATA:0DDBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 51388                                  ; 24/03/2024
 51389                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0DDBh
 51390                                  
 51391                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51392                                  ;
 51393                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 51394                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 51395                                  ;
 51396                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 51397                                  ;
 51398                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 51399                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 51400                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 51401                                  ;
 51402                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51403                                  
 51404                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 51405                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 51406                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 51407                                  ;ELSE
 51408                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 51409                                  ;ENDIF
 51410                                  ;ENDM
 51411

 51830                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51831                                  ;
 51832                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 51833                                  ;
 51834                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts
 51835                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the
 51836                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 51837                                  ;
 51838                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 51839                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 51840                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 51841                                  ;	   4. else 
 51842                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 51843                                  ;	   6. endif
 51844                                  ;	7. else
 51845                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 51846                                  ;	9. endif
 51847                                  ;
 51848                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51849                                  
 51850                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 51851                                  
 51852                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 51853                                  
 51854                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 51855                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0F9Eh
 51856                                  
 51857                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51858                                  ;
 51859                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 51860                                  ;
 51861                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51862                                  
 51863                                  ldivov:
 51864                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51865                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51866                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51867                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51868                                  i0patch:
 51869 00000F70 EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont
 51870                                  
 51871 00000F72 E8E200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51872                                  divov_cont:
 51873 00000F75 2EFF2E[4C0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 51874                                  
 51875                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51876                                  ;
 51877                                  ; INT 20h Handler
 51878                                  ;
 51879                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 51880                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 51881                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 51882                                  ; will be restored then.
 51883                                  ;
 51884                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51885                                  
 51886                                  lquit:
 51887                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51888                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51889                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51890                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51891                                  i20patch:
 51892 00000F7A EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont
 51893                                  
 51894 00000F7C E8D800                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51895                                  quit_cont:
 51896 00000F7F 2EFF2E[500F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 51897                                  
 51898                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51899                                  ;
 51900                                  ; INT 21h Handler
 51901                                  ;
 51902                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51903                                  
 51904                                  lcommand:
 51905                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51906                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51907                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51908                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51909                                  i21patch:
 51910 00000F84 EB03                    	jmp	short command_cont
 51911                                  
 51912 00000F86 E8CE00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51913                                  command_cont:
 51914 00000F89 2EFF2E[540F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+8]	; jmp to DOS
 51915                                  
 51916                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51917                                  ;
 51918                                  ; INT 25h
 51919                                  ;
 51920                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51921                                  
 51922                                  labsdrd:
 51923                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51924                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51925                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51926                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51927                                  i25patch:
 51928 00000F8E EB03                    	jmp	short absdrd_cont
 51929                                  
 51930 00000F90 E8C400                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51931                                  absdrd_cont:
 51932 00000F93 2EFF2E[580F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+12]	; jmp to DOS
 51933                                  
 51934                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51935                                  ;
 51936                                  ; INT 26h
 51937                                  ;
 51938                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51939                                  
 51940                                  labsdwrt:
 51941                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51942                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51943                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51944                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51945                                  i26patch:
 51946 00000F98 EB03                    	jmp	short absdwrt_cont

 51949                                  absdwrt_cont:
 51950 00000F9D 2EFF2E[5C0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+16]	; jmp to DOS

 51954                                  ; INT 27h
 51955                                  ;
 51956                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51957

 51959                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to

 51961                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51962                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51963                                  i27patch:
 51964 00000FA2 EB03                    	jmp	short sr_cont
 51965                                  
 51966 00000FA4 E8B000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51967                                  sr_cont:
 51968 00000FA7 2EFF2E[600F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+20]	; jmp to DOS
 51969                                  
 51970                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51971                                  ;
 51972                                  ; INT 2Fh
 51973                                  ;
 51974                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51975                                  
 51976                                  lint2f:
 51977                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51978                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51979                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51980                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51981                                  i2fpatch:
 51982 00000FAC EB03                    	jmp	short int2f_cont
 51983                                  
 51984 00000FAE E8A600                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51985                                  int2f_cont:
 51986 00000FB1 2EFF2E[640F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+24]	; jmp to DOS
 51987                                  
 51988                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51989                                  ;
 51990                                  ; CPM entry
 51991                                  ;
 51992                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51993                                  
 51994                                  lcall_entry:
 51995                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51996                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51997                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51998                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51999                                  cpmpatch:
 52000 00000FB6 EB03                    	jmp	short callentry_cont
 52001                                  
 52002 00000FB8 E89C00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52003                                  callentry_cont:
 52004 00000FBB 2EFF2E[680F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+28]	; jmp to DOS
 52005

 52007

 52010                                  %if 0
 52011                                  
 52012                                  lirett:
 52013                                  	iret
 52014                                  
 52015                                  %endif
 52016                                  
 52017                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52018                                  ;
 52019                                  ; LowIntXX:
 52020                                  ;
 52021                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 52022                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 52023                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 52024                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 52025                                  ;
 52026                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 52027                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 52028                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 52029                                  ;
 52030                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 52031                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 52032                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 52033                                  ;
 52034                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52035                                  
 52036                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52037                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0FEEh
 52038                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:10DBh)
 52039                                  
 52040 00000FC0 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 52041 00000FC4 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 52042                                  
 52043                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52044                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 52045                                  %if 0
 52046                                  DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 52047                                  %endif
 52048                                  
 52049                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 52050                                  LowInt23:
 52051                                  					; save the return address that is on
 52052                                  					; the stack
 52053 00000FC8 2E8F06[C00F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 52054 00000FCD 2E8F06[C20F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 52055                                  
 52056 00000FD2 CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 52057                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52058                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52059                                  
 52060 00000FD4 E88000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52061                                  
 52062 00000FD7 2EFF2E[C00F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 52063                                  
 52064                                  
 52065                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 52066                                  LowInt24:
 52067                                  					; save the return address that is on
 52068                                  					; the stack
 52069 00000FDC 2E8F06[C40F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 52070 00000FE1 2E8F06[C60F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 52071                                  
 52072 00000FE6 CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 52073                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52074                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52075                                  
 52076 00000FE8 E86C00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52077                                  
 52078 00000FEB 2EFF2E[C40F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 52079                                  
 52080                                  
 52081                                   
 52082                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 52083                                  LowInt28:
 52084 00000FF0 CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 52085                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52086                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52087                                  
 52088 00000FF2 E86200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52089                                  
 52090 00000FF5 CB                      	retf
 52091                                  
 52092                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 52093                                  
 52094                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52095                                  ;
 52096                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 52097                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 52098                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 52099                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 52100                                  ;
 52101                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 52102                                  
 52103                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52104                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1024h
 52105                                  
 52106                                  disa20_xfer:
 52107 00000FF6 E84800                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 52108                                  
 52109                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 52110                                  
 52111                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 52112                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 52113                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 52114                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 52115                                  
 52116 00000FF9 FA                      	cli
 52117 00000FFA 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 52118                                  
 52119                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52120                                  	;;;
 52121 00001000 36C606[C011]00          	mov     byte [ss:INDOS_FLAG],0
 52122                                  	;;;
 52123                                  
 52124 00001006 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 52125 00001008 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 52126 0000100A FB                      	sti
 52127                                  
 52128 0000100B 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 52129 0000100C 56                      	push	SI
 52130 0000100D 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 52131 0000100F 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 52132 00001011 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 52133 00001013 CB                      	retf
 52134                                  
 52135                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52136                                  ;
 52137                                  ; M003:
 52138                                  ;
 52139                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 52140                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning
 52141                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 52142                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for
 52143                                  ; more info.
 52144                                  ;
 52145                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that
 52146                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's
 52147                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 52148                                  ;
 52149                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52150                                  
 52151                                  disa20_iret:
 52152 00001014 E82A00                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 52153 00001017 FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 52154                                  
 52155                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52156                                  	;;;
 52157 0000101B FE0E[C011]              	dec	byte [INDOS_FLAG]
 52158                                  	;;;
 52159                                  
 52160 0000101F 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 52161 00001023 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 52162 00001027 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 52163                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 52164 00001029 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 52165                                  	
 52166                                  ; 25/03/2024
 52167                                  %if 0
 52168                                  	mov	AX,[NSP]
 52169                                  	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 52170                                  	mov	AX,[NSS]
 52171                                  	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 52172                                  %else
 52173                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52174                                  	;;;
 52175                                  	;les	ax, dword ptr ds:NSS
 52176 0000102C C406[F005]              	les	ax,[NSS]
 52177 00001030 8C06[8405]              	mov	[USER_SP],es
 52178 00001034 A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],ax
 52179                                  	;;;
 52180                                  %endif
 52181 00001037 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 52182 00001038 5B                      	pop	BX
 52183 00001039 59                      	pop	CX
 52184 0000103A 5A                      	pop	DX
 52185 0000103B 5E                      	pop	SI
 52186 0000103C 5F                      	pop	DI
 52187 0000103D 5D                      	pop	BP
 52188 0000103E 1F                      	pop	DS
 52189 0000103F 07                      	pop	ES
 52190                                  lirett:		; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52191 00001040 CF                      	iret
 52192                                  
 52193                                  ;**************************************************************************
 52194                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line
 52195                                  ;
 52196                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in
 52197                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 52198                                  ;
 52199                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA
 52200                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled
 52201                                  ;	USES	NOTHING
 52202                                  ;
 52203                                  ;**************************************************************************
 52204                                  
 52205                                  XMMDisableA20:
 52206 00001041 53                      	push	bx
 52207 00001042 50                      	push	ax
 52208                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 52209 00001043 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 52210 00001045 2EFF1E[4D10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 52211 0000104A 58                      	pop	ax
 52212 0000104B 5B                      	pop	bx
 52213 0000104C C3                      	retn
 52214                                  
 52215                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 52216                                  
 52217                                  XMMcontrol:
 52218 0000104D 00000000                	dd	0
 52219                                  
 52220                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52221                                  ; 24/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52222                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:107Fh
 52223                                  ;;;
 52224 00001051 00000000                	dd	0
 52225                                  SC_STATUS:
 52226 00001055 0000                    	dw	0
 52227                                  ;;;
 52228                                  
 52229                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52230                                  ;
 52231                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 52232                                  ;
 52233                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in
 52234                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 52235                                  ;
 52236                                  ;	ENTRY: none
 52237                                  ;
 52238                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 52239                                  ;		
 52240                                  ; 	USES : NONE
 52241                                  ;
 52242                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52243                                  
 52244                                  ; 19/09/2023
 52245                                  ;LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 52246                                  ;	dw	00080h
 52247                                  ;	dw	00000h
 52248                                  ;
 52249                                  ;HighMemory:	; label dword
 52250                                  ;	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 52251                                  ;	dw	0FFFFh
 52252                                  
 52253                                  	; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52254                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1085h
 52255                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:116Fh)
 52256                                  
 52257                                  EnsureA20ON:
 52258 00001057 9C                      	pushf
 52259 00001058 1E                      	push    ds
 52260 00001059 06                      	push	es
 52261 0000105A 51                      	push	cx
 52262 0000105B 56                      	push	si
 52263 0000105C 57                      	push	di
 52264                                  
 52265                                  	; 19/09/2023
 52266                                  	;lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 52267                                  	;les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 52268                                  
 52269                                  	; 25/03/2024 
 52270                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 52271                                  	;;;
 52272 0000105D 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 52273 0000105F 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 52274 00001061 4E                      	dec	si
 52275 00001062 BF9000                  	mov	di,90h	; 0FFFFh:0090h	; HighMemory
 52276 00001065 8EC6                    	mov	es,si
 52277 00001067 BE8000                  	mov	si,80h	; 0000h:0080h	; LowMemory
 52278                                  	;;;	
 52279                                  
 52280 0000106A B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 52281 0000106D FC                      	cld
 52282 0000106E F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 52283                                  
 52284 00001070 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 52285                                  EA20_RET:
 52286 00001072 5F                      	pop	di
 52287 00001073 5E                      	pop	si
 52288 00001074 59                      	pop	cx
 52289 00001075 07                      	pop	es
 52290 00001076 1F                      	pop	ds
 52291 00001077 9D                      	popf
 52292 00001078 C3                      	retn
 52293                                  
 52294                                  EA20_OFF:
 52295                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 52296                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 52297                                  
 52298 00001079 53                      	push	bx
 52299 0000107A 50                      	push	ax
 52300                                  
 52301                                  ; 25/03/2024
 52302                                  %if 0
 52303                                  	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 52304                                  	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 52305                                  	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 52306                                  	mov	ax,cs
 52307                                  	mov	ss,ax
 52308                                  %else
 52309                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52310                                  	;;;
 52311 0000107B 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 52312 0000107D 2E8C16[6C0F]            	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ss
 52313 00001082 2E8926[6E0F]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 52314 00001087 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 52315                                  	;;;
 52316                                  %endif
 52317 00001089 BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 52318                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 52319                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 52320 0000108C B405                    	mov	ah,5
 52321 0000108E 2EFF1E[4D10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 52322 00001093 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 52323 00001095 740E                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 52324                                  
 52325                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 52326                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 52327                                  	;  25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52328                                  	;;;
 52329 00001097 2E8E16[6C0F]            	mov	ss,[cs:SS_Save]
 52330                                  	;;;
 52331 0000109C 2E8B26[6E0F]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 52332                                  
 52333 000010A1 58                      	pop	ax
 52334 000010A2 5B                      	pop	bx
 52335                                  
 52336 000010A3 EBCD                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 52337                                  
 52338                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 52339 000010A5 B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 52340 000010A7 CD10                    	int	10h
 52341 000010A9 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 52342 000010AB 7405                    	je	short XMMcont		; Y: do not change mode
 52343                                  	;xor	ah,ah ; 0		; set video mode
 52344                                  	;mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 52345                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52346                                  	;;;
 52347 000010AD B80200                  	mov     ax,2
 52348                                  	;;;
 52349 000010B0 CD10                    	int	10h
 52350                                  XMMcont:
 52351                                  	;mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 52352                                  	;xor	al,al			; page 0
 52353                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52354                                  	;;;
 52355 000010B2 B80005                  	mov     ax,500h
 52356                                  	;;;
 52357 000010B5 CD10                    	int	10h
 52358                                  	
 52359 000010B7 BE[1911]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 52360 000010BA 0E                      	push	cs
 52361 000010BB 1F                      	pop	ds
 52362 000010BC FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 52363                                  XMMprnt:
 52364 000010BD AC                      	lodsb
 52365 000010BE 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 52366 000010C0 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh
 52367 000010C2 B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
 52368 000010C4 BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 52369 000010C7 CD10                    	int	10h
 52370 000010C9 EBF2                    	jmp	short XMMprnt
 52371                                  
 52372                                  XMMStall:
 52373 000010CB FB                      	sti				; allow the user to warm boot
 52374 000010CC EBFD                    	jmp	short XMMStall		; M006 - End
 52375

 52545                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 52546                                  
 52547                                  ; DOSDATA:12CFh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 52548                                  
 52549                                  ; Retro DOS v5.0
 52550                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1180h
 52551                                  
 52552                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 52553                                  ; DOSDATA:12CFh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 52554                                  
 52555                                  ; first and second DOS patches
 52556                                  ;	Non-console device read/write (system calls 3Fh and 40h)
 52557                                  ;
 52558                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 2 locations, one for read, one for write
 52559                                  ;	DVRDLP:
 52560                                  ;	DVWRTLP:
 52561                                  ;
 52562                                  ;
 52563                                  ; 036h	lds	si,SS:[????]				  ; ThisSFT
 52564                                  ;	lds	si,si+7 				  ; sf_devptr
 52565                                  ; 0E8h	call	????		<- "simulate" int28 event ; DSKSTATCHK
 52566                                  
 52567                                  DOSP1_ID:	db	036h,0C5h,036h
 52568                                  DOSP1_THISSFT:	db	036h,005h,0C5h,074h,007h,0E8h
 52569                                  DOSP1_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP1_ID
 52570                                  
 52571                                  		db	90h, 90h
 52572                                  
 52573                                  DOSP12_ID:	db	036h,0C5h,036h
 52574                                  DOSP12_THISSFT:	db	036h,005h,0C5h,074h,007h,0E8h
 52575                                  DOSP12_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP1_ID
 52576                                  
 52577                                  ; DOSDATA:12E3h
 52578                                  
 52579                                  ; Third/Fourth DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) from console
 52580                                  ;
 52581                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 1 location
 52582                                  ;	GETBUF:
 52583                                  ;
 52584                                  ; 051h	push	cx	<- begin special int28 mode
 52585                                  ;	push	es
 52586                                  ;	push	di
 52587                                  ;	mov	dx,???? ; offset dosgroup:CONBUF
 52588                                  ;	call	????	; $STD_CON_STRING_INPUT
 52589                                  ;	pop	di
 52590                                  ;	pop	es
 52591                                  ; 059h	pop	cx	<- end special int28 mode
 52592                                  
 52593                                  DOSP3_ID:	db	051h,006h,057h,0BAh
 52594                                  DOSP3_CONBUF:	db	029h,002h,0E8h
 52595                                  DOSP3_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP3_ID
 52596                                  		db	09Ah,0E3h,05Fh,007h	; ???? , pop di, pop es
 52597                                  DOSP4_ID:	db	059h			; pop cx
 52598                                  DOSP4_ID_OFF	equ	(DOSP4_ID - DOSP3_ID)
 52599                                  	
 52600                                  ; DOSDATA:12EFh
 52601                                  
 52602                                  ; Fifth DOS patch - System call 40h (Write) to console
 52603                                  ;
 52604                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 1 location
 52605                                  ;
 52606                                  ;		push	cx
 52607                                  ;      WRCONLP: lodsb
 52608                                  ;		cmp	al,1Ah
 52609                                  ;		jz	????
 52610                                  ;		call	????	<- "simulate" int28 event
 52611                                  ;		loop	WRCONLP
 52612                                  ;      CONEOF:	pop	ax
 52613                                  
 52614                                  DOSP5_ID:	db	051h			; push cx
 52615                                  		db	0ACh,03Ch,01Ah,074h,005h
 52616                                  		db	0E8h			; call
 52617                                  DOSP5_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP5_ID
 52618                                  
 52619                                  ; DOSDATA:12F6h
 52620                                  
 52621                                  ; Seventh DOS patch - System call entry, patch USER_ID with VMid for share
 52622                                  ;
 52623                                  ; Code in disp.asm, 1 location
 52624                                  ;
 52625                                  ;
 52626                                  ;	mov [SaveDS],ds
 52627                                  ;	mov [SaveBX],bx
 52628                                  ;	mov bx,cs
 52629                                  ;	mov ds,bx
 52630                                  ;	inc [indos]
 52631                                  ;	xor ax,ax
 52632                                  ;	mov [USER_ID],AX	<- Patch to set USER_ID to VMID
 52633                                  
 52634                                  DOSP7_ID:	db	02Eh,08Ch,01Eh
 52635                                  DOSP7_SAVEDS:	db	07Eh,05h		; mov [SaveDS],ds
 52636                                  		db	02Eh,089h,01Eh
 52637                                  DOSP7_SAVEBX:	db	07Ch,05h		; mov [SaveBX],bx
 52638                                  		db	08Ch,0CBh		; mov bx,cs
 52639                                  		db	08Eh,0DBh		; mov ds,bx
 52640                                  		db	0FEh,006h
 52641                                  DOSP7_INDOS:	db	0CFh,002h		; inc [indos]
 52642                                  		db	033h,0C0h		; xor ax,ax
 52643                                  DOSP7_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP7_ID
 52644                                  
 52645                                  ; DOSDATA:130Ah
 52646                                  
 52647                                  ; Eighth DOS patch - OWNER check in handle calls. For share, need to NOP test
 52648                                  ;
 52649                                  ; Code in handle.asm, 1 location in routine CheckOwner
 52650                                  ;
 52651                                  ;
 52652                                  ;
 52653                                  ;	push	ax
 52654                                  ;	mov	ax,ss:[USER_ID]     <- patch to XOR AX,AX to set zero
 52655                                  ;	cmp	ax,es:[di.sf_UID]   <- NOP
 52656                                  ;	pop	ax
 52657                                  ;	jz	????
 52658                                  
 52659                                  DOSP8_ID:	db	050h			; push ax
 52660                                  		db	036h,0A1h
 52661                                  DOSP8_USER_ID:	db	0EAh,002h		; mov  ax,ss:[USER_ID]
 52662                                  		db	026h,03Bh,045h		; cmp  ax,es:[di+2F]
 52663                                  DOSP8_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP8_ID
 52664                                  		db	02Fh,058h		; pop  ax
 52665                                  
 52666                                  ; DOSDATA:1314h
 52667                                  
 52668                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 52669                                  ;
 52670                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 52671                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.
 52672                                  ;
 52673                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 3 locations
 52674                                  ;
 52675                                  ;   DVRDRAW:
 52676                                  ;	    PUSH    ES
 52677                                  ;	    POP     DS
 52678                                  ;   ReadRawRetry:				<- Patch 10
 52679                                  ;	    MOV     BX,DI
 52680                                  ;	    XOR     AX,AX			<- Reenter #2
 52681                                  ;	    MOV     DX,AX
 52682                                  ;	    call    SETREAD
 52683                                  ;	    PUSH    DS				<- Reenter #1
 52684                                  ;	    LDS     SI,[THISSFT]
 52685                                  ;	    call    DEVIOCALL
 52686                                  ;	    MOV     DX,DI
 52687                                  ;	    MOV     AH,86H
 52688                                  ;	    MOV     DI,[DEVCALL.REQSTAT]
 52689                                  ;	    TEST    DI,STERR
 52690                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 52691                                  ;	    call    CHARHARD
 52692                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 52693                                  ;	    OR	    AL,AL
 52694                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 52695                                  ;	    CMP     AL,3
 52696                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDFERR
 52697                                  ;	    POP     DS
 52698                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry
 52699                                  ;
 52700                                  ;   CRDFERR:
 52701                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 11
 52702                                  ;   DEVIOFERR:
 52703                                  ;	    LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 52704                                  ;	    jmp     SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 52705                                  ;
 52706                                  ;   CRDROK:
 52707                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 12
 52708                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 52709                                  ;	    ADD     DI,[CALLSCNT]
 52710                                  ;	    JMP     SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 52711                                  
 52712                                  DOSP10_ID:		db	006H,01FH
 52713                                  DOSP10_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52714                                  DOSP10_LOC:		db	08BH,0DFH
 52715                                  DOSP10_REENT2_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52716                                  			db	033H,0C0H,08BH,0D0H,0E8H
 52717                                  DOSP10_ID_LEN		equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52718                                  			db	0DFH,00EH
 52719                                  DOSP10_REENT1_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52720                                  			db	01EH,036H,0C5H,036H,036H,005H,0E8H,0AFH,00EH
 52721                                  			db	08BH,0D7H,0B4H,086H,036H,08BH,03EH
 52722                                  DOSP10_PACKVAL_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52723                                  			db	009H,003H
 52724                                  			db	0F7H,0C7H,000H,080H,074H,019H,0E8H,047H,017H
 52725                                  			db	08BH,0FAH,00AH,0C0H,074H,010H,03CH,003H,074H,003H
 52726                                  			db	01FH,0EBH,0CFH
 52727                                  DOSP11_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52728                                  			db	05FH
 52729                                  DOSP11_REENT_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52730                                  			db	036H,0C4H,03EH,036H,005H,0E9H,0A1H,004H
 52731                                  
 52732                                  DOSP12_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52733                                  			db	05FH,08BH,0FAH
 52734                                  ; DOSDATA:1353h
 52735                                  
 52736                                  ; 13th DOS patch - Actually a SYSINIT patch. Patches the stack fault code
 52737                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.
 52738                                  ;
 52739                                  ;	    Sets focus to current VM so user can see fatal message.
 52740                                  ;
 52741                                  ;
 52742                                  ;	l0: lodsb		<- Setfocus here
 52743                                  ;	    cmp al, '$'
 52744                                  ;	    je l1
 52745                                  ;	    mov bl, 7
 52746                                  ;	    mov ah, 0Eh
 52747                                  ;	    int 10h
 52748                                  ;	    jmp l0
 52749                                  ;	l1: jmp $
 52750                                  
 52751                                  DOSP13_ID:	db	0ACh			; l0: lodsb
 52752                                  		db	03Ch,024h		;     cmp al, '$'
 52753                                  		db	074h,008h		;     je l1
 52754                                  		db	0B3h,007h		;     mov bl, 7
 52755                                  		db	0B4h,00Eh		;     mov ah, 0Eh
 52756                                  		db	0CDh,010h		;     int 10h
 52757                                  		db	0EBh,0F3h		;     jmp l0
 52758                                  		db	0EBh,0FEh		; l1: jmp $
 52759                                  DOSP13_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP13_ID
 52760                                  
 52761                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 52762                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 52763                                  
 52764                                  ; 05/01/2024
 52765                                  %endif	; 05/11/2022

 52814                                  ;############################################################################
 52815                                  ;
 52816                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 52817                                  ;
 52818                                  ; The dos 4.X redir requires that country_cdpg is at offset 0122ah. Any new
 52819                                  ; data variable that is to be added to DOSDATA must go in between Mark3
 52820                                  ; COUNTRY_CDPG if it can. 
 52821                                  ;
 52822                                  ; MARK3 SHOULD NOT BE > 122AH 
 52823                                  ;
 52824                                  ; As of 9/6/90, this area is FULL!
 52825                                  ;
 52826                                  ;############################################################################
 52827                                   
 52828                                  	;ORG	0122Ah
 52829                                  
 52830                                  ; DOSDATA:122Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 52831                                  
 52832                                  ; 09/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52833                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52834                                  
 52835                                  ; 17/01/2024
 52836                                  ; MSDOS 5.0  MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52837                                  ; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52838                                  ; 09/03/2024
 52839                                  ; Windows ME    IO.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52840                                  
 52841                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 52842                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.
 52843                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCountry is 1 (USA).
 52844                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.
 52845                                  
 52846                                  ; country and code page information
 52847                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52848                                  COUNTRY_CDPG:	; label  byte
 52849 00001132 0000000000000000        	db   0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0		; reserved words
 52850 0000113A 5C434F554E5452592E-     	db   '\COUNTRY.SYS',0		; path name of country.sys
 52850 00001143 53595300           
 52851                                  	;db   51 dup (?)
 52852 00001147 00<rep 33h>             	times 51 db 0
 52853                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 52854                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 52855                                  ;  ifdef JAPAN
 52856                                  ;	dw   932			; system code page id (JAPAN)
 52857                                  ;  endif
 52858                                  ;  ifdef TAIWAN
 52859                                  ;	dw   938			; system code page id (TAIWAN)
 52860                                  ;  endif
 52861                                  ;  ifdef KOREA
 52862                                  ;	dw   934			; system code page id (KOREA IBM)
 52863                                  ;  endif
 52864                                  ;else
 52865 0000117A B501                    	dw   437			; system code page id
 52866                                  ;endif
 52867                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 52868 0000117C 0600                    	dw   6				; number of entries
 52869                                  COUNTRY_CDPG_76: ; COUNTRY_CDPG + 76 
 52870 0000117E 02                      	db   SetUcase  ; 2		; Ucase type
 52871 0000117F [FA0A]                  	dw   UCASE_TAB			;pointer to upper case table
 52872 00001181 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52873 00001183 04                      	db   SetUcaseFile  ; 4		; Ucase file char type
 52874 00001184 [7C0B]                  	dw   FILE_UCASE_TAB 		;pointer to file upper case table
 52875 00001186 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52876 00001188 05                      	db   SetFileList ; 5		; valid file chars type
 52877 00001189 [280D]                  	dw   FILE_CHAR_TAB 		;pointer to valid file char tab
 52878 0000118B 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52879 0000118D 06                      	db   SetCollate	; 6		; collate type
 52880 0000118E [FE0B]                  	dw   COLLATE_TAB		;pointer to collate table
 52881 00001190 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52882 00001192 07                      	db   SetDBCS	; 7		;AN000; DBCS Ev			2/12/KK
 52883 00001193 [000D]                  	dw   DBCS_TAB			;AN000;pointer to DBCS Ev table	2/12/KK
 52884 00001195 0000                    	dw   0				;AN000; segment of pointer	2/12/KK
 52885 00001197 01                      	db   SetCountryInfo  ; 1	; country info type
 52886 00001198 2600                    	dw   NEW_COUNTRY_SIZE		; extended country info size
 52887                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 52888                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 52889                                  ;	......
 52890                                  ;else
 52891                                  	; 09/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52892                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1292h
 52893                                  _COUNTRY_ID:
 52894 0000119A 0100                    	dw   1				; USA country id
 52895 0000119C B501                    	dw   437			; USA system code page id
 52896                                  COUNTRY_CDPG_108: ; COUNTRY_CDPG + 108	
 52897 0000119E 0000                    	dw   0 				; date format
 52898 000011A0 2400000000              	db   '$',0,0,0,0		; currency symbol
 52899 000011A5 2C00                    	db   ',',0			; thousand separator
 52900 000011A7 2E00                    	db   '.',0			; decimal separator
 52901 000011A9 2D00                    	db   '-',0			; date separator
 52902 000011AB 3A00                    	db   ':',0			; time separator
 52903 000011AD 00                      	db   0				; currency format flag
 52904 000011AE 02                      	db   2				; # of digits in currency
 52905 000011AF 00                      	db   0 				; time format
 52906 000011B0 [6B0D]                  	dw   MAP_CASE			; mono case routine entry point
 52907 000011B2 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of entry point
 52908 000011B4 2C00                    	db   ',',0			; data list separator
 52909 000011B6 000000000000000000-     	dw   0,0,0,0,0			; reserved
 52909 000011BF 00                 
 52910                                  ;endif
 52911                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------

 53000                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 53001                                  ;============================================================================
 53002                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 53003                                  
 53004                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 53005                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 53006                                  ;
 53007                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 53008                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 53009                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 53010                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 53011                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 53012                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 53013                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 53014                                  ; to call out here.
 53015                                  ;
 53016                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 53017                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 53018                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 53019                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 53020                                  ;
 53021                                  ;history	-	created 8-7-92 by scottq
 53022                                  ;		-	added Rational386PatchPtr 2-1-93 by jimmat
 53023                                  ;
 53024                                  ;Exported Functions
 53025                                  ;==================
 53026                                  ;MagicPatch     -       callout patched by magidrv.sys for cluster allocations
 53027                                  
 53028                                  ; DosData Segment
 53029                                  
 53030                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 53031                                  
 53032                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53033                                  
 53034                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 53035                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 53036                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 53037                                  ; 'patch' related.
 53038                                  
 53039                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 53040 00001246 0000                    	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 53041                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53042                                  
 53043                                  ; 25/03/2024
 53044                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1340h
 53045                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - DOSDATA:133Eh)
 53046                                  
 53047                                  ; 07/03/2025
 53048                                  %if 0
 53049                                  MagicPatch:
 53050                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 53051                                          retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 53052                                          nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 53053                                          nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 53054                                          nop             ; call far ?:?     
 53055                                          nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 53056                                          nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 53057                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 53058                                  ;MagicPatch endp
 53059                                  %endif
 53060                                  
 53061                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53062                                  
 53063                                  ;DosData Ends
 53064                                  
 53065                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:136Ah
 53066                                  ;
 53067                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 53068                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1346h
 53069                                  
 53070                                  ;; Windows ME IO.SYS
 53071                                  ;; db 12 dup(0)
 53072                                  
 53073                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - DOSDATA:1344h)
 53074                                  
 53075                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53076                                  
 53077                                  ;DOSDATALAST SEGMENT
 53078                                  
 53079                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 53080                                  
 53081                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53082                                  ; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 Modification (paragraph alignment)
 53083                                  
 53084                                  ;db 0,1,12,64,19,0 ; ! Magic numbers !
 53085                                  
 53086                                  ;align 16
 53087                                  
 53088                                  ; !!! DOSDATA:1370h ; Retro DOS v4.0 only!
 53089                                  
 53090                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53091                                  
 53092                                  ; 05/01/2024
 53093                                  ;%endif	; 05/11/2022
 53094                                  
 53095                                  ; 05/12/2022
 53096                                  ;MSDAT001E:	; label byte
 53097                                  
 53098                                  ; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 53099                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 53100                                  DOSDATAEND equ $
 53101                                  DOSDATASIZE equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4962 for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 53102                                  					; = 4970 for MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS
 53103                                  MSDAT001E equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4934 for PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 53104                                  					; (= 4944 for Windows ME IO.SYS)
 53105                                  ;DOSDATALAST ENDS
